description:
Oh my! This was a great place! There are quite a few other Italian places in the same street.  We went to Sodini's in a recommendation. Did not disappoint! I had the gnocchi with Gorgonzola cream sauce. The gnocchi are not made there but the absolute best I've ever had. Pillowy and light not dense. We also had the ravioli with meat sauce and it was perfect. Our waitress was no muss no fuss, perfect for an Italian meal! 

The atmosphere is perfectly Italian. Rat Pack images, old family photos.
author: Christina S.

description:
We saw this quaint little place in a previous visit to San Francisco and went in for a drink. It was packed and the food looked amazing. We read reviews and were quite surprised by some of them. Saying the staff was rude, and the host ignored them. 

We walked in, asked for a table and were seated in five minutes by one of the brothers who own the restaurant. He was very nice, matching wit and humor with ours. Our waitress, Erin Callahan rounded the corner in another two minutes with water and menus. She made great recommendations and threw in an order of garlic bread, which was hot and delicious. The meal of linguini and meatballs was exactly what we wanted and very good. Erin even brought us a side of the sauce because she though we'd like it to dip the garlic bread in. We also ordered the polenta that was also fabulous and all of it hot.

My only dig would be the food came too quickly so we didn't have much of a chance to absorb the ambiance!
author: Donna T.

description:
The ravioli was really fresh here. The meatballs were also amazing and tastes home cooked by somebody's mother! Service was great - our waitress was lively and very upbeat. I was offered a free drink since it was birthday and that made my day. I don't think this was the restaurant's official policy but generosity on the behalf of our very sweet waitress. I made sure to tip her well for her hospitality. I ordered Linguini with a cream sauce and mushrooms which was delicious! I also sampled a vegetarian tortellini and one with beef. Both were good.

With so many Italian food options in North Beach it's often hard to decide which one to choose. I'll give credit to my daughter for suggesting this place since she had been there before. It was a great suggestion and I would definitely return.
author: John S.

description:
This a great little place in North Beach area.  The restaurant has a nostalgic feel of a typical Italian joint.  The have old pictures on the wall.  It has a full bar and the owner greets everyone at the door and does the seating.  The wait staff is great and are friendly.  The menu is pretty simple and looks like all is made in house when ordered.  

Cary R had the lasagna but felt it was a little light on the meat.  I had the seafood over linguine.  Pasta was cooked just a tad bit over al dente and the seafood was cooked perfectly but the sauce was lacking seasoning- I think the dish was made simple and I had higher expectations along the lines of a fra diavolo.  Either way the place is great and busy, I would go back to try some other dishes.
author: Jay O.

description:
So many restaurants to choose from with amazing ratings we decided due to me to dine here. The lasagna pictures is what made me pick this restaurant. I was expecting an amazing meal! Unfortunately it fell flat. Perhaps my expectations were to high? Idk. 

To start it was so crowded another positive sign! Staff was amazing! Our waitress was a sweetheart. We skipped apps as we wanted to enjoy our entree. 

My fiancé ordered their seafood pasta and I ordered their lasagna. To start the lasagna wasn't bad but it wasn't amazing. I believe they use a meat sauce but there was no meat to be found. I loved that there was plenty of cheese and ricotta but I needed some meat to cut in between bites. I was pretty disappointed. I tried my fiancée seafood pasta in a light cream sauce and I found it to be a bit bland. He said it was good but both for me lacked some flavor. I will say this at least the ambience and service was amazing!!!
author: Cary R.

description:
Older than 110 and still going strong!

Isn't that impressive?! Come on, it must make you go "WOW" in this day and age when many family owned businesses in San Francisco, and other big cities, don't last more than a couple of leases.

Sodini's used to be called "Green Valley Restaurant" before the Sodini brothers bought the place more than 25 years ago. They changed the name (just a little bit), the decor and the menu and "Sodini's Green Valley Restaurant" was born. 

I started going to Sodini's about 20 years ago, so I can't tell you what the place was like before the Sodini brothers took over, but I can tell you that what you have now is wonderful. When you enter the place the first thing you'll see is the bar which by the way is a great place to sit, have a drink and even order a meal. To your left you'll see the main dining area. Before you know it someone will greet you and ask you how many you are. If you are going there on a Friday or Saturday night the chances are you will have to wait about 15 minutes or more. But it is worth it.

The food is mostly Northern Italian cuisine, but you will detect elements of California in there too. The ladies who will serve you are awesome! They may look tough, but they are wonderful. They know the menu and are quick with their jokes. You just need to smile and break the ice.

Oh, and the bartenders are great too. They make awesome cocktails and if you are visiting, they could be a good source of information about the neighborhood.
author: Afshin A.

description: Yes. Yes. And yes. Totally love this place! Very nice vibes. Cool area to walk around. Great customer service. Loved the food. I highly recommend this place. The owner is awesome as we also loved having Aaron serve us!!
author: Avi K.

description:
While North Beach is a beautiful area of SF, having grown up in a Midwestern city with a true "Little Italy" (complete with customers in flashy suits who miraculously get seated before you-even if you've been waiting), I always found the restaurants there lacking that kind of vibe. 

Well, I found my spot in Sodini's. This is the kind of place straight out of Goodfellas. I was expecting to see Paul Sorvino frying sausage and peppers in the back. From the great and professional host to the friendly and fun servers, this place is exactly how an Italian restaurant should be. This "red sauce joint" as Sinatra would put it, serves up terrific southern italian inspired dishes that will make it your new favorite spot in North Beach. 

I had the chicken parmigiana which was rolled thin (as it should be), lightly breaded and served with a side of linguini. Absolutely delicious. My dinner date had angel hair pesto and added prawns. She was also very pleased with her dish. They also have a great selection of wines to compliment your meal.

They don't take reservations but as I stated above, the host was great in securing me a great window table after a minimal wait. He will even take your name and number and call you when your table is ready (in case you want to wait elsewhere). 

Take it from me, if you are from anywhere east of the Mississippi and miss that old school vibe of a true "Little Italy" spot, Sodini's is your place.
author: Jim N.

description:
This is a nice spot to grab a bite in Little Italy! It's your typical little Italian spot, lots of Rat Pack decor and homey vibes. My family and I waited at the bar for our table, and that bartender deserves an award for hospitality! Gosh I wish I could remember her name, but if she's working when you go, you'll know who I'm talking about. She was great conversation and made us out of towners feel right at home.

My husband and I both got the house red wine, and it was just how a house red should taste. For dinner I ordered the angel hair North Beach Style, because when in North Beach, ya know? Unfortunately it was pretty disappointing. The pasta was cooked fine, but the sauce was much too watery for my taste. However, my husband's parents got the pizza, and man, I wish I would have, too. It was so yummy and the crust was nice and crispy.  

Great hospitality here, and the pizza made up for the poor pasta sauce. I'd definitely go back for the pizza!
author: Brianna N.

description:
This is the best home style family italian restaurant in all of San Francisco. 

I have had almost everything on the menu, since I go way too much. My favorite has to be the lasagna or the chicken parm for an entree. Bruschetta and house salad as an app. 

The wait is super long if you go during peak times, but it is worth it. Put your name down on a table and then walk about 50ft down the block to Gino and Carlos and have a cocktail/play some pool while you're waiting for Sodini's to text you that your table is ready. 

This is one of the last San Francisco restaurants with a legitimate down home Italian family feel to it. Never once has Sodini's been empty, even within 5 minutes of opening they are packed. 

For visitors who want the traditional SF experience in north beach or locals, Sodini's is the place.
author: Michael P.

description: Reasonably priced, good ol' Italian comfort food in a cozy spot in North Beach! Our out of town Italian friends asked to go here because it's one of their favorite Italian restaurants and we've also bumped into local friends drinking limoncello here before. We were here on a Sunday night at about 8:45pm and there were still many tables. We had to wait for a table for five and we gladly had drinks at the bar talkingto the patrons. My Dirty Martini was delish and I had another at dinner! The bartender is always really friendly when we're waiting for a table and she's very entertaining. She's been there for years, I think something like 20+. My husband really enjoyed the Chicken Parmesan. The chicken was pounded and so tender, you can fork it. My friends liked the Gnocchi with a creme sauce, Apollo loved the Spaghetti that came with my entree, and I very much enjoyed the Veal Marsala. They served a pretty hefty portion. The service is great here, with very friendly and attentive staff. It's a fairly small place so you can enjoy family meals and hear each other talk or have an intimate dinner.
author: Jen L.

description: Came Labor Day weekend. All the places we wanted to go were packed and waits were long.So we ended up here . We didn't have to wait long for a table . Place was packed.  I ordered the lasagna because of reviews. It was ok . Didn't blow me away but still tasty . Had a cup of the minestrone soup . That was quite delicious. Kids split a order of spaghetti and meatballs and enjoyed it . We ordered garlic cheese bread right away. I was hoping it came out with the soup but it did not. It actually came after our dinner which was weird timing . We were just about to cancel the order and it showed up . Not happy that they didn't have a kids menu. So many places in sf have amazing kids menus. When you have kids it's important.It's what I look for when picking a restaurant. So not sure if I will be coming back.
author: Nichole S.

description:
I was looking for a place with both Caprese salad and baked pasta with no meat. I found Sodinis has both! 
I was traveling alone so when I got there they let me pick my seat. I sat in the corner overlooking the room. 
The waitress was wonderful. Chatty enough that I was happy for some conversation (the worst part of traveling alone is the lack of eel conversation.) but not so much that it was annoying. She was very attentive and brought the Caprese out quickly. 
I've had lots of Caprese salads and this one was one of the best! Lots of basil. The mozzarella was so good. And they add red onion to it just like I do at home! It was divine. 
I got the . Penne Al Forno It was okay. Nothing special, but it may have just been because the Caprese was so good! 
I drink lots of water with my meal and I have always said that I judge the service by whether or not I sit at the table waiting for more water. There was a fellow working who kept my glass filled. Even when the restaurant got pretty busy. 
It was a great first meal in San Francisco.
author: Jenny P.

description:
Gnocchi with pesto sauce!!!!! These pillows of heaven are stuffed with spinach and ricotta and taste like little tortellini or ravioli rather than the usual gnocchi, but with an even better chewy texture. I have never had gnocchi like this, and if you also have not, you need to ASAP. Their sourdough bread they start you with is also delicious.  

We got the steamers with clams and mussels, and while the sauce is delicious, the clams and mussels themselves are very small and not worth it. 

Dark cozy restaurant. We got a nice corner booth with little curtains, it was super cozy and still had a festive feeling from the holidays.  Service was great, they were very attentive and helpful.
author: Susan W.

description:
Since it was our last night in San Francisco, I felt it would be fitting to have Italian as our last meal in town. I noticed several small Italian restaurants while we were walking through North Beach, so I checked a few out on Yelp.

I came across Sodini's and it looked like my kind of place. I am so glad we chose to have dinner here on our last night in San Francisco. We arrived around 7ish and the wait was about 45 minutes for the 3 of us. Sodini's is a great place to go just to people watch. Young, old, Italian, non-Italian, locals, tourists, etc. all come through the door. Mark, the host/owner was funny and very welcoming. 

Sodini's is my vision of how an Italian restaurant in North Beach would be. Small, dark, old school wood bar and actually owned by an Italian. That being said, let's get to the food. When we were seated, Mark told us one of the specials was Gnocchi (Imported from Italy) in a Gorgonzola cream sauce. Needless to say, I was sold. Unfortunately, I don't recall what my wife and daughter had. Just goes to show you how good the Gnocchi was. So good, I couldn't recall anything else that was on the table. The Gnocchi was incredible. Tiny little pillows of heaven that deflated in your mouth. They were not chewie, as most Gnocchi tend to be. I love Gorgonzola and to have it in a cream sauce is heaven for me. Calories be damned! I actually finished the plate. The Gnocchi was so good that my wife and daughter both said they should have ordered it. 

Overall, Sodini's was a great experience for our last night in San Francisco. As for getting there, we were staying at the Mark Hopkins and walked to Sodini's. There was street parking (not free), but why would you drive when you can walk in San Francisco, right?
author: Bill S.

description:
The owner planted himself on the booth seat right next to the woman on the right and proceeded to call her "not a woman - a girl" before launching into one of the more unfortunately bigoted rants I've ever had the displeasure of being witness to. He started, for some inexplicable reason, expounding very loudly on his thoughts about how gay people have started to go too far. He brought up, for instance, someone's child who has gotten so gay they now identify as trans and have the audacity to want to be cheerleader. This man then went on a tear about how this child was trying to get special treatment and described in alarming detail how this child wore sheer clothing - how exactly does this man know anything about this person's life??? The woman sitting next to him also for some inexplicable reason was agreeing with him and declaiming how if someone wanted to be a woman they should have the same rules apply. Ah. I see. 

The waitress was lovely and gave excellent recommendations for the menu but, sadly, I wanted to vomit after the astoundingly lengthy,
bigoted tirade I was forced to listen to. You would think the proprietor of a restaurant would have slightly better sense than to very visibly display his retrograde views on gender and sexuality on a busy Saturday night. 

I'd give negative points if possible.**

**except for the waitress who was lovely
author: S C.

description: Perfecto perfecto! Their Meatballs are fucking amazing with angel hair pasta. Paired it up with a nice bottle of red.
author: Thien T.

description: I came here yrs ago and loved the cozy Italian decor, but couldn't recall the name. I just remembered the vicinity of location. So one night im strong around.. and wpd u believe I found it. So I hang to stay for dinner. It eased chilly late... but I wanted to sit outdoors. Owner or manager waitress .did not make us feel rushed even though I knew it was probably close to closing time. Super accommodating. With the heating lamps on, makes it cozy. Great meal wine and people watching.. I was content. Made me sp happy that everything I remembered was still the same. Hope you enjoy.
author: TJ S.

description: It's a good thing I don't live in the city because I would eat here everyday! I had the penne al forno and it was delicious! Our wait was long, almost an hour on a Sunday night. Service was a touch slow but it was worth it for the delicious food. I would recommend this to anyone looking for some delicious Italian food in North Beach.
author: Brittany S.

description:
I've been going there for years, but this is the first time I've written a review.  Whenever I'm in North Beach looking for good, old-fashioned Italian food, I stop by Sodini's first.  It's a very popular place and the wait time is usually 30-45 minutes.  This is typical for the area and should be factored in if you or your party are starving.  I will say it is worth the wait.

I told my friend about this place and she was interested in trying it.  She doesn't know the city that well so it was also an opportunity to explore the neighborhood.  As a native San Franciscan (born & raised) who lives outside the city for some time now, it's a treat go back.  The area is so rich in history and culture and I miss it so much.

We arrived there a little after 6:00 pm and was told by the hostess that there was a 30-45 minute.  As mentioned by other reviewers, she took a mobile phone number and told us she call when our table was ready.  I suggested we walk around my old stomping ground and maybe try to find a bar that wasn't too crowded.  It also gave me the chance to play tour guide.  As luck would have it, the hostess called back in 10 minutes saying she could seat us. 

What I love about Sodini's is the neighborhood feel and lack of pretension.  It's not trying to be anything but great, little restaurant.  What I love most is the food.  It succeeds on both counts.  You can tell if the food is going to be good or not by how the place smells.  Immediately, you smell the garlic with a hint of tomato sauce and you know it's going to good.  The place was packed, which was also a good sign.

We were sat right away and after a few minutes our server introduced herself and took our drink orders (my friend had a lemon drop & I had a pint of Anchor Steam).  While enjoying our drinks and reviewing the menu, I scanned the meals being enjoyed by the other patrons and everything looked so good.  I chose a very decadent Tortellini Carbonara.  This is one of my favorite Italian dishes--although I try to order it infrequently--and I hadn't had theirs in years.  Without a doubt, this one of the best I've every tried.  Carbonara sauce can be tricky because it's just the right combination of egg yolks, cheese, pancetta and black pepper.  Some places have screwed it up by adding non-traditional ingredients to it like bacon and/or sausage (c'mon, man).  Sodini's gets it right using only traditional ingredients.  The tortellini was cooked to perfection; nothing ruins a carbonara like overcooked pasta.  I literally could have eaten two entire plates.

My friend had the Tortellini all Panna and it too was fantastic.  Both of our dishes came with garlic bread and I only wish there was more.  Thankfully, there was a basket of bread.  Yes, it was a carb-explosion.  My god, everything was so good.  We're definitely going back.

Finally, our server (I forget her name) was awesome.  She was knowledgeable and attentive.  We couldn't have asked for more.
author: Rich H.

description: Beat italian in San Francisco, no question. Would strongly encourage anyone to go there if/when they are looking for classic Italian. The chicken parm is amazing. I would start with the calamari. No dessert but after dinner drinks and espresso are perfect as you wont be hungry! Large portions.
author: John C.

description:
We usually stop by North Beach for dinner one of the nights we are in town. Our expectations were to have some classic Italian dishes to load up on some carbs and to be easy on the GI system because we would be running early the next morning. Sodini's met our expectations for food, our server took care of us, and we had some fun hanging out in the bar.

We arrived at the first-come first-serve restaurant around 7 PM on a Saturday night and were quoted a 75 minute wait. The host/owner took my cell phone number and as we looked around we saw some empty seats at the end of the bar with Indians on TV, so we decided to have a seat and wait it out. We actually met and chatted with some other tourists that were from out of town and running the next day also which helped pass the time.

Our wait ended up being one hour and we were sat in the corner booth right next to the window with a view of Green St. The restaurant has a very old school look and feel with very tight quarters for the patrons. It's loud and relaxed enough where everyone isn't boisterously loud screaming over each other but you can see that everyone is having a good time.

Our food was delicious and pretty standard for restaurants in the area, as was the $93 pre-tip tab for three. The calamari wasn't greasy and the squid was not overcooked, but could have used a little salt out of the fryer. My tortellini carbonara had a nice cream sauce with pancetta atop al dente pasta rings. If you're looking for life changing Italian dishes, you won't get them here, but you'll get the classics in a fun environment.
author: Arthur M.

description:
This place doesn't have enough reviews!
After walking in and out of some high-rated Yelp Italian spots, we discovered this little gem.
Price point ON POINT, delicious food, great service. Blaze was our waitress and she was charismatic and delightful. I ordered the lasagna and my husband ordered a Penne dish, both delish. The lasagna melts in your mouth! No lasagna can compare to my mother in law's- and my husband openly admitted that this was the best he's ever had! So happy we found this spot- will be back next time we are in San Francisco!
author: Hannah D.

description: Great small local Italian-been in north beach for years -very good salads -Pesto tortellini, lasagna, ravioli were all delicious. Service was attentive and friendly-highly recommend giving it a try
author: Laura W.

description:
Sodini's Green Valley is a classic neighborhood Italian restaurant. Sodini's is not fancy. It is fun, friendly & funky serving fantastic food. The bar is lively pouring generous drinks while you watch the chefs in the kitchen making magic. 
Servings are generous and many people take a box home for later. I had the linguine with clams. It was the best I've ever had and there was enough for dinner the next night. 
Casual, loud, fun, fantastic & reasonably priced.
Will become a regular when visiting San Francisco.
author: Clair R.

description: love the restuarant ambience! The staff were so friendly and the owner made you feel like you are part of the family! Classic old school italian restaurant. Calamari was light and airy. I ordered the linguine with clams. Fresh clams and delicious cream sauce. Definitely going to be a return customer whenever I am in North Beach!
author: Cristina A.

description:
I'm giving this restaurant three stars because the service and the house salad were fantastic. After reading many reviews we figured we couldn't go wrong, and we were so excited to finally dine at this longstanding restaurant. Our server was wonderful! She was friendly and attentive, and I swear she could read my mind. Without asking she split the first course salad my husband ordered and served half to me. When I told her I hadn't ordered one she said that it was big enough for two and she figured we would split it anyway. Yep! I'm so glad she did that because the salad and the bread were the only things I could eat. I ordered the angel hair pasta with pesto. The pasta was an overcooked watery mess and the pesto was also watery and bland. My husband's pasta was overcooked as well. He did like the sauce and meatballs enough to finish them off, but he was also surprised at the lack of flavor.

If this had been a run of the mill diner, not an Italian restaurant in North Beach, I might be more forgiving. But we drove an hour just to go there for what we thought would be an authentic Italian dining experience. We were very disappointed.
author: Jodi D.

description: We love this place! Great vibe. The last few times we've gone there, my pasta has been a bit more done then I like. Best house salad in SF. My hubby loves the Chicken Marsala.
author: C D.

description: Went here for dinner for my brother's birthday. It is a great restaurant with authentic Italian food. The service was great and the food was really good too. :) Try this place out if you're ever in San Fransisco!
author: Amaneet G.

description:
Pros:
- None

Cons:
- Run-off-the-mill Italian family restaurant. Nothing special or authentic about it.
- Canned Tomate Sauce. Buying the normal cheap sauce in Trader Joe's is better. They probably buy theirs bulk in cans. 
- Nothing special about the pasta
- Worst meatballs ever. Obviously frozen and they bought them at a cheap store. Costco has much better meatballs. 
- Got scammed buying a pitcher of house wine for like 45 bucks. Worst wine ever. I am a wine fan and know when I am buying cheap wine. This was worst. They could buy boxed wine at Trade Joe's for 2.50 and it would be way way better. 
- Service was decent but they never picked up the plates when we were done eating.
author: Alejandro S.

description:
Came here for dinner last night with 4 friends. Immediately we were seated at a table next to the kitchen. Some might complain that it was loud outside the kitchen, but I personally love to see the excitement (stress and chaos) of food preparation. Our server brought us water and bread right away. In addition, there was ample olive oil, vinegar, and red pepper flakes on our table for dipping. 

We ordered a pitcher of the house red wine, which was decent. In addition, I ordered the Seafood Linguine which was packed with calamari and shrimp, there were only a few clams and mussels but the vast amount of calamari made up for it. It was in a light tomato cream sauce that was perfect and came with a large piece of garlic bread. I barely finished half my pasta, and my server packed it up for me to go! In addition, right before we left, I was telling an extremely passionate story and knocked my wine over, instead of the server just cleaning it up, she brought me an entire new glass. WHAT? unheard of. Will definitely be back!
author: Whitney P.

description: Super friendly staff, great atmosphere and great food. We weren't crazy about the meatballs and it took a little while to get our check but, overall, we loved it and would come back anytime. Definitely would recommend!
author: Kat D.

description: Fantastic food, great drinks. If you really want to test the taste try the linguini with meat sauce and meatballs. You will not be disappointed. Pair with a red wine (I chose the house) and it will complete the entire ensemble. Do yourself a favor and stop by.
author: Jeremy B.

description: While in SF for business Monday one of my associates took us there. It is a very small place with a friendly atmosphere and people. VERY Italian. The service was excellent and the food the same. I just got back from Italy and have been longing for true Italian bread. I found it there. I am sure you will love this place
author: Murray G.

description: Great,great food. Nothing especially fancy but well prepared and very generous portions. Very good service! The place is a mixture of locals and tourists.
author: alex f.

description:
Yes yes yes.

When in North Beach the possibilities of good Italian food are endless and you hope that no matter where you go, you won't be disappointed. It's hard to choose a spot, but let me help u out a little and just stop here.

They opened at 5pm and we arrived at 6pm. They already had an hour wait and u fortunately they don't take reservations. We were able to sit outside without a wait and there are overhead heat laps which is a huge plus for that bay breeze.

I love that the potions are huge here which allows you to actually split meals and not over indulge. 

Everything on the menu looked amazing but our group ended up ordering...

Calamari appetizer and bruschetta 
Tortellini carbonara
Seafood linguini
Spaghetti and meatballs 

The calamari is lightly fried, the bread for the bruschetta is buttery with delicious overnight marinated tomatoes, creamy and flavorful sauces (all of them) and the meatballs were juicy!!!!

Sooo sooo good. Everything was flavorful. We regret nothing haha
author: Bianka G.

description: What a find.... good food, terrific prices...fun.  Great classic red sauce vibe. Strong drinks and friendly service. Relax, your treated like friends and family.  Large portions.
author: Scott W.

description: This place has the most amazing pizza I've had in San Francisco. The service is busy but the staff is so nice. The place is small but homey. I definitely will take my next date here. They even have crayons to color on the table cloth and a candle at the table to set the ambiance.
author: Natalie F.

description:
My friends and I were in the mood for pasta, so we stopped by this place after strolling a bit in the "Little Italy" Area. We knew we couldn't go wrong with any Italian restaurant. 

The overall ambiance seems very home-y, and each table is supplied with crayons and paper lined tablecloths which makes for a very casual and family-friendly setting. Tbh, my friends and I were pretty stoked to see some crayons and pretty much drew in between bites. 

I ordered the gnocchi pesto, and was expecting a much larger portion than what I ended up getting. As a small person, I didn't really mind since I don't eat much anyways, but didn't really think my meal was worth $17 + tax and tip. I wish there was another element to the dish other than just gnocchi and pesto, maybe some more veggies or something, since the texture and flavor got a little monotonous after a while. Gnocchi was unique though, since it was filled with pesto flavoring, as compared to typical non-filled gnocchi. 

Overall, okay experience. Service was good (props on continuously filling the bread basket!) and food was decent... just a little pricey.
author: Tina T.

description:
Really tasty and soul-comforting Italian food like you'd get from your grandma (if I had an Italian grandma) served up in a homey, casual environment. 

I came for dinner on a Friday night around 8:30pm but still had to wait probably around 45 minutes for a table, this place is popular! Come earlier so you won't be as hangry as I was. My dining partner and I shared a Caesar salad (yummy and drenched in dressing haha), as well as the tortellini in a creamy carbonara sauce (recommended by our waitress) and the linguini with marinara sauce and topped with 2 giant meatballs. Everything was delicious and really hit the spot, I literally couldn't stop smiling as I was eating. Our waitress was so sweet and friendly as well, and I had enough food to take home as leftovers for two more meals haha. 

Would definitely come back!
author: Vivian L.

description: Been coming here for over 25 years - never disappointed.  This place is an institution. Lovely, cozy ambiance, great  food and incredible service - love BLAZE!  She's the best!
author: Liliana R.

description: Amazing food and service. The owner, Mark is great . Rachel was our server and Casey was our bartender and it was more I expected. Just. Go.
author: Mark M.

description:
I just became the duchess of Sodini's (and I'm waiting for the rest of my group) so it seems a good time to update my review. 

This is one of my very favorite places in the world. We've been eating here for 15 years and it never disappoints. Everything I've ever had is excellent, even things I don't like elsewhere. Examples: gnocchi and fritto misto. 

But as much as I love the food I love the people. The same folks have been here longer than I've been coming. They're the best. I get a hug from Mark whenever he sees me. He loves the story of our first visit. Ana at the bar greets us like long lost family. The servers know us and are always happy we're back. 

We love to bring new people so they can see what we love. Everyone we bring comes back often. I'll. never quit coming. 

Oh, my favorite - chicken parm. It's to die for.
author: Audrey W.

description:
This Italian spot is yummy!.  
Service was excellent, food was delightful 
Everything was delicious
author: Charo S.

description:
We visited the restaurant on News Years eve. This rating is based mainly on our bad level of service than the food quality.  Overall food quality was good, with food coming out tasty, reasonably on time, and hot.

However, the service we got from our Asian female server was horrible.......twice we had to go to the bar to get an extra fork because they picked up our fork with our appetizer and never replaced it and again for the Parmesan cheese being out at our table.   Our waitress never checked in with us after we received our food.  And here is the kicker, after hardly ever checking in with us until the end when she had to bring our check, we asked her to take a quick picture of us to which she responded, "I can't do that now because I am so busy with my tables".  We gave her a "Really" look and she begrudgingly took it.
author: Ali M.

description: EAT HERE! EAT HERE! we came to this place at the recommendation of a local and you guys... EAT HERE! limited seating but the best service (i.e. BLAZE) and food we've had in the city. nothing fancy, nothing original but everything so so good. do not skip over the minestrone!
author: Kennan G.

description:
Yes. Yes. Yessssssss!

First time here last night and 100% coming back.

Amazing food, cozy, comfortable, and friendly, what else can you ask for?! In the neighborhood of many Italian spots, this is the one I'm sticking with.

We were greeted by the bartender when we walked in and sat immediately. Our waitress was super friendly and gave us time to decide on all the delicious options.

We went with the steamer clams and the tortellini carbonara (GET THIS!!) and oh man we were not disappointed. The creamy sauce with the tortellini :drooooooooool:

+1 for having crayons at the table to draw on the paper. We were a little too excited about that! 

Come here asap!
author: Heather H.

description: This place is great! Old school Italian! Warm and friendly staff you will always feel welcome. Low key and bit off the tourist strip that is Columbus street. The gnocchi here is my favorite. I crave it all the time and get it every time I'm there. My husband enjoys the lasagna and many other dishes but it's gnocchi or bust for me! Highly recommend this gem if you are in north beach.
author: Michaela M.

description: Italian comfort food. Had a late lunch here. Lots of pictures on the walls. Pizza took extra time to cook, but it was worth it.
author: Michael C.

description: Absolutely incredible experience. Alex, our waitress, was amazing. They have the entire authentic Italian restaurant down. Frank Sinatra, dark lighting and THE BEST food. Away from all the tourists and tucked in the heart of little Italy. Feeling blessed to have found this gem. Being from New York and a first generation Italian, this is the spot to go...it will NOT disappoint!
author: Emily G.

description: Love this place for old school neighborhood Italian food.  This is one of my go to places in San Francisco for a casual and fun dinner.
author: Grant W.

description:
The best things about this restaurant are the location and staff.

The food is not good. I took a friend there who was from out of town. Her first time in San Francisco. Multiple friends of mine suggested this place. We went there and I ordered the seafood linguini and she ordered a pizza. She said her pizza was quite doughy. I tried a slice. She was right. Certainly not the best pizza I've ever had. My seafood linguini had almost all calamari for seafood. Maybe two tiny little shrimps and a bit of mussels, but mostly calamari. It was very bland, and it did not seem like there was any tomato cream sauce at all, like it was supposed to have.

Bleh.
author: John B.

description: The Food is terrible here, there is no Italian flavor in the food just expensive for nothing
author: Ali A.

description: Met here to gather with a group of friends. The second we walked in the door we were greeted with warmth and smiles. We sat at the bar while we waited for our friends and were treated to banter and conversation with the bar tender who was so helpful. The wait staff was just as great! The food, we were told, is top notch. They weren't kidding. Everything was fresh, authentic, and bursting with flavor. The ambiance is an eclectic mix of Italian flair. Very fun. Very good. Very welcoming.
author: Jill M.

description: Meh, blah and I have to ask why Sodini's is worth the wait and the hype!?  Spent close to an hour to be seated.  Thought Yelp reviews and the reputation would indicate something worth our while.  Sodini's didn't measure up.  Service?  Pretty much average. Food?  Nothing close to a Frank Sinatra or Billy Joel moment.  What for & why did I wait in the line???  To be generous, this joint might hum but definitely doesn't sing!!!
author: Matthew T.

description: I have been going to Sodini's as Lo.g as I have lived in SF. I love this place. The food is great comfort food and the people are truly family. I always say that Sodini's is the Cheers of North Beach.  Stop by and say hello have a drink and a bite to eat.
author: Victoria M.

description: just went back.  service excellent and very nice and friendly.  food is just ok to below average. fish pasta was fishy. raviolli was all cheese, no meat or pasta inside.  much better italian places to go than this place so will not return.
author: Jacko F.

description: What an outstanding find in North Beach. Food was absolutely amazing and service was even better. Great neighborhood restaurant with friendly service and outstanding food. Thank you!
author: Mark D.

description:
I don't know who these people are who put in all the five-star ratings.  They must have had their taste buds neutralized at an early age.  We ate there recently. My friend had the seafood linguini. 
Somehow between the table and the kitchen the linguini morphed into spaghetti. The sauce was flavorless; the only discernible flavor was the flavor of the water the seafood was boiled in. I had angel hair pasta with pesto. The pesto sauce was OK, but had the pasta remained in the cooker another 30-secnds, it would have been mush. If you want really bad Italian food, this is the place. On the up side, the drinks are generous and reasonably priced.  The ambience is an unabashed  homage to Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack, with dashes of The Godfather and Goodfellows thrown in.
author: Odo D.

description: Great little place.  Food very good.  Service charming and warm, kind of like your best friends older sister, warm atmosphere. And prices are right.  Instead of waiting 40 minutes at sotto mare down the block, go here and relax and enjoy.
author: Dan N.

description: So last night I was just walking by and couldn't help but stop after smelling the food from the street. I checked out the menu... decided to give it go. This place was DELICIOUS. I was welcomed right when I walked in and didn't wanna leave lol. I ordered the linguine with meatballs to go. My food was ready in literally 7 minutes. I ended up staying and eating it there. The flavor of the sauce was perfect. The meatballs melted in my mouth and everything from the food to the service was excellent. I'm a local and I'm shocked I've never been here. Will definitely be back. Very nice vibe inside.
author: Jennifer E.

description:
I see the charm of this place.  It is very old school.  However the food is just average to me.  We had seafood linguini and New York steak. 

Linguini was tasty but too many calamari and shrimp is tiny.  I see why it's only $20.  Steak is average as well and a little dry. 

Decor is nice and cozy. Service was good and friendly.  Given so many fabulous restaurants and food in north beach, I am not sure I will be back anytime soon.
author: Lei H.

description: I love this place ! One of the few "old school " Italian restaurants that are left in San Francisco.  The white linguine with clams is my favorite.  Also, meatballs and spaghetti.
author: Stash P.

description: Very slow service. It took 15 minutes just to get water. We had the caprese salad and a pizza. Quality of ingredients is poor and tasteless. Pizza crust tasted like it was from a prepacked frozen crust. I'd rather eat frozen pizza from the store.
author: Rochelle C.

description:
Charming and cozy atmosphere. Nice mixture of tourists and locals.

Food was ok. Was surprised that the fried calamari came out cold and the the chiffoned basil on the caprese salad was dried out. Lasagna was the best entree. Seafood linguini was ok. 

Overall ok though I'll try other Italian places in the area before returning again.
author: Bonnie L.

description:
Always a Pleasure to Come eat at Sodini's in my Hood.
Old school Family style Italian Food.
Been enjoying it here for A decade.
Consistent food and Friendly Greetings with no frills. CRAYONS AWAIT YOU at the Tables along with Real Candle light,So mind your Q's people,don't put your fingers in the wax...ha ha. 
It's about the Minestrone soup,Steamed clams and Sautee Spinach for this Girl.
My SON Loves the Pizza and Lasagna.
Thanks Ana ,Rachael,Mark and everyone else for Making us feel like Family.
Happy 2017
author: Connie B.

description:
Another fantastic experience at Sodini's. (Wednesday Night. 6:30pm)

The Lasagna and the Pesto Gnocchi were delicious.
The fried calamari was very bland and tasteless.  After it was fried there was no seasoning added to it.

The service was excellent, the timeliness of the food was perfect, and our drinks were never empty.

I would like a wider variety of beer.  But really, after dinner I will just walk across the street to Church Key if I want a good beer.
author: Cap P.

description: This was about as good as it gets. I'm not a big Italian food person but this place came recommended from someone at the bookstore cross the street. The food was amazing! The lasagna was possibly the best I've ever had. It's a small family owned place, nothing fancy and definitely worth the trip!
author: Debra S.

description: Awesome Italian food, great atmosphere. Ana is a  great bartender. I will definetly come back here for the canneloni. Sodini's represents North Beach as it should be.
author: Jupiter M.

description: Absolutely delish. Had lasagna...it was incredible. Not too meaty, just perfection. Wife had linguini and loved it. This is a great place to try. The red sauce is just incredible.
author: Todd G.

description: Heard this place was amazing, so we came here for dinner and it did Not disappoint. The lasagna was amazing, fresh with great flavor. The cheese ravioli with pesto sauce was to die for - incredible! It was all in all a fantastic dinner with great service and authentic tasty flavor! Our waitress took care of us and made us have an even better dinner. Loved it!
author: Brek S.

description: Again, people complain fearfully about SF disappearing at a rapid clip but then there's still spots like sodini's. Eating here is a must - it's a family place, a neighborhood joint and a blast from the good old past. Every dish I've had is cooked to perfection and on point, but aside from that it has unmatched, irreplaceable character bouncing off every wall.
author: Sally R.

description: Unfortunately this place did not earn its 4 stars. I ended up with diarrhea after eating the chicken marsala special. The salads were so so. The service was good though and the bread was good. Dinner was just a big disappointment and not worth the trips to the bathroom.
author: Annette K.

description: Great food and workers are attentive to all needs. Would recommend to anyone as a great Italian restaurant...
author: Josue G.

description:
So we came here upon recommendation from one of our friends.  

And it didn't disappoint.   The service was good and they kept our drinks flowing and tolerant of my companies raucous behavior.   We sat outside on a really nice warm day.   The waitress was really nice and attentive.  

We had the Calamari.  A really tasty Seafood Linguine.  And the Pizzas we're also very good.  

For beer I had the Speakeasy Bigdaddy IPA.  

All in all I recommend the place and hope to come back again.
author: Homer S.

description:
Wonderful seafood linguini with just the right amount of cream to tomato in the sauce, balancing the smooth and acidic deliciously. An abundance of calamari & shrimp which I love, but just needs 1-2 more each mussels and clams. 
We really enjoyed our server-18 years at Sodini's and she LOVES her job (I asked her, because she was so upbeat, helpful & energetic!) 
And we really enjoyed the intimately quaint yet family feel of the restaurant, with that crowded but cozy ambiance.
author: Yvette D.

description:
Great family style Italian Restaurant. Loads of Sinatra and Rat Pack photos everywhere.
Food was good basic Italian - like spaghetti and meatballs. I miss this from living
author: Mark H.

description: This was the best Italian restaurant ever. Blaze the waitress was so nice and everything was fantastic!  We had the muscles,  Caesar salad, Chicken Marsala, and Lasagna.  The Chicken was so flavorful and tender. Lasagna was the best I've ever had.  If your in San Francisco you need to go here. I really loved the atmosphere!!!
author: Christie T.

description:
Great restaurant, great service, great food. This place has personality, a real north beach Italian restaurant.
I'll be back .....
author: Jack W.

description: One word- Lasagna. It was crazy good. The place is small and everything else seemed pretty middle of the road, but that lasagna... that's where it's at!
author: Lisa T.

description: Best meal ever!  The yummy house salad is best ever and gnocchi is so good.  Rachel and Melissa are there for you and best North Beach restaurant - so good you have to try it
author: Lynn J.

description:
Have been here many times for dinner, consider it my "go to" place in North Beach.  Last visit was Saturday 1/27/18

Fried calamari appetizer is consistently incredible, the aoili is magical, with just the right amount of spice to get your attention.  Entrees ordered included Chicken Marsala, Linguini and Clams in a white sauce, and Seafood Pasta in a red cream sauce.  Everyone was very happy with their meals
author: Terry S.

description: This was a great find in North Beach on New Year's Day when a lot of other restaurants were closed. We were lucky we got there soon after they opened & only had to wait about 15 min. This was such an old school classic place complete with a very Italian host and rat pack figurines. The bar in front was very cute and cozy as well. The food however was the star. The house salad was amazing as was bruschetta. The calamari was just okay, I've had better. However, the tortellini carbonara was outstanding! My boyfriend's veal parmigiana was good as well & our friends enjoyed their meal as well. Highly recommend this restaurant. We will be back.
author: Kathleen C.

description:
Came here after 9pm on a weds night for dinner. Place was still packed!!  To be so very busy late on a weeknight as an Italian restaurant in little Italy tells you a lot right off the bat. 

Food was huge portions. I loved my angel hair pasta and he loved his ny steak. Cooked perfectly. 

I wouldn't come here if I were in a rush. It's definitely meant to enjoy, relax, eat great food, take your time savoring, and really just truly enjoy a good meal. 

I met Ana and she was wonderful. Very welcoming and seemed like all the clients knew her, which speaks well for the restaurant and environment. I forgot our waitresses name but she was also welcoming. 

Overall I would definitely go again. And with a far bigger appetite.
author: Alicia Marie P.

description: Live in San Diego/Imperial county region and by far this was the BEST Italian place I've had out of SD's Little Italy and Imperial Valley's Italian Restaurants. Waitress was VERY attentive and made our visit very comfortable. The boss Marco was a true professional and you can tell takes pride in the old school aura this classic restaurant is known for. Lots of celebrities and sport figures dine here, for good reason. For a party of 7, 3 kids and 4 adults, dinner and dad had a glass of house Chianti and the bill was very reasonable. The only criticism I have is they don't serve dessert but that is fine, they referred me to another location in the area for a coffee and a tiramisu. Dr. Michael Savage dines here so enough said for me, THUMBS UP!!! Great classy old school place, as seen in the movie "Burglar" with Whoopi Goldberg, I will be here again and make this my "go to" Italian place in San Francisco!!!!
author: Jeffrey J.

description:
Blaze was our server upon walking into this 100+ year old establishment last evening. Given three options for our table, we chose the intimate window seat, tucked closely behind the table against the wall.

I was craving authentic Chicken Parmesan. This place nailed it, but it was impossible for me to finish, given the enormous (and delicious!) salad that came before and as part of my meal. 

I tried the wine described as, "spicy red wine", which came to our white-papered candlelit table in a simple and appropriately-portioned glass. It was a nice table wine with a little extra depth - nothing fancy, but just what you'd expect to be served in an Italian restaurant without fanfare. I wish I had seen the crayons sooner, which were tucked away behind the olive oil and balsamic vinegar.

We decided against coffee and once outside the restaurant, we noticed signage that said, "No dessert," among other things that I don't need to enjoy a meal. With so many other amazing establishments close by in North Beach to enjoy, I don't see a need to have it all here:) Two of my favorites for coffee with a block or two are Cafe Puccini and Cafe Trieste.

We will be back to enjoy this wonderful North Beach gem! Perhaps next time, sharing a meal.
author: Brooke C.

description:
My husband and I love this place and eat here whenever we are in town.  The food is excellent but it's the service that puts it over the top.  Mark, Casey, Anna and the rest of the staff make us feel like family every time.  They even gave us free t-shirts and a bottle of wine during our wedding weekend!  Love you guys.  :)
I recommend the Tortellini Carbonara, my hubs likes the linguini with clams and we both enjoyed the calamari.
author: Ann-Marie J.

description:
Went here on a Saturday night for our weekly cheesy cheat meal. Being vegetarians, my husband and I were really looking forward to this place. We came in at around 8:15 and we're told there would be a one hour wait. We decided to wait it out but were pleasantly offered a table within fifteen mins. 

We ordered the small vegetarian pizza and the penne al pesto. I can't stress enough how big the small pizza is and is enough for two people. The service was slow and the food took time so we gobbled down the delicious complementary bread. 

The pesto sauce in the pasta was delicious. It was perfection- fresh nutty creamy. But overall the pasta dish was average. Didn't like it. Same goes for the pizza. It had chunky tomato pieces which I personally hate. But for a highly rated Italian joint, the pizza was very average. 

I would definitely come back here for the amazing old world ambience, super nice staff and lovely music. Maybe next time just a drink and the bread.
author: Ashmita V.

description:
Go in and say you know Caroline.

She's tall.  Brunette.  Just gorgeous.

She doesn't work at Sodini's.

She's my friend.  And this is her favorite spot.

You'll get hugs.  You'll get the best seat.  You'll be VIP.  

And then you'll just love this place.

Don't pass on the house wine.  Red OR white.  That's it.  $8 for a heavy pour.

Get the house salad.  Greens are healthy for you anyway.  They'll even divide it up among the table.  The creamy Italian dressing?  It's not lite but it's worth the calorie splurge.

So many great choices on the menu.  I am a sucker for pesto and gnocchi always wins my heart.  They'll recommend the carbonara and the marinara, too.  

But that gnocchi.  Soft, pillowy, done perfectly.  As my friend Caroline would say, "SO GOOD!"

(admittedly, it was a smaller-than-I-am-used-to portion, so I could have eaten more)

No desserts so don't even ask.

The decor is all sorts of Rat Pack.

Watch out for the toilet.  Especially if you are tall.  I'll explain no more.

What a great dinner and experience all around!
author: Damian C.

description:
I LOVE Italian food and was waiting to eat at a place on North Beach. Sodini's was the first place I went to and it was awesome! Just off Columbus Ave, the entire place was so alive on a Saturday night.

There were quite a few options on the menu (even a few vegetarian ones) and they had specials too. The food was authentic and the service was great! Our waitress was super witty and arranged the food for us in the colors of the Italian flag. LOL! Overall, we had a very enjoyable evening.

The only reason I am not giving this place a 5 star rating is because they don't take reservations and hence you have to end up waiting about 20-30 min which doesn't seem like a lot now, but is hard when you have to do it with such great food around you!
author: Divya S.

description:
Hey paisan... Why you-a no come here when Frankie and Dino been here? We gotta pasta. We gotta pizza. We gotta veal parmigiana. We gotta vino. There ain't nothin' we ain't got that you don't want. Whatsamattuh? Maybe I go tell Don Corleone, eh. Capeesh? Oh good, you-a come in. Have a seat. And indeed Jamie W. and I did at the tiny table they squeezed next to the bar on the way to the toilet. There was a loud group of middle-aged tourists, the horned-up wives being particularly raucous in their adoration of the swarthy bartender. Ah, welcome to North Beach or at least the stereotypical view of it of which Sodini's does a masterful job of capitalizing.

The staff has their routines down pat here and the decor is everything you want it to be down to the plastic grapes on the overhead trellis and the photos of the Rat Pack on the wall (photo: http://bit.ly/17dlilj). No surprise that the menu is old-school Italian. We started with the $11.95 Caprese Salad, which appeared extravagantly priced for three slices of tomato topped with pieces of mozzarella and buried in a pile of fresh basil and red onion (photo: http://bit.ly/1v9POaS). While it was what I expected, it just didn't taste as fresh as I was hoping. For his entree, Jamie went for the $15.95 Linguini with Meatballs and Tomato Meat Sauce, which was nothing all that special except the quantity. There was a heaping pile of pasta on that plate and the veal meatballs were huge (photo: http://bit.ly/1vBbIPb).

Mine was the $18.95 Linguini with Seafood, which I had to admit was pretty good when it could have been easily mediocre. Granted the tomato cream sauce was a but much, but the plethora of clams, mussels, shrimp and calamari rings was a pleasant surprise along with the toasted garlic bread they put on the side of the plate (photo: http://bit.ly/1zkd5mU). The other pleasant aspect of our dining experience was the sassy veteran waitress who served us and didn't ignore us despite the high maintenance needs of the bands of tourists crowding the main dining room. So I guess we narrowly averted a horse's head in our bed, but I can see why Frank and Dean came here when they were in town. Bada-boom, bada-bing.

FOOD - 3 stars...old-school Italian executed like it was 1952 for better or worse, the linguini with seafood is the standout
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...also old-school and who would have it any other way?
SERVICE - 4 stars...that waitress really made our experience better
TOTAL - 3 stars...one of the true anchor points of North Beach but don't expect culinary artistry here
author: Ed U.

description: Very fun place for a drink or two. Nice calamari app... I'd leave it at that. It is super fun for a tourist - to see old school Italian San Francisco, but the food is not that great.
author: Vincent R.

description: We stumbled across this gem for a late supper and we were pleasantly surprised. We were treated like family. Seated in the window at a romantic table with candles a blaze. One of the best salads and pasta entrees we've ever had. Pasta was perfectly done and sauce was homemade. Price was on point as well, the most reasonable meal we've had in the city. We highly recommend! You won't be disappointed!
author: Kristin S.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city. Excellent service. Amazing food. So much history. I'm never disappointed and have been here numerous times. No reservations. No desserts. Worth the wait and generous portions.
author: Stephanie B.

description:
Most of the pasta is bought from a vendor because the kitchen is too small (per the waitress). However, it is still cooked to perfection and accompanied by some amazing sauces, all made in house.

Started off our meal with the steamers. You have a choice between mussels or clams or both. We opted for a mix, but I definitely preferred the clams - they seemed sweeter and more tender in my opinion. However, the white wine broth that accompanied the seafood was divine - I definitely used as dip for the bread at our table.

For our entrees, my parents and I shared 3 dishes, all were excellent in their own way...but our favorite was definitely the Tortellini Carbonara. The sauce wasn't too creamy and overwhelming, just enough to thoroughly hug each tortellini. There was also a good amount of mushrooms and pancetta accompanying the dish to add notes of flavor and change up the texture as well. 

Our second favorite was the lasagne. It was so smooth and served up nice and hot such that the cheese was still all ooey-gooey and stringy - yum! Pasta was not too thick and there was just enough meat and cheese to go around. Quote of the night? "It's no Stouffer's, that's for sure!" 

And last but not least, we had the Gnocchi Gorgonzola. They were like little potato pillows filled with spinach and ricotta. Definitely not doughy and definitely one of the best gnocchi dishes I've had recently in North Beach.

All in all, meal was delicious. Service was friendly and fun...and the feel was cozy, albeit a little dark inside. I would definitely say that this is one of the better Italian restaurants in North Beach/Little Italy and it doesn't need a promoter outside like some on Columbus Ave!!
author: Elaine Y.

description: This was the cutest little place!! The food here was absolutely amazing. My dad and I ate here when in SF for a weekend and he claims it's the best Italian food he's ever had. The service was good and the food was amazing!!
author: Chephra M.

description: Oh my gosh! The gnocchi is amazing! We were in town for work and came to eat here based on great reviews and a local bartenders tip.  The house salad was also great with lots of toppings, cute quaint little place.  Super authentic Italian restaurant.
author: Tina B.

description: Great Italian restaurant that really made my wife and I feel at home. We will be back next time we are in town!
author: Hal L.

description:
This place has been around for over 100 years, and has outstanding food and service. 

We started off with the polenta, which is covered in cheese and marinara. I was really impressed with the marinara, and the polenta was delicious. My boyfriend and I split the gnocchi with Gorgonzola and the seafood linguine. I was blown away by how heavenly the gnocchi tasted. Impressed with the seafood linguine as well, but it paled in comparison to the gnocchi. 

Rachel (who has worked here for 17 years) was incredibly thoughtful and treated us like we were her family. She had helpful wine and entree suggestions, and was very proactive when it came to making sure we had everything we needed. 

The ambience is very kitchy - Sinatra posters and Italian memorabilia. No reservations, and they do not serve dessert.
author: Angela F.

description: Great Italian cuisine, loud and lively atmosphere. Love it! Perfect place for a date night.
author: Sean D.

description: We stopped here on Friday night to get an appetizer while waiting to get dinner at sotto mare. Service was so slow but everyone was incredibly friendly. We got the caprese salad to spilt and one Stella, total was $24. Steep price to me considering we split a small salad of few ingredients and a beer coupled with being in "little Italy". Yes the menu looked very good and full of options but the service was so slow. I would like to give this place a shot for a full dinner but everyone around us was waiting forever for everything, including water.  And the place wasn't full. They did apologize each time for being slow.
author: Morgan S.

description: Great local Italian restaurant,  fun bar. Small place, so, be ready to like your neighbors.  Best tortellini carbonara ever from a person who cooks regularly.  Service was friendly and funny, be prepared to eat a lot of food!! Wine priced well, and loved the Caesar salad. Go and buono appetito.
author: Denise K.

description:
We had a glass of wine at the bar while we waited, met an adorable couple that were there celebrating their 1st from 39 years ago, they told us the food hadn't changed one bit, this is when I knew it was going to be lovely.
We were seated by the window with two candles, just adorable. The food was great, could have used a bit more gravy on my pasta but I still loved the chicken Parmigiana. The caprese salad was perfect!
author: A L.

description: One of my favorite restaurants EVER! Delicious food, great bar, cool ambiance. Perfect for a nice romantic dinner or hanging out with friends.
author: Kathy R.

description: Maybe the best Italian in North Beach. We went with the waiter's recommendation of the cannelloni and we loved it! We also had the pesto gnocchi.  Just delicious. Service was excellent and got us in and out for the Beach Blanket Babylon show easily. Will absolutely eat here again!
author: KC L.

description:
So far, we have been here 1.5 hours. We have been seated. I needed to get the hostess to get a waitress after 30 minutes at our table. It smells great - but a table seated 10 minutes after is has been served. We ordered simple food straight from the menu. We are hungry, and ready to eat. 

Do not come here if you are wanting food to be served in under two hours.

I love authentic Italian - the place seemed great - but this is NOT OK.
author: Hillary C.

description: Great food and service. Parking was horrible, had to park a couple of blocks away but worth it.
author: Francisco Q.

description:
Awesome find.  Having a few drinks in North Beach and asked for a dinner recommendation.  Super kitschy atmosphere and good service.  Of course, Sinatra and Martin on the sound system and all over the walls.  Miniature bathrooms give up the building's age.  I'm 5'11 250 and I had to angle my way in. My buddy has the lasagna and remarked at how good it was and the portion was huge.  I had the gnocchi and was blown away.  Little potato pillows full of flavor with a fantastic meat sauce.  The little piece of garlic bread that came with made me consider getting a full order.  Would give 5 stars but we got an earful from drunk woman at the bar.  Nice lady, but had way too many and wanted to talk.  Bartender apologized later, so he DID notice; he should have done something. Regular or not, letting paying customers get cornered by a barfly isn't a great look.
Anyway, she moved on before we got our food, so no real harm done and it didn't ruin out fantastic dinner.  I'll be back, but will get a table next time...
author: Ken P.

description:
So let me start by saying i really like the food here it's good and i come here with family and friends often and have been a local to them for 5 years live right up the street. So i was tired looking to order food and went online and actually placed a order online through (BRING ME THAT)
which has there menu and everything. I called just in case to see if they got the order and this nasty woman answers the phone don't know if she is the  owner or not and personally don't care. She went were not associated with any one online so i said oh ok thats weird cause i placed in order you guys might want to look into that just kinda looking out for them. She literally goes no you should just not order from here  ever again and hangs up on me. I don't really write review's but i was disgusted by this and trust me my friends, family, and anyone i know wont spend a penny in this place and will make sure everyone that asks me about this place i will turn them on to the other 100 restaurants in North Beach. I actually met the owner who was really cool a few times and always asks how was everything super nice. I don't see how he lets people work for him that talk to people like that. I called back 3 times she finally picked up and was a complete coward on the phone what a joke. RIP Sodini's also I'm going to post the pics of this website advertising online that u can order through them just because this nasty ugly person inside told me to F Off. Again even in the worst places iv'e never been treated like this.
author: Robert S.

description: Went in on a Saturday night got seated right away by a very welcoming Italian man. We were served drinks immediately and our food came out incredibly fast. The food was spectacular. If you're looking for an authentic Italian restaurant with great service and amazing food, come here!
author: Cheyenne V.

description: The food and service were just wonderful, I can't say enough about it. It is an authentic Italian dining experience. The gnocchi is the best I've had. A great way to end your day in SF-- delicious food, hospitable service, interesting/lively/energizing environment. Altogether a great place to relax and enjoy.
author: Melissa F.

description:
This place is hands down the best Italian food I've ever had.  A cute little restaurant with amazing service,  Erin was our server and provided a warm and friendly experience. 

For starters we enjoyed they're homemade garlic cheese bread.  It was light, airy and pure deliciousness on a plate. 

For our entrées we had their homemade lasagna and gorgonzola mushroom gnocchi. Both were delicious, hot and hit the spot. The gnocchi sauce was so good,  I tried not to lick the plate.  They don't serve dessert, but recommended a wonderful pastry shop called Stella's Pastry. It's only a block away and hit the spot to end the evening.  I highly recommend you give both places a try! Make sure to request Erin, she's amazing!
author: Bob K.

description:
Really wanted to love this place. Old style Italian restaurant, good vibe... but food was bland and pasta floating in sauce. Just nothing good about our meal there. Servers were efficient and friendly. 
Food..... blah...
author: Denise F.

description: We attempted to go to another restaurant close by but it was closed on Sunday. We decided to give Sodinis a try and we're so glad we did. authentic Italian dishes, old school atmosphere and friendly staff. The food was excellent, in fact the best Gnocchi I have ever tasted. We will definitely be back.
author: Maria M.

description: I went to Sodini's for the first time last night with two friends.  We were visiting the city for the night and were really craving a solid Italian dinner.  We happened across Sodini's and are SO GLAD we tried it!  We were seated right away, and our server, Blaze, killed it from start to finish.  The ambiance was laid back and cozy.  All three of us got pasta dishes- linguini with clams and the tortellini carbonara.  Portions were generous, flavor was great, prices were very fair.  We asked Blaze where she recommended going for a drink after dinner and she took about 5 minutes chatting with us about her favorite spots and even hand drew us a map of the area around the restaurant so we knew were to go!  She totally made our experience at Sodini's 5 stars.  Will definitely be making Sodini's a regular stop on my future visits to San Francisco!
author: Katie M.

description: Don't be fooled by reviews here especially you are Asian. Tables are so close to each other and the whole restaurant is very noisy. The waitress from the bar is super rude. Came in on a Sunday night not as busy as usual, there were two ladies waiting, not sure for the bar or table. I stood there waiting someone to greet me and only wanted to find out how long was the waiting. My family was parking in front the alley for me to find out. Nobody greeted to me. After about ten minutes the woman from the bar came to me and I asked her how long was the waiting. She said two hours and "get back to the line" without asking me any questions. Except two ladies the rest of people in line all came after me. She was sooo... rude. I am still shaking while I am writing this review.
author: renee b.

description: We absolutely love this place! The Sodini family is just awesome and the restaurant remains one of our San Francisco anchors as the city becomes more and more corporate each day.  There is nothing more comforting than enjoying pasta and chianti at the Sodini's Green Valley restaurant--a cherished North Beach haven.
author: Anonanon S.

description: LOVED THE FOOD! Got the seafood linguine, my plate was sparkling clean after so delicious. Service was awesome they really made me feel welcome and at home and made me want to come back! Look forward to coming here again
author: Gavin H.

description: The veal was amazing - so tender and seasoned perfectly. Their sauce was great. My meal even came with an order of minestrone soup, which I loved. We felt like we were back home in NY having a home cooked meal. Staff was attentive and friendly. Definitely worth the  wait.
author: A Z.

description:
Not very good Italian-American cuisine, but fun 1950s Sinatra, Davis and Martin, rat pack ambiance.  

Last night was my first and will be my only visit.  Although the service and ambiance were great, the main course was not edible.  I ordered the Chicken Marsala special.  It came with a side of linguini topped with a tomato sauce.  This combination of two different sauces on the same plate made for an inedible mess.  The Marsala sauce tasted like a commercial brown gravy from a can and lacked a distinct Marsala flavor.  The abundance of Marsala sauce ran into the tomato sauce linguini, creating garbage.  On the good side I did very much like the minestrone soup.  

I had a pleasant experience and only wish the meal had been better.  I must say the place was packed on a rainy Saturday night so it appears to be well liked.
author: Donna P.

description:
If you are looking for a place to eat excellent food at a great price this is the place. Its off Columbus a few blocks so it has alot of locals which is great. Most places you find in the Columbus St area are tourist geared. Expensive, tasteless food and bad service. At Sodinis I always get great service and food comes quick. Its a funky old place and full of atmosphere.
Love the Clams linguine and large portion of fried calimari. They also serve fresh sour dough with your meal.  Prices are very reasonable for SF.It does get crowded fast, so I always get there just as they open so I can be sure to get my window table. I usually try to park up a few more blocks toward Coit Tower. I can usually find street parking there.
author: Rolando B.

description: Food was fine but bad service -- kept waiting for more than an hour to get our meal (even when the small restaurant wasn't full), and they lost my credit card, spent 10 minutes looking for it, and never even apologized when they found it.
author: Michael C.

description: Very good. The wait was a bit of a nightmare; forty-five minutes stretched into over an hour, so it's a good thing there are plenty of bars nearby. But once we were seated, they wasted no time bringing us menus and food and getting us served. The Tortellini Carbonara with mushrooms was perfect, and filling in the way that I left perfectly contented but not feeling like I might burst open if I fell over. The prices were also very fair considering the quality of the food and the fact that it's North Beach. Overall, a winner.
author: Zeb L.

description:
Came here yesterday with the husband. Wanted some authentic Italian pizza, and Yelp highly rated Sodini's. It was super packed so we waited 15 mins to get in. The place was really friendly and cozy. Family style. Unfortunately, the food did not live up to my expectations. (I keep forgetting that "Italian" food in the American context, has little to do with Real Italian food - aside from being carb heavy. Just like the Italians from the Jersey Shore aren't real representatives of Italians from Italy.) 

We got the Margherita pizza... the most basic, simple Italian pizza ever... and it looked like it came out of Papa Johns (and tasted like it too). Don't get me wrong, it was tasty and I enjoy Papa Johns, but this is a pricier "Italian" restaurant, so I expected better quality. No sliced tomatoes - just diced (Chipotle style), no basil leaves - only basil powder!!, and no mozzarella balls, just shredded cheese - not nice shredded cheese either. We also got the cheese ravioli in pesto and garlic sauce. It was tasty but small and not worth $17. Also, the sauce did not taste homemade, but rather, premade. Save yourself some money and go to Trader Joes and purchase their ready-made pasta and pesto sauce.

Food: 2/5
Price:2/5
Quality: 2/5
Ambience: 4/5
author: Sandy C.

description: I've eaten a lot of pizza. A LOT of pizza. Best one was in Europe, second best was in New York but this pizza is just as good if not more. The crust is cooked to perfection (=not at all chewy) and it's an authentic Italian restaurant. Great service too. Easy 5 stars.
author: Alexandra E.

description:
I've had a number of meals at Sodini's and the dining experience is consistently very good, that is the food AND service.  Also, it's a really cute and fun little place, perfect for lower-level special occasions, more so because the prices are reasonable.  So...GO!  HOWEVER...

I did experience a little blip last night that tarnished my personal feelings about Sodini's.  My sister arrived early and was seated at a postage stamp of a table tucked away in the front window corner.  When you arrive, you normally go through the bar to the dining section.  Seeing Anna tending bar on my way in - a woman who I knew to be a childhood friend of my co-worker, and who previously bought me a drink to celebrate that coincidence - I exchanged pleasantries with her, then proceeded to where my sister was seated.  

I had to completely shoe-horn my way into my seat, and the configuration was such that we were seated at awkward right angles to one another (as opposed to the traditional across-the-table situation).  The problem is, both my sis and I are not small people and the table was meant for a single or at most, two diminutive diners.  Besides there being not much area for plates, I'm 6'2" and around 220, and my sis is, well, as I said, not small either.  There were very real girth challenges.  I told her immediately that this would not do and we should ask for a different table.  

Happily, Anna happened by - although I'm still not sure why as she was not our server.  Still I took the opportunity to ask if we might be seated elsewhere, and simultaneously mentioned our past connection in hopes it would help smooth things over.  Anna peered around - and there were several empty tables at this somewhat off-period of 6pm on a non-descript Tuesday -- but curiously seemed adverse to the idea of us moving, and instead suggested that my sis and I simply change positions!  I was taken aback a bit by this because two things seemed beyond obvious, (1) my sister would fare even worse in my seat, and (2) we were plainly physically uncomfortable.  Since this was the first time I'd seen my sister in at least three years (she just moved back to the SFBA) and we were celebrating my 60th birthday, I didn't want to bring about an awkward situation or cause an undue problem at this special outing, so I settled in and made due.  The result however was that my back was wrenched the entire evening during and after the meal.  On retrospect I know I should have insisted or taken us to dine elsewhere.

It wasn't so much that there were tables available, or that Anna knew me by sight, or that I considered myself a friend of the establishment (I normally come in for an Irish coffee with Casey who's served me hundreds of times at the GDL when it was on Powell Street); it was just that most nice restaurants would have immediately recognized there was a problem and insisted that we move elsewhere or be re-accommodated at the very utterance of such a reasonable request so I had to wonder how they'd treat you, an unwitting tourist, or a local first-timer.   Think about it.  I'll be back, but in my thinking, I'm disappointed that Sodini's now feels like less of a congenial and friendly place to visit.  And that's a shame.
author: Michael B.

description: My husband and I decided to try this place for our 1 year anniversary. I must say I am so glad we stumbled upon this place. The food was amazing and the service was the best I've had in a long time. They treated us like family from the second we walked through the door. I recommend this place to anyone wanting great Italian food!
author: Nicki H.

description: Hung out at the bar and it was a great experience!The bartender Anna was exceptionably hospitable and made sure we were well taken care of.  We will be back for dinner for sure.
author: Mike B.

description:
Travelers from NJ who passionately try to avoid tourist traps. We are pros in NYC but out of our element here. Luckily we found a great cabbie chick who grew up in the city and is savvy beyond belief about SF.  She gave us three choices of all off main. We picked Sodinis.

Best steamers you will ever have...house wines are excellent. Seafood pasta dishes, we had were excellent. For wine, apps, and mains all less than a Bennie you can never go wrong. Hale to the wait staff. We loved them.
G
author: G. S.

description: Authentic Italian cuisine at its finest! Love the bar, restaurant and incredible food! Not to be missed in SF
author: Noelle C.

description:
The boyfriend and I spent a short weekend in SF and wanted to try a North Beach italian joint. He chose Sodini's and off we went.
