We were seated right away by a man who looked and acted like he just stepped out of an episode of Soprano's. He enthusiastically shook my boyfriends hand like they'd known each other forever, and seated us at a small table for two. We loved the vibe in there right away. It was crowded, as was expected for a Saturday evening, but it didn't distract from our experience. Our waitress was excellent and so, so friendly! The staff acted like they genuinely wanted to be there and could be seen chatting and laughing with other patrons between delivering food.

We had the bruschetta for an appetitzer; it was some of the best I've ever had! Simplistic and absolutely delicious. The boyfriend ordered lasagna for his entree, while I had the tortellini carbonara. They were both excellent! I almost always need a to-go box when we go out, but I ate every bit of it. Calories be damned; it was a worthy splurge! 

All of this to say...don't miss this place!
author: Kylie W.

description: Overall, okay place. Be aware that the wait time is insane! We waited for an hour & 15 mins. But once we were in, the servers were friendly and the ambiance was homey. The food was decent but was not the best I've ever had. I was expecting better quality food but it wasn't horrible either. Would I go again? I would have to think about it.
author: Jessica F.

description: Hidden GEM...we took a recommendation from the bartender at our hotel. We stopped in on a Saturday night, busy place but well worth the wait. The food was OUTSTANDING! Blaze our waitress was AWESOME! It was extremely busy but she took the time to go over the menu with us, and provide food recommendations. I have to say the calamari was melt in your mouth delicious. The dipping sauces equally delicious and compliment the calamari beautifully. I had the chicken parmesan and loved it. The chicken was thin, crispy and delicious. The cheese lightly browned on top with the best red sauce!
author: Jasmine C.

description:
We wanted to try something close to Beach Blanket Babylon, and since Kapp's is gone, it was really a toss up. I read the reviews for Sodini's and thought we might like it. We walked in and were immediately welcomed like family! 
The food was great and the service was so warm and friendly! We will certainly return on our next visit to San Francisco.
author: Lori H.

description:
Such a great Italian restaurant in North Beach!! It's tucked in a quaint street near Golden Boy. It was owned by a former Giants player and they have kept it as a beautiful tribute to that time. 

Vegetarian options are fantastic! We had the manicotti and Alfredo. The garlic bread was also amazing. Definitely going back if I'm craving real Italian food!!
author: Akshaya V.

description: This might be my favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco, or even the west coast. This place has been around since 1906! Love these old time Italian places, and this one has a lot of charm. Even the bathrooms are old school. Seems like their current theme is mobsters with lots of Godfather pictures up and the restaurant logo on their shirts has a gun like the Sopranos logo. Very cool place. And the food is great. The caesar salad has big anchovies, and I liked veal parm.
author: Peter K.

description: The atmosphere is the main draw here. The food isn't exceptional but it's just a good place to bring some friends, eat a lot of food, and have some drinks. One drawback is that the pasta is not homemade in-house, the gnocchi is from Italy. Lasagna was excellent.
author: Ian S.

description: I've had dinner there with friends. The food was really mediocre, though not cheap (27,50$ per person for pizza + wine). We were really disappointed! The place itself is alright otherwise, and the waitress was nice.
author: Charles M.

description:
As an Italian cook from the east coast, I will try to be fair in judging this place tonight.  It's Monday, so maybe the regular chef is off from the weekend.  I ordered linguine and meat sauce.  Not that I like linguine with meat sauce, but my only choice in white is a cream sauce.  So, I took a left turn in my selection. 
The Italian bread is sourdough.  I was not expecting that, but hey, we're in SFO.  So I put some salt and pepper in the side of olive oil, and dipped away the taste.
When my pasta came it looked good.  Oh dear, the linguine was overcooked and not salted in cooking.  The meat sauce was okay.  I put a lot of grated cheese on it to help, but there was no helping the pasta.
I gave it three stars cuz of the reputation ONLY. My husband liked his canneloni
Sorry, I wish it was super great.
author: M-E I.

description:
Sodini's is an incredible gem in the heart of North Beach.

My boss, an SF native, took me here for lunch one day. Somehow every time we get food in the city, we're able to find parking right in front of the restaurant. If only I were blessed with that sort of parking karma! I was sh** out of luck the second time I came here myself and spent what seemed like eternity circling.

Once inside I was seated immediately. I ordered the seafood linguine and was presented with a huge, mouth-watering plate of it not more than fifteen minutes later. They are very generous with the sea critters here! Clams, shrimp, mussels and calamari all swimming in the beautiful ocean of creamy tomato sauce. As much as I loved it and wanted to inhale every bite of it, I had to take about half of it to go to prevent myself from crippling stomach pains later. The leftovers were still FANTASTIC the next day and made some coworkers envious :P

NO reservations, no dessert, and no frills. If you're looking for an old school Italian joint with a chill local scene, Sodini's is the one!
author: Jenny Q.

description:
We LOVE Sodini's and it's our go to romantic Italian restaurant on a Friday or Saturday night. By now the owner knows us, although right from the second time we came in he remembered us which I was impressed with. We are always warmly greeted and we always love the food, which is very classic Italian American fare. Comfort food! There is also a full bar and of course a lot of wine to choose from.

The neighborhood is part of the fun, it's a whole experience to go there in the first place. There's all kinds of live music up and down the block and fun art galleries and shops to tinker around it. I love the twinkly lights that they have strung up outside, if you decide to sit at their out door seating area. It takes you back to a simpler time. I do feel safe walking around this neighborhood.
author: Rachel L.

description: Just finished a meal at Sodini's. Great food, great service and experience. Can't beat the ambiance either!!!
author: Jen G.

description:
Went to Sodini's years ago and loved it. Every time I was lucky enough to have a meal there, it was excellent. I work in a restaurant nearby and always recommended Sodini 's. ALWAYS!!! 
Clam and garlic pizza, fried calamari and Caesar salad was my all time order each and everytime. Plan on going back soon, can't wait!!!
Just finished dinner at Sodini's. Rachel is such a GREAT server. The calamari was so tender and delicious. Caesar salad was perfect!!! Clam and garlic pizza was a disappointment . The crust was too light and unlike pizza dough. I had recommended this restaurant and spoke so highly of this particular pizza which I had eaten several times in the past years and was always amazing. BUT we will always come back because of Rachel, she is the epitome of service in this industry.
author: Veronica L.

description: Wow !! We have been coming to SF for years and finally found this hidden gem , Excellent Food , Minestrone Soup was the best I've ever had , The server was Extremely Friendly also , Great price for a great meal , Price was very reasonable for the great food
author: Troy D.

description: Awesome service awesome food! We went yesterday this place never disappoints me! Ready to go agin tonight lol
author: Lei S.

description: You come here for the classic atmosphere, warm service, and neighborhood vibes. The food is average and nothing too stellar. Overall, the food is fairly solid. I especially loved how a lot of the patrons all knew each other and the servers were really welcoming. I had the Pesto Linguini and my husband had the Gnocchi Carbonara (or Gorgonzola). Both were fine, but again nothing outstanding. I think the service and restaurant itself is more worth the visit. Next time, I'll head in for a bar seat.
author: Lisa R.

description:
great lasagna! authentic & delicious :D

HIGHLY RECOMMEND THEIR LASAGNA :P we went back a second time already haha!

Both times the atmosphere was the same the place was packed, Sinatra music was playing, the staff was friendly and they were great with refilling water and refilling our bread baskets. Both times there was a bit of a wait for the food, but like i said we were there at peak times so thats to be expected ;)
author: Sara Emily S.

description:
Family ambient restaurant or date ambient will be good as well. 
We went in 6 people and it was perfect! The minestrone soup was amazing! And the clam pasta was pretty tasty as well!! 
Over all was good the service as well!
author: Kim K.

description:
WARNING: IF YOU ARE NOT A LOCAL DO. NOT. BOTHER. 
     After being dissmisively told where to sit (we were not led to our seats by a hostess or otherwise) we waited about 30 minutes before actually being helped. Our waitress was somewhat pleasant during our meal, but visibly disappointed when we didn't want to order after dinner drinks or dessert. Once she gave us our check that was the last time we saw her, she didn't even pick up our card her sister(another waitress) had to do it for her. Maybe she thought we were paying cash, but I feel like that's a stretch. 
     The busser was the most professional person we encountered all night as he was happy to attend to us and even boxed our leftovers even though he was clearly busy clearing tables. If the wait staff didn't spend every spare moment buttering up their regulars, or cutting up with the cooks, maybe our waitress would've remembered we existed, but the overpriced food is enough to make us avoid giving them a second chance. 
Don't waste your money or time, I'm sure someone else in North Beach will actually appreciate your business.
author: Nicolas C.

description:
My favorite restaurant in North Beach. Tonight my friend and I had calamari, Gorgonzola gnocchi and tortellini carbonara. All absolutely yummy and would order again. Another one of my favorite dishes is their clams and linguine with the white sauce. Tonight I ordered a rum n' coke and was introduced to Sailor Jerry rum, all I can say is OMG! I think I found my new rum, so smooth! The staff there is always very friendly, just love this place.
6-2-15 Had dinner here last night and had my faves: Fritto misto for appetizer and gnocchi with Gorgonzola for my entree. Don't know if they have a new chef but it wasn't as good last night. Will go back soon to see if it was just a fluke. Love, love, love Rachel (waitress). She's simply fantastic.
author: Kim L.

description:
I really love this place.  It has been a few years since my last time here but once again we were treated like family.

My gnocchi was wonderful - perfect fluffy pillows (unlike the pasty version many places call gnocchi) that was willing to soak up anything I threw it's way...the yummy meat sauce on the plate or the wine that washed it down and the limoncello that chased it on it's way.

Speaking of limoncello, we ordered a round for the table and I was asking our awesome waitress Linda about the brand since I make my own.  This led to a longer conversation and free refills of limoncello for the group!
author: Jim W.

description:
The food was very yummy! We had tortellini al la carbonara, bruschetta, and pizza.  So flavorful and delicious. The ambience reminded me of our recent trip to Italy, especially sitting outside. Although a little chilly but the heat lamp was helpful.

The white sauce on the tortellini is creamy but not too heavy and a little garlicky with Parmesan flavors. The pizza crust is just right not too thick, as I usually prefer thin crust.
author: Susana G.

description:
Six hungry shoppers, 9:50 pm Saturday night, where to dine?

We walked 'round and 'round the area; I walked in here and within two minutes, the Big Guy walks over and said how many? I said six, he said this way. I like that!

My friends shared a pizza; I ordered gnocchi w/ gorgonzola.

My gnocchi gorgonzola was pretty good; each gnocchi was stuffed with a pesto sauce. Each pillow of gnocchi was soft, chewy and warm all over with gorgonzola sauce.

Will return.

Customer service: good

Parking: very little street parking, take your chances. We parked in Union Square,shopped, then hiked over. We were famished.
author: Bert K.

description: Reminds me of Italian food growing up (in New Jersey and Rhode Island, where they do it the right way!) Delicious food, warm and candle-lit ambiance, terrific service (Blaze is awesome)! Can't wait to take my parents here!
author: Mirabella Y.

description: Excited to return tonight! 6+ years later. Thought of this place in my dreams! I can not wait!
author: Dale B.

description:
The pizza is delicious. Everything was good but pizza was the best. The calamari was also very good.
Great environment. 
We had spaghetti  and chicken parm. They were both great
Place has a great old school Italian vibe. There were a coupe of old timers sitting at bar the contributed to the  environment.
author: Lynn K.

description:
This is probably my favorite Italian restaurant in SF. I've been going here for 8 years, steady family ownership- love that they know their regulars! The food is delicious - especially their calamari appetizer - which is the best I've had anywhere in world, including Italy. Light, golden, not chewy at all! 
The ravioli is tasty- you can even order half meat/half cheese ravioli & the lasagna!- hearty, large portions.  Delicious pizza also- personal is plenty big for 2, especially after splitting the calamari. In fact, everything I order there has really sizable portions. Wash it down with a Zen of Zin Zinfandel, look at the fun Sinatra-inspired decor, & feel transported into that time. No reservations taken. But just wait half hour at the bar because they also don't serve desert. (Just coffee) smart: people don't hang about after they finish dinner!.  (& if you have any room for a sweet there are many northbeach pastry places just down the street).
author: Blues B.

description: I am not from San Fran, I got the name of here from a friend and have to come here every time I'm in town. Food is amazing , atmosphere is a dark lit romantic Italian restaurant. I can't rave enough about this place. It's been around for over a 100 years for a reason!
author: Craig H.

description:
This is my favorite place to eat Italian when visiting San Francisco.  This is a family owned establishment and the owner Mark greets patrons as they enter. He also explained the family pictures on the wall including his parents' wedding picture and a picture of his grandfather.  

When greeted I asked for a table for four and was told it would be about an hour wait and I said that will be fine. I sat at the bar while the rest of my party looked for a parking spot. The bartender was attentive and asked what I wanted to drink while I waited. About 20 minutes later I was informed our table was ready. 

We ordered the garlic cheese bread for starters and it was buttery, cheesy, and warm.  Then we ordered our dinner and I had the linguine with meat sauce and meat balls. It was a hearty serving and was delicious. Everyone else in my party enjoyed their meal as well.  The fun part about this place is the table tops have white paper and there are crayons for you to create your own canvas. 

I highly recommend this old school Italian restaurant in North Beach!
author: Katrina D.

description:
Had the House Salad, and minestrone soup along with chicken parmesan.  The salad was one of the best salads I've had.  I usually have caesar, but I'm glad I went with the house.  The chicken parmesan was ok, not great but ok.  I don't know why I keep ordering  that because I'm always disappointed.  My wife had the salmon and thought it was very good. 
Good atmosphere and friendly staff.  I'll go back when I' in SF.
Very good restaurant and not expensive.
author: Jeffrey P.

description: This authentic Italian restaurant didn't disappoint! We ate here before Beach Blanket Babylon and the service was great! We had the pesto gnocchi and tortellini carbonara and they were amazing! Would definitely recommend!
author: Kristen M.

description:
Dear goodness....
Best Cesar salad ever... Don't skip it. Watch out the drinks are STRONG! Just sayin' looking forward to dinner... Love the atmosphere..
author: sierra r.

description: Loved my plate, great staff and very welcoming. Will most definetly be back to taste a different dish, they had so many good ones to choose from!! Thx again for taking care of us for my birthday dinner:)
author: Natalia H.

description: Delicious dinner and fantastico service! Veal scallopini was amazing, we also had the seafood linguini that many reviewers had suggested, abundance of calamari but not so much of other seafood, flavor was good/ok but not superb, we will also try other dishes next time. Everything we have had in the past has been fabulous. Fried Calamari and    Tomato brochette appetizer perfectly executed, loved!! Highly recommend this place!! Great evening with friends and food!
author: Lady J.

description:
Sodini's is way more than an Italian restaurant.  It's neighborhood.  It's family.  Being a NB girl, I've eaten my way through the entire menu a hundred times over.  No reservations, so if you have a long wait, order some fried calamari or bruschetta to nosh on in the interim.  Preferably w a cocktail, since Ana makes some fantastic drinks.  She is a mixologist, & has been since long before the word  became commonplace.  The seafood linguini is a go-to, made w a creamy tomato sauce that I love.  The pesto pasta is also noteworthy; & I'm a pesto snob.  

Many years ago, Sodini's is actually where I learned what chicken mattone is.  It's chicken that is cooked under a brick (that is wrapped in foil), so that the skin is crispy & the meat retains all its juices.  I still dream about this dish.  It's a special from time to time, so if it happens to be a special on a night you're here, order it!  It's not a common dish, and I've only had it at one other venue...& it didn't compare to the chicken mattone at Sodini's.  

The staff is awesome.  The owner, Mark Sodini, is awesome.  Authentic & warm, you can't go wrong here.

Mangia!
author: Veronica M.

description: Not busy when we walked in, but filled up quickly. Had a great meal and drinks, and the staff (especially Erin) was fantastic. Loved the food. Started with Bruschetta, then the house salad and finished with the gorgonzola gnocchi. A great find, and a lot of fun!
author: Brian L.

description: Ok. Came here at 6 pm on a Thursday and got a table easily. The school is an old school Italian restaurant with kitchy stuff on the walls that is almost cheesey. My friend got a house salad that was basically a Cesar. My canelloni was whatever. The gnocchi my other friend got was the best dishes by far. Just overall mediocre experience.
author: Alyssa H.

description:
Love this place.  The atmosphere is lively, the people who work here are great. It's a little like a place where you'd see Tony Soprano and Paulie eating an amazing eggplant parm. 

GREAT chopped salad! Not kidding. Get this!!  

Also had amazing linguini with pesto. Maybe the best in North Beach. 

Be sure to read the sign on the window: they don't do dessert, coffee, and a few other things. But it's worth it!
author: Elizabeth M.

description:
Once again, my bad habit of only awarding 5 stars or 1 star only. But the truth is the truth. 

I was walking in little Italy in San Francisco, thinking I could speak Italian when I decided to try the ravioli at this highly reviewed restaurant. 

Do you see where I'm going? 

Ok. I'll explain. I was craving MEAT ravioli. I ordered meat ravioli only to have the waitress suggest I try their mixed ravioli that comes with both cheese and meat ravioli in a meat sauce. I agreed and took her suggestion. 

First thing I noticed when I got my plate was the sauce. You couldn't see any meat with the naked eye. You literally needed a magnifying glass. Then I started eating and kept biting into cheese raviolis. I had to ask the waitress where the meat raviolis were hanging out. She then proceeded to take the fork out of my hand and scour around the sauce in my plate to show me there were meat raviolis in my plate. Kinda gross but I'm not that fragile, so I decided to eat the meat ones only. 

Whoa! What a surprise. Where's the meat in the meat ravioli?? Since I tasted something other than meat, I decided to open the only other "meat" ravioli on the plate. 

Guess what I found??? 

Nooooo, of course not. It wasn't meat!!! 

What I found was deliciously tasting thanksgiving stuffing! No joke, that's what was inside the "meat" ravioli. 

Sure Taco Bell mixes their beef with fluffers, but I wasn't expecting that from a well reviewed restaurant. 

The waitresse's response.... There's meat in there. Sure sweetheart, there's life in Mars too. 

Be warned... They may have other dishes that I didn't try, but with the poor customer service and my "meat" ravioli disappointment I will surely never ever try this place again.
author: Nick D.

description:
I have to start off with saying that the calamari is absolutely phenomenal. I order calamari at almost every restaurant they have it and I have to say that this calamari I truly think is the best I've ever tried. The food was absolutely amazing my boyfriend and I have decided to make it a traditional once a month must go. And I must say the service there was amazing the waitress that helped us out was the sweetest woman ever I wish I could remember her name so I can give her credit, how about I say beautiful curly hair and hopefully she'll know I'm talking about her.. oh and the birthday lemonchello shots should help :)
Thank you for your great service and we will see you soon :-)
author: MiaAmor V.

description:
I met a couple old friends from High School here and we had a fantastic meal!!  Erin our server was FANTASTIC and extremely helpful!!  
Very homey Italian feel.  
Food and Service GREAT!  what else do you need?
author: Blain H.

description:
A local favorite of mine! 

I've taken friends and out-of-town visitors here and it's a hit every time. The food is great, the people are sweet, and the wine is plenty. You sit down and feel like you just happen to have an Italian friend who owns an awesome restaurant down the block. 

The seafood linguine and calamari platters are must-tries. I still kind of wish they served dessert (I envision this place to serve a killer tiramisu), but I'll settle for another glass of their pinot noir.
author: Linda X.

description:
Very small and dark restaurant with a bar. 

Simple Italian fare, all the basics like gnocchi, pizza and lasagna.

I had the linguine and meatballs. Very simple, not overly seasoned or garlicky. Pasta was cooked perfectly to my liking.

The dining companion had the #1 pizza special. Topped with all kinds of meat, sausage, pepperoni, salami, and gooey cheese. It had a delicious crispy light crust. 

Really solid Italian meal. My only complaint is the eccentric server who forgot to bring us the change.
author: Sonya T.

description:
By far my favorite spot to sit down and grab dinner in North Beach. Probably hit this place up once a month. 

No reservations, but they're really good at taking your name and calling you back. It's the same door guy every night and he's awesome...super friendly, super Italian-American. He's everyone's friend.

Get yourself a pitcher of wine (ask for the Giants pitcher) and the Gnocchi is seriously second to none. My wife and I usually split the Gnocchi gorgonzola, bruschetta, and a side salad and it's the perfect amount. 

Service is always amazing. 

Oh, it's pretty close quarters there so don't pick this place to break up with your significant other. Seriously, we witnessed that once there at arm's length...not pretty. Also, not a great place for kids.

It's a fun, relaxed, unpretentious place that's a good mix of locals even during the tourist season.
author: Corbin C.

description:
A bartender from another restaurant recommended Sodini's... Great call, delicious home style Italian with vibrant atmosphere. 
First, every single member of the staff we saw greeted us with a big smile and hello, setting a high bar of expectations.  Service and menu advice was excellent.  The salad portions were large and  delicious: Caesar and house. We split the chicken parm as it was the waitress' top suggestion. The combination of nicely thin chicken and mozzarella browned to perfection made you feel like family.
author: Mark K.

description: Our favorite place in north beach! Would much rather go here than to a bigger more "popular" place. They make you feel very welcome and love that all of the locals come here. Very warm Italian vibe :)
author: Brianna S.

description: Great service, but a just your typical, cookie-cutter, Italian restaurant-in-a-box. You're paying for cheap food - not quality, in-house made pasta. I would pass on this place even if it was midnight and I had a few drinks too many. Totally fell for this tourist trap of a restaurant.
author: Nick D.

description:
My husband and I were recently up in SF celebrating our 10 year anniversary.  One of my clients insisted while I was up there to find this place, she promised I wouldn't be disappointed.  On our last night we decided to give it a try, my only regret is that we didn't seek it out sooner so I could've had at least one more meal there before we returned. 

We ordered the Calamari/Prawn appetizer - DELICIOUS - but rather large for two people.  My husband ordered the Gnocchi, this is a childhood favorite from his dear Italian grandma and he couldn't stop raving.  And I ordered the Linguini w Clams in the white sauce.... I have no words... It was truly the BEST I've ever had.  It was the kind of good that makes you want to physically hurt someone but you resist cause its not socially acceptable and all... 

As for other reviews, yes, the place is small.  It's San Francisco!  But I loved the feel of it.  To top everything off, our waitress Erin, was amazing!!!  She was beyond friendly, so welcoming and fun to talk to.  You could tell she was extremely busy but you never felt rushed or neglected.  If you can request to sit in her section when you visit I highly recommend it.  

As you can tell, I'm a fan.  I will visit every time I'm in the area!
author: jamie g.

description:
Amazing food! So happy we stumbled into Sodini's on our trip to San Fran! Incredible food and environment. The best Italian food and an amazing owner there to greet you. 

Visit this place and be sure to leave with a smile on your face....and food coma.
author: leila d.

description: So good!! The wait is a little long but it is worth it. For the amount of food you get the prices are so reasonable. Staff is super friendly. I recommend the clams with linguini so delicious!
author: Danielle M.

description: If I lived in SF this would be a weekly habit. My daughter and I enjoyed the atmosphere from our little corner window table, complete with chianti candleholders. The bread was great! Best Ceasar salad ever! I got to eat my anchovies, AND my daughters. :). The pitcher of house red went down easy, so that by the time we got our veggie pizza, it was like, "Oh yeah, here's the pizza."  Pizza was good. Just pizza. But the pasta and gnocchi we saw at other tables looked amazing. Will definitely branch out next time!
author: Ina T.

description:
My boo and I took a last minute adventure to North Beach and obviously we had to have pasta. Sodini's is super cute and intimate. The decor is exactly what I imagine a family Italian restaurant to look like - dimly lit and photos covering the walls. However, I just wish that the food was as good as I expected it to be! 

We got the Beef Tortellini Carbonara (white sauce with mushroom and pancetta) and the Gnocchi Nostri (meat sauce). Both dishes were just so-so. I think we expected a lot more out of an Italian restaurant in the heart of Little Italy. Both dishes were just so-so. We both agreed that the first couple of bites were the best. I liked the gnocchi alone, the meat sauce was interesting because it had a grainy consistency. The tortellini was good, but the flavors got too overwhelming and a bit too salty. I think the best part of my meal was probably the house salad..which is surprising because they had them premade - I could tell because my fork was icy cold when I got my dish. The dressing is garlicky and tasty - maybe not great for a date night, but I loved it so much that I asked for extra dressing.
author: Britney L.

description: So delicious! The sauces!!!! Really enjoyed this iconic Italian/American San Francisco atmosphere. Five of us ordered different entrees and each one was uniquely it's own flavor and style. I would be remiss not to mention the lady bartender who was so welcoming and just from the few minutes we hung at the bar waiting for our table could tell she brought a lot of personality to the place. I will definitely go back again.
author: J C.

description:
The service was excellent. Polite and with a smile. 
Gnocchi was amazing. The Gorgonzola sauce was so tasty. 
Everyone else loved their food too.
author: Panos G.

description:
Had a great meal while in SF for the Labor Day weekend.....(following Jimmy Buffet).
Our server Linda, a local, was great to talk to.  

Good local place, not so 'touristy' like so many other places.  Met some fun people there and they bought us drinks after we bought their drinks.  Good vibe here.
author: Toni E.

description:
My lady told me she loved this place. I skeptically made the plan for us to go try it out. I don't often frequent Italian places because I feel like I make better pastas at home. Wellll....

Quite pleasantly surprised to find an Italian spot with a good variety and twists on traditional classics. 

The people here were great. The waitress was amazing....friendly, knowledgeable, and funny. 

The ambiance was incredible...I mean classic randomness you'd want and expect from a family Italian spot. The crowd is diverse....a mix of dressed up marrief couples, first daters, casual hispters, amd local yuppies.  Essentially, everyone is welcome. 

If you're in the neighborhood. ..even if not...stop by, it's very worth it.
author: Sean M.

description:
It may had been what I ordered, but based upon most of the food I indulged in, I would certainly just give it a solid 3 stars.

A friend suggested this place and treated me here recently. I love the cozy, authentic Italian cafe atmosphere, and find that alone, extremely charming and classy- in a settle, non pretentious way. 

We got a nice (somewhat intimate) table a hop scotch away from the window. 

For drinks, we went with a carafe of the house red wine. It turned out to be just ok. 

For our main dishes, I went with the special- which was the salmon with pesto Linguine . It comes with your choice of soup or salad. I went with the soup which was the Minestrone soup. Friend went with a Pesto Tortellini. 

The minestrone soup was hearty, savory and overall fantastic tasting. Far more authentic tasting compared to your standard Italian restaurant. 

Salmon and tortellini arrived decent in presentation. My salmon was cooked to perfection however, it significantly lacked in flavor. I ended up having to use the good ol salt shaker quite a bit. The pesto was fresh tasting, though not as creamy as I prefer, not to mention there was certainly not enough to mesh  completely with the pasta. I tried some of my friends tortellini that was also just sub par. I also felt the salmon was way overpriced at $23. buckaroos. 

The service I will say, was very attentive and professional, which certainly was a plus. 

Overall, I think this place is incredibly cool as far as the environment goes. The service was on top. And even though I was less than impressed with our dishes, I still would love to have the opportunity to come back and try some of their other dishes.
author: Shannon H.

description:
1 star for amazing atmosphere 
1 star for Italian food you can eat daily. 
1 star for frank Sinatra. 
1 star for attentive bar staff and boisterous manager or owner who greets everyone who walks in. 
  

Thanks for being in business!

Charles
author: Charles P.

description:
Love!!!!!! YUM
Great food , funky, great atmosphere fun wait staff 
Loved it ....
It's gonna be my new place !!!
author: sherrry b.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!!! We eat here every time we are in SF. All of the food is amazing! Servers are sassy and roll their eyes but we love that part too!! Eat here as often as you can.....
author: Katie M.

description:
Authentic Italian Cuisine - YUM! This is one busy spot and understandably "no reservations" but it's worth the wait. The staff works hard and is super friendly and cheerful. The portions are quite large definitely feel like you are getting your money's worth. 
My husband and I share the Gnocchi Nostri and they were to die for...tiny pillows of heaven that melt in your mouth. For dinner, I had the veal scallopini and my husband had the NY steak. Both were superb and seasoned perfectly. I wasn't a fan of the marinara sauce on the linguini but the whole dinner was a perfect night out.
author: TJ C.

description: Definitely do NOT go here if you're vegan. Every single item on the menu is cooked in butter -- yuck! Worse, they didn't lift a finger to help. Most restaurants will talk to the chef to try to make something, but the server refused to even entertain that. This is just bad customer service, IMO.
author: Alec F.

description:
The food was awesome!!! Great pasta and great wine!
We are definitely coming back!
author: Diana G.

description:
Yummy food for your tummy. 
No kidding it's good stuff we were a big group so I get to try like 6 different pastas and I liked them all! My favorite had to be the seafood linguine 2nd favorite is the ravioli   

The waiter was nice enough to suggest orders and informs us of everything needed! 

You'll probably gonna end up seeing the owner he's such a nice guy go ahead and say hi! 

Side note: NO DESSERTS I don't know why but that's how it's.
author: Abdul A.

description: Ordered chicken Parmesan and it was very tough and brown, didn't see white meat and they might've given me the wrong meal by mistake or over cooked it. Subpar food overall but decent prices. Great atmosphere but again, food wasn't worth it.
author: Justin B.

description:
After 2 years of living here and trying out a handful of places, we have finally found our Italian cafe! We decided on the spur of the moment to try this place for dinner on a Tuesday night. We arrived around 7pm and the tiny place was packed. But we were greeted warmly by the bartender and we only waited 5 minutes for a table and got seated pretty close to the window, so I was happy. 

They bring bread out right way. It was good (not great) but the olive oil to dip it in was yummy. Their house red wine is very good. For dinner, I ordered the tortellini carbonara and my husband got the special, chicken piccata with pesto linguini. Oh man, both were SOOO delicious! The pasta was fresh and homemade and perfectly al dente. The chicken was flavorful and, well, I can't stopped dreaming about that tortellini with the mushrooms and pancetta and cream sauce. Party in my mouth!

Our server was great. Her name was Rachel and she said she's been there for 15 years. She was friendly and attentive. 

Sodini's has the feel and ambiance of a true little neighborhood gem. We can't wait to go back. Next time I want that little table in the window!
author: Tara M.

description: We had dinner here with my kids and some friends on Sunday, ordered three caesar salads and three pizza, the crust was heavy and the toppings were just ok.   Lots of tourist and it was busy, just had better pizza somewhere else.
author: pochini m.

description: Great atmosphere!!! Incredible staff. Very friendly. Food is fantastic. Great prices!!!! My new favorite! The owner greets you like family! The sopranos vibe and the New York feel is perfect!!!
author: Bill B.

description: There's a reason why this place is packed with locals. It's awesome. The food, the service...stellar. Mark set us up outside and met us all by asking our names and shaking our hands. Our server was Blaze and was the absolute  est. She went above and beyond. (There was a Snuggy involved with one in our party; thanks Blaze!) Also best was the gnocchi. Little potato pillows from heaven (actually imported from Italy.) Lasagna was equally In. Cred. Ible. I wish I could give this place more stars. Can't wait to come back.
author: Deborah S.

description:
Note, doesn't take reservations so be prepared to wait.  Even with that it was worth the wait.  The bartender is very observant and delivers great service and ensure you enjoy you wine. Excellent service overall

We had the bruschetta and the daily special grilled salmon with pesto.  They were both right on point. 

Brushetta was well toasted and the flavors added to the tomatoes just watered your mouth.

The salmon was big and me and wife were able to share and be completely full. Cooked to perfection with a Lil crust on the outside and tender from the inside.

With love of Sinatra in this room, id definitely come back.
author: Salim G.

description:
Authentic old school real Italian family restaurant! 
I had heard about how north beach was the epic real Italian neighborhood back in the day. I read about the italian north beach in "The Season of The Witch" book, that chronicles the history of San Francisco. I was amazed! Sidini's here is the real deal. A cool wine bar, Italian classy old tune songs, dark, cozy, candlelight and the waitress wore a cool shirt "Sidini's" in the logo of The Sopranos hbo show! The food is to die for! We ordered vegetarian pizza, cannoloni, fresh baked Italian bread, real balsamic with Italian Olive oil (its hard to find the real shit, and here it was!) Excellent service. Excellent family! This is definitely What heaven must be like!! Sodini's ROCKS!
author: Anna L.

description:
Wow! The wait is usually long and they don't take reservations.  We got lucky and were willing to sit outside,  so we got to skip the two hour wait. There was a heater outside, and though I'm normally cold, I was comfortable.  
Our group decided to order family style and got bruschetta, calamari, the seafood linguini, gnocchi with pesto, and chicken parmesan. The chicken came with a house salad that was loaded. It was great and big enough to share 4 ways. Both appetizers were amazing.   It came with a lot of calamari. Between the bread, and both appetizers we weren't starving for dinner.  

There was so much calamari on the seafood pasta, we thought it was tube noodles! The tomato cream sauce was delicious. The gnocchi had great flavor. The chicken parm was tender and delicious, though the linguini that came with it was nothing special. It was only $2 more than a pasta and came with the salad, so it was a good buy. 

The service was also really good. They were friendly even though they were really busy.

We would definitely eat here again. Great food at a reasonable price.
author: Amanda F.

description:
GO!  Just go!  We found Siding's about 5 years ago--every visit to SF has to have a dinner at Sodini's. Fun, family run place with great food. We have ordered just about everything on the menu and this last trip we ate there 2/5 nights.  Great for date night, or friends and family.
Mark is the best--Blaise, Erin--friendly and fun--and GREAT food. Order of pitcher of Chianti and the rest is history! Manga!
author: Trixie V.

description: My husband and I wanted authentic, off-the-beaten-path Italian food in North Beach. Upon entering, we were immediately treated as family by the bartender. She chatted with us while we waited for a table and recommended food choices once we told her part of our family is Italian. The creamy Gorgonzola gnocchi and side of meatballs were impeccable! It all tasted just as fresh and flavor-filled as our family's cooking. My fav part - the wine choices are red or white! That's my kind of restaurant. 100% will return next time we are in town. Thank you, Sodinis, for an unforgettable experience!
author: Caitlyn N.

description: Best Italian food in San Francisco. No frills food. You are greeted at the door by a sopranos look a like which completely sets the tone for  a truly authentic family owned restaurant experience. The food is amazing and the drinks are strong. Two thumbs up.
author: Melissa R.

description:
It was a chilly night and we were given a table outside. Once they realized we had two little boys with us they offered to find a table for us inside. No attitude at all!
The food was fantastic, they catered to our young boys and made us all feel at home. 
I will not stop dreaming of the lasagna until I make my way back to S.F. to partake again.
author: Amy S.

description:
Came to Sodini's on Nov 8 with a few friends. Had the bruschetta - so good, I imagine it's even better when tomatoes are in season - and the penne baked with mozzarella and tomato sauce, which was very tasty.

Long wait, but it was a Saturday night. Service was excellent.

Would definitely come back again.
author: Corinne L.

description: we ordered linguini with clams, gnocchi gargonzola, tortellini carbonara for the 4 of us and it WAS LITERALLY BOMB  the gnocchi tastes like food pillows and the carbonara is just great if you like cream  SO GOOOOD we forgot to take photos before eating
author: Selina L.

description: For classic Italian food along with a staff that makes you feel like family, this is the place to go!  Upon reading yelp reviews, we were prepared for a wait on a Saturday night - it is worth it. We couldn't have been happier with the service and taste of the food.  Will definitely return every time we are in the city. Highly recommended!!!
author: Cheri B.

description:
If I could leave zero stars, I would. 

Please consider elsewhere before spending your money at Sodini's. Before even getting the opportunity to sit down and enjoy a meal here, we were made to feel so uncomfortable and disrespected we left. If you don't have time to read, check out Colosseo just right down the road instead. Otherwise, here you go. 

My girlfriend and I were in North Beach looking to get some great Italian when we came upon Sodini's on Green St. The menu looked perfect and it didn't look to busy outside, so we stopped inside to try and get a table. We walked inside and it was fairly lively, but two tables were open and there weren't any signs as to whether we were supposed to seat ourselves or wait for a hostess. After a minute of waiting and a failed attempt at getting the bartender's attention, my girlfriend went over to one of the open tables where a gentleman was cleaning to find out if there was a list we needed to put on, or if we should just sit down.

I remained standing close to the bar, where you first walk in, just in case a waitress or hostess emerged to help seat us. This is when shit hit the fan. A waitress walked over to the line that was beginning to form, grabbed what I presume was the wait list, and if looks could kill, my girlfriend would have dropped dead on the spot. In the most rude and snide voice I've heard from a waitress in a long time, she said out loud (not knowing that who she was talking about was my girlfriend), "Um, what is she doing? Who is that? She can't do that." 

I told her, "She's trying to see how to get a table." The waitress chimed again, full volume, "She needs to get back here. What is she doing." When my girlfriend came over, the waitress saidvin an incredibly rude voice (I really can't stress this enough), with her eyebrows arched, "Um, can I help you?" We told her, again, we were simply trying to get a table. I'm not sure if she misunderstood me and thought I was trying to rob the place, but as defensive as possible, embarrassing my girlfriend in front of everyone, we were told there was a 20 minute wait, and we'd have to wait our turn. At this time, another waitress came by and told us to "get out of the way." We were literally standing in the only spot you could stand and try and get help. 

That's when I lost it. We were fully prepared for a big night out, on vacation, to get a nice meal, order drinks and tip well. I told the bartender to take us off the list, but that I wanted to personally tell the waitress that it was because of her that we were leaving. What would a normal customer service reaction be in this situation? "Oh, no, don't leave! I'm so sorry you're upset." Nope. Her eyebrows shot up, her face got squished, and she was bewildered we'd want to tell the woman who embarrassed us that we were leaving. 

When the first girl came back, I told her what happened. I told her that my girlfriend had stepped outside from embarrassment and didn't feel comfortable staying because of how we had just been treated. Suddenly, she was defensive. She very un-genuinely apologetic and said she was "just confused" and we shouldn't leave. No, in reality, she didn't realize that when she was talking aloud about my girlfriend getting a table, that she literally said it TO the person she was with. The mean face she shot the random guy waiting in line? Yeah, I was with her. I was very clear -- you do not talk to customers like that, and that I was dumbfounded in how she had made us feel. 

Never in my life have I encountered such a hostel experience trying to get a table. Here's a few tips, as I have too run a kitchen, worked in an Italian restaurant, managed a kitchen, worked as a server and felt the rush that can happen all day every day in a restaurant: 

1. Don't talk badly about customers to other customers. You don't know who they may be with. 

2. Your face and voice say more than your voice ever will. I won't pretend to remember verbatim how our exchange went, but the gist of it was just plain mean, rude and uncalled for. If you aren't at the door to greet the line of customers waiting for you, and it's too hard to put up a single sign that says "wait to be seated," don't be surprised if - god forbid - someone attempts to figure out how to get a table. Arching your eyebrows, getting a tone and saying, "Um, what is SHE doing?" like someone just spit on your shoes is a bit uncalled for. 

We ended up leaving and waking down the street to Colosseo. Absolutely stunning meal. The service, from the second we walked up outside, was nothing but warm and inviting. They started giving us recommendations on the spot. The meal was top notch and everyone from the greeter, to our server, to the gentleman who refilled our drinks was kind, warm and thankful. It was a great experience. 

Skip this place. Eat at Colosseo. It's not worth giving your money to a place that disrespects your date before you even have a chance to order.
author: Joe W.

description:
Had great Italian food while watching the Republican convention on Fox News.

Excellent service and a good choice of traditional Italian meals. Highly recommended. The only negative is that parking is a nightmare. But this restaurant makes it worth the effort.
author: Gary S.

description:
I had friends in from Honolulu and wanted them to try a family style Italian restaurant.  The service was out of the world...felt bad because we all wanted to talk before we looked at the menu.

I don't think anyone of us was disappointed with our meal.  What I love is that the owners are coming around the table and they are there making sure everything is done right.
author: Stephanie C.

description: One of the best meals and more- the service, experience, vibe and ambience cannot be beaten! A special shout out to our server, Erin, who not only gave us the BEST care but also got our taxi at the end of the night. And, Casey pours the best and strongest drinks in town. Perhaps the best thing-- the people want to work there so it feels like eating in someone's home. We'll be back and back and back. Thank you, everyone!
author: Gayle M.

description:
You have to embrace the over-the-top Scorcese (and Soprano's) atmosphere and just enjoy Sodini's family welcome and their family style, red sauce Italian food.  This is a red checker-cloth place with veal to its credentials.  

We couldn't have been more pleased by how we were treated and the quality of the food.  They have a pride of place and position in North Beach.  Go here with confidence and enthusiasm if you're looking for old school family southern Italian.
author: Doug M.

description: Had dinner here last week and would have left without writing a review (food and everything was that uneventful) but just could not believe how rude and classless Ana was behind the bar. She told every group of people that walked into the restaurant that there was a wait (fair) but told each of them a different time (what's the purpose for that?). Families with kids were told the longest wait (we were quoted 2 hours).  We almost left but sat outside for a minute because 1) there was clearly no line worthy of 2 hours....only one family waited before us and 2) we just had our Uber drop us off and needed to formulate a new plan. The family that waited before us was pretty fed up as they had been waiting 20 minutes and had witnessed lots of different wait times quoted. So they left and let us use their reservation. So we waited another 10 minutes and witnessed the same before and after being sat. Many people that came during our dinner left announcing how rude Anna was to them. The wait staff was super nice and caring and I feel like if their livelihood is in Anna's hands that's a pretty crappy place to be. Food was mediocre and won't be making a trip here again.
author: Kathy B.

description: In town for a girls weekend and came upon this place on a Friday night. Warm welcome. Great service. Delicious food. Owner made a table full of sisters (family not nun :) ) feel very special.  Cheers!
author: Amy M.

description: This family-owned Italian restaurant is so damn good. Went there on a Saturday around 5 and sat outside. Our waitress Rachel was super friendly and gave us great service. It was quiet and relaxing. We got the calamari, which is easily the best calamari I have ever had. We also got the gnocchi and the lasagne, which were both absolutely perfect. I highly recommend this place. We will be going back many times. Five stars.
author: Kat R.

description: This is the place you should stop by if you visit North Beach.  Great things happen here!  If you love Italian food then this is the place to eat at.
author: Marc Lee R.

description:
I came here with a large group for my birthday and we ended up waiting an hour and a half for a table (which I was not super excited about). However, the host was so awesome and continued to check in with us and even sent us a few free orders of bruschetta as we waited. The bruschetta was absolutely delicious. Super flavorful and fresh.

After we were seated, we were so hungry that we basically ordered half the menu. It was most definitely worth the wait. Every single plate we ordered was delicious. Pesto tortellini and gnocchi were the favorites! 

Tips:

Do not go with a large group. It's a small restaurant and definitely made for smaller parties.

Go early! They don't take reservations.
author: Laura M.

description: Great food. Great service. Great ambiance. The best Italian restaurant in SF bar none ! Just please stop over cooking the pasta.
author: Patrick D.

description:
Excellent classic neighborhood Italian joint. It isn't fancy but it is very friendly! It gets crowded though on a Thursday night it wasn't completely full but still brimming with energy.

The house salad is very tasty (and may be on the heavier side of dressing for some people) but still a good sized serving in general. The seafood linguini is a hefty portion and generous with the squid (and seafood in general). The sauce is a tomato cream. I think Sotto Mare is better but this place has a worthy contender.

I'd definitely come back here again for a no-frill Italian dinner.
author: Victor W.

description: A group of 7 of us stumbled upon this establishment during dinnertime on Saturday evening. The owner shuffled around some tables to accommodate us right away. We ordered the calamari as an appetizer. It was fantastic! I usually don't like calamari but it was just perfect as were the sauces it was served with. For dinner, I had the caprese salad and the Gorgonzola Mushroom Gnocchi. IT WAS HEAVEN! I will be dreaming about them as they are pillowy, marshmallowy and stuffed with amazing goodness. The gorgonzola sauce was to DIE for. Everyone else loved their food as well. Sodini's was such a gem to find and I will for sure be returning in the very near future!
author: Kailie Y.

description: So great! Authentic dishes and attentive service. Cozy space and great food so make a reservation to get a seat. We were celebrating a special occasion and the owner even visited our table and gave us a complimentary bottle of wine! Highly recommend
author: Erin C.

description:
Absolutely delicious Italian food! Well prepared, good portions and wait time for the food was not bad at all. Decent wine selection and a full bar. The staff were all very friendly and attentive. We arrived about 5:30 on a Saturday and got seated right away, but it did start to fill up pretty quick after about 6. The place is loud, crowded and casual. It's like dining with some good Italian friends or family! If you're looking for a quiet, romantic place to have dinner, this ain't it! But, if you're looking for a nice, casual, unpretentious place with a lively atmosphere to enjoy some yummy Italian food, then this is the place! I just found my favorite Italian restaurant!

Simple, delicious Italian food and a great atmosphere. What more could you want?
author: Charles M.

description: We stopped in without a reservation with a party of 5 at 7pm on a Wednesday evening and were seated promptly. The service was fast and friendly. We split a pitcher of wine amongst the table. I have never had wine served from a pitcher but the wine was not bad and the price was right for it. Warm bread was served with the wine. I did not eat but the rest of the party did enjoy their food very much. I would happily return to this restaurant, definitely with a bigger appetite next time!
author: Alexa L.

description: You could defiantly tell that this place was family owned very welcoming and sweet. Romantic dim lighting and a sweet little candle on every table. Our waitress was incredibly sweet. The food was amazing. We will for sure be back on our next vacation.
author: Haley H.

description: Looking at the reviews it is either  great or terrible.  We liked the restaurant.  Started with their deep fried calamari.  It was lightly  breaded and the sauce went well  together.  We had their  seafood with linguine.  Everything  was very fresh . Unfortunately  they are not open for lunch
author: Tony K.

description: Get the bar booth if it's available and you'll feel like old school royalty. I like the veal parmigiana personally and haven't had many other things. It can get busy so you'll have to be patient.
author: J C.

description: dark bar coupled with restaurant right behind the bar was very cool! Linda was a great waitress whom I talked to about things not at all related to the restaurant,food and area....but we did that too! I was here for a trade show so called my friend in Larkspur who knew the city well and he recommend this place is "staple" Italian that was NOT expensive! he was correct! The Caesar salad was really good! The seafood and linguine with white sauce was quite good.....the veal in mushroom sauce was a little tough but doable.....Overall I really enjoyed the place.Old school bathroom you can barely fit in with a door that barely closes and you can see out of urban you gotta love it 100 year old restaurant feel and I loved it! Linda was the best feature for me! My friend i was with scarfed it all down pretty fast and enjoyed it as well!
author: Brian D.

description:
My wife & I made our second trip to this CLASSIC on our honeymoon. Wow! It has a great old school neighborhood joint feel. The bar area is tight, but you get to mingle with the friendly staff and "The Regulars". The food is incredible and by all means try to get the window tables.
This joint will be forever on the rotation whenever we roadie to the Bay Area. Love it!!!
author: Mike H.

description: I was born here.  North Beach is sacred to me. And in a disappearing San Francisco, I honor & cherish places that revere this history. Hey man Scott Wiener -- if it ain't broke don't fix it. So I returned to a North Beach spot that has been a restaurant I visited back in '95. There's always been a restaurant here on this spot since at least 100 years. I dig the extremely knowledgable & very cool bartender --she is GREAT!! I loved the soup -- they'd make more money if people could order a cup of soup or small salad with the pasta courses, as well as the Secondi meat courses. Not everyone eats meat so why not offer them soup or small salad? if you want to try several dishes, it makes sense to offer a small salad or soup to anyone. If you ask, they'll accommodate but many folks might not ask.
author: Scott F.

description: Lasagna was delicious, service outstanding, Linda our waitress has a great personality, made us feel right at home, like we were part of the family, two thumbs up!!
author: Tom L.

description: Very cool atmosphere! The history is real here. Bartender was great and full of life. Wine is good and foods even better! You may have to wait a bit for an outside table but so worth it...be patient!
author: Randi C.

description:
Sodini's is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city! Their calamari and gnocchi are the best I've ever had. The bruschetta is also delicious and tastes fresh. Just some truly delicious food here. You have to try it!

Tip: I would not recommend Sodini's if you're eating with a large group because the restaurant is not very large.
author: Michelle L.

description: Great food and service, I loved the place, it has good waiting time, quality food and good environment
author: Sophia A.

description: Came to this place 4 dinner last week.  My first time here. We ask how long is the wait n they say 20 mins. By the time we got seated is 1 hr!!! N we ask waiter why we had to wait sooo long n he always say u r next...meanwhile people dat came after us were seated first!!! Never again will i come  back here n i will tell all my friends to go some place else!!!
author: Al L.

description:
Poor safety alert on Yelp posted when we arrived, but we went for it and glad we did. Plenty of locals here and the fresh clearly homemade pasta was heavenly!  No desserts offered and did not need one.   I thought the garlic bread was my dessert. The Chianti was very good too. My wife had Gorgonzola Gnocchi which was just the right balance of flavors. I has basil pesto tortellini... tasty as well. Solid friendly service. Just visiting so this will be my only visit... too bad. 

Edit... They recommended we have desert around the corner at several places. We chose Stella's Pastry and it was great. Nice to have lovely dinner and try another establishment for dessert. It's all so close by... Makes the experience that much better!
author: Tom I.

description:
Traditional Italian place in North Beach a little off the beaten path. Has been around for over 100 years and definitely has an older feel, pictures on the wall, Italian family, etc. If you don't get there early, you'll definitely wait. 

They're known for their fried calamari and although I don't like fish of any kind, I like these a lot. Anything on the menu is probably great, but my personal favorite is the pesto gnocchi. They're little "pillows" filled with spinach and ricotta. Different than any gnocchi I've had and the pesto is perfect - not too strong or oily. Everything my family has gotten has been delicious as well. 

Definitely would recommend and take my friends here!
author: Katie G.

description: Wow, I don't like that the food safety alert popped up on this place after we ate there. However, everything we ate was delicious!! Lasagna, calamari, tortellini carbonara was excellent! It's a cute, cozy little spot and love that they have a bar area. Pitcher of wine was great to! Service was excellent!!
author: Monica B.

description:
My friends and I met here for dinner and had such a nice evening .. We got to sit in a dark romantic corner booth, ordered two bottles of wine, shared mussels and clams, caesar salad and the gnocchi with pesto . The music was perfect.. Our waitress was wonderful! The bartender was wonderful! .. And our handsome host made us feel like we were part of the family . 
The the way an old style Italian restaurant should feel.
author: Noe'lle M.

description: Got linguini with meatballs.  Wasn't all that good.. also took about an hour and a half to get it. Service is really slow.  If you go there get the linguini with some sort of seafood because nothing else is too special.  If I could give it 3 and a half stars I would.  The poor service and mediocre meatballs makes me edge this place closer to a 3 rather than a 4.
author: Kevin L.

description: We were visiting and got a recommendation to have dinner here. Great choice! Mark the owner was very nice and recommended the lasagne. It was awesome. Definitely try it out
author: James F.

description: Love this place. We were a party of 4. I had the lasagna which was a mound of cheesy heaven. The red sauce is one of the best I have ever had. Linguini and mussels was also very good. Linguini and meatballs awaesome. The meatballs had great flavor. Meat and cheese ravioli were also very good. The atmosphere is quaint and full of energy. Our waitress Linda Luna suggested our meals and she was spot on. Thank you Linda for a great experience. This place was packed when we arrived. The host took my name and phone number and called me when the table was ready. Gave us a chance to check out one of the local pub across the street. We will definitely see u again. Prices were very reasonable. $124 for the meal which included 7 drinks from the bar.
author: Michelle C.

description:
Sodini's is a very cozy Italian restaurant on Green St in North Beach with Rat Pack pictures all over the place. Imagine the movie "Good Fella's" and you are walking into a restaurant and everyone knows you.  The place was crowded. We visited at 6:15pm on a Saturday night and 5 minutes later a half hour wait prevailed.  
 
The pasta dishes run the price of $12.95 to $18.95 with the meat dishes running more. I ordered the lasagna and while the sauce was very good I felt that it was lacking meat and spinach. They made up for it with lots of cheese which I could give or take. Very good Italian food but the dressing on the salad is primero, it is enough for two people to split and the waitress highly recommended it.

I didn't have wine but it appears they have an extensive wine list and a fully stocked bar. Peroni's were $6.00...Ouch!!

Sodini's serves all of the Italian favorites and the service was excellent.
author: Jim D.

description: Just had a little Valentine's  dinner at the bar and it was great. Old school Italian fare, with a cool low-key but classy atmosphere. Lots of fun old rat pack paraphernalia. The service was fast and super friendly. The Caesar salad was fresh and crisp and perfectly dressed, and our pasta dishes were rich and delicioso. The bartender and servers were fun and friendly. Just the kind of experience I travel to north beach for. Nothing too fancy, but simple authentic and well-executed. Worth checking out if you want a neighborhood experience for sure.
author: Leslie H.

description: i had to wait an entire year to come back to this amazing restaurant since I live in SoCal so coming here isn't as easy as jumping in the car and swinging by for a quick dinner. But my cravings were too strong so we flew up for the weekend just to satisfy my craving! Boy oh boy did they not disappoint! The food here is literally the best thing EVER! As an Italian my standards are incredibly high. This place knocks every other Italian place out of the water!!! Go here NOW!!! My favorite is the Gnocchi Gorgonzola...DEATH!!! I'm drooling just typing this!
author: Heather P.

description: Stopped by here during a recent trip to SF.  I loved this place.  As a Sinatra fan, I really enjoyed the ambiance.  In terms of their food, they served me by far the best lasagna that I have ever had!  The wait staff was nice and friendly.  Definitely one of the best places I got to eat at while in SF.
author: Mike V.

description: Great food, great atmosphere and awesome Italian owner. Come by and try it out it doesn't disappoint!
author: Asen A.

description:
Stopped in after a Coit Tower Sunset with my daughter and my nice (both 19). We loved the city feel (we're from NYC originally) and the atmosphere was festive in an old world sort of way... The food was reliably good. 

Nothing fancy here guys... very decent homestyle Northern Italian fare. My daughter had the Chicken a la Sodini, which was basically spaghetti with red gravy, and a chicken cutlet with a creamy, cheesy sauce... she enjoyed it and the preceding house salad, which we all shared. My niece had ravioli with meat sauce and I had lasagna. The lasagna was a bit soupy... but tasty.  We started with Bruscetta, which we enjoyed, but it was on the amateur side for some reason. I know that's an odd thing to say... but that's what I was thinking.

Basically, it was sliced italian bread that was NOT grilled with olive oil and garlic (which is the oops part) but the topping was lovely... so forgivable... and we were starving. Caprese salad we also had was very nice, but needed a bit of salt and pepper or maybe an interesting olive oil. I've seen rave reviews of all of this here... and it's either a case of folks who aren't accustomed to home made Italian or the kitchen was off.

Like i said, we absolutely enjoyed every meal... but it wasn't "oh, that's yummy!" if you get my meaning.

The wait staff was wonderful and really attentive. All in all... just what we needed.

I was kind of surprised that they didn't have anything for after. No espresso, no sweets. Not that we had room for this... but it struck me as odd. It was my first time in North Beach, and I'm sure if we hadn't been so full... and there late on a weeknight, we could have found some italian pastry somewhere on Green Street if we had tried.

I will go again, because I'd really like to try the pizza...
author: Rosie S.

description:
good food, good prices (including very reasonably priced wine), good service

we had the gnocchi pesto and tortellini carbonara - the former was "the best"; the latter was great if you do not want thick carbonara sauce - this one was light but could have had a bit more spice

the only drawback here if you're not in the neighborhood is, of course, parking in North Beach

i think they gave up the "Green Valley" name ages ago - have returned over the years and will hasten the next visit
author: S K.

description: The service was excellent but food was mediocre. It was missing seasoning. The environment is cozy.
author: Michael A.

description: We tried Sodini's on vacation and were given a warm welcome upon arrival. Friendly staff, great food and fun Italian atmosphere. We did the tortellini alla panna and penne con gamberi, both of which we recommend to others.
author: Daniel S.

description:
Hey, Lady, the Tramp called. He wants to try again, this time at Sodini's Green Valley Restaurant. And you're both gonna love it!

But, instead of spaghetti, I suggested that you order the manicotti. Sure, it's not as romantic as sharing spaghetti, but Sodini's baked manicotti is so perfect (the crucial crisp edges!), you'll never even think about twirling those strands again.

So, this is what I'm talking about! Straight-up, old school Italian American fare done right and down right delicious. 

Romantic? As hell! 
Check it:

--ambiance, just as you'd expect and it seems like it's been there forever, two intimate rooms, one with a bar, incredibly cozy, with all the Italian accoutrements we're so familiar with, including the ever-present framed black and white shots of patrons.
-checkered table cloths (well, maybe they were white linens. Doesn't matter cuz they were red checkered in spirit).
-no sugar in the sauce, no need, cuz your sugar is across the table from you!
-the perfect glass of Chianti... better yet, share a bottle! You deserve it.

Great food. Friendly service. An outdoor patio if that's your thing. It ain't fancy by any stretch, but you can't buy romance, Lady!
author: Joi B.

description: We went here on a whim, and it was worth it. The drinks are stiff, the food is great, the staff is friendly, and it's really clean. The place is smallish, but don't let that stop you. You can even draw on the table!
author: Josh S.

description:
We went there tonight the 4th july. It got a good number of stars on a few sites and plus it was convenient for us.  Nice atmosphere and busy.  But the food was mediocre at best.I ordered lasagne. It was just an over cheesy mess I barely tasted any pasta. My wife had the gnocchi and the pesto sauce wasn't good. 
Kids didn't like the cheese pizza and they always like pizza. I hate when I hear waitresses say " oh the gnocchi or lasagne or whatever is to die for." And then it's just not worth dying for at all.  It's just your average American Italian fare and over cheesed.
author: Allen W.

description:
Wonderful little hole in the wall, old-school Italian place. The service was great...warm, friendly, and fun. My gnocchi gorgonzola was creamy and delicious, beautifully textured. My friend said her gnocchi with pesto was great, too. 

It got busy while we were there, but the waitress never made us feel rushed...we were able to enjoy our wine after we'd finished our meal. If you're looking for comfort food, I'd definitely go here.
author: Jenn W.

description: If in San Fransico you have to do this place.   It's a hole in the wall with awesome food and a better atmosphere.      It's a must so.
author: Dave L.

description:
Great service old style, felt a bit like family being here. The wait wasn't too bad and I thought all of the food was damn good, my gf had the pepper steak and I had a linguine with a creme mushroom sauce and some spinach on the side mmmm

I would also like to note they were really nice and didn't charge us a corkage fee for some wine we brought in, that was very cool of them and I'll be back!
author: Christopher Steven O.

description:
This is by FAR the nicest group of people I've ever come across! The bartender is the sweetest :) and she makes you feel right at home!!

Food was excellent....very rich and fresh. (Bread could use some work though.) Food service was a little ....hectic, crazy, slow? But my overall positive experience was from the superbly kind bartender!
author: Chelsie D.

description:
I think I follow the right people on Yelp ;)

I decided to take their advice and come here instead of the Stinking Rose/ Steps of Rome. We called in advance and was told we didn't need reservations for a Thursday night and we were seated within 20 minutes. 

Their sourdough bread isn't anything special but their olive oil is spectacular! Don't taint it with their basalmic vinegar! Their wine is excellent! Valpolicella. 

I opted for the angel hair pasta and asked for it arrabiata with meat. It tasted home made and traditional without risking being "simple" or bland. I felt a little bit like Julia in Eat Pray Love, savoring every bite and I finished it ALL! Even the garlic bread that the dish comes with (doused in butter but in a good way) 

Yes, the artwork in the bathrooms adds a lot of character ;) 

Would be nice if they had freshly grated parmesan but this place isn't "fancy" like that.. nor does it pretend to be!
author: Kathy S.

description:
We went here for a dinner with five people in total.
Our server Erin was very friendly and gave us all good solid recommendations for both food and wine.
We all had a great time and Erin really made us feel like regulars. Check this place out, you will not leave feeling hungry.
author: Alan R.

description: This place is awesome! The food is fantastic, everything have lots of flavor! Authentic Italian food. The only reason I'm giving them a 4 stars, is because they don't serve desserts. Bummer
author: Mayra N.

description:
This place is small and it can get very cramped, come before the dinner rush that starts around 5:30

The staff is super awesome and the food is always exactly what you need.  This place is no frills, home style italian food-great customer service and they hustle out there to make sure they are on point always.  My favorite is the mussels here:) yum so good!

Warning I suggest you don't eat all day and save your only meal of the day for here because you will probably ingest over 2,000 calories....but it's all worth it.
author: Diana D.

description: This place rocks.  It's a great neighborhood bar to grab a drink or dinner.  The bartenders are sweet and the owner, Mark, is THE Italian stallion.  He is gorgeous and knows how to treat his customers well.  I would recommend this place to anyone!
author: Chris L.

description:
Reservations needed, the bar where folks wait for their tables gets packed, packed, packed! 

Excellent food and warm ambiance, though the dining floor is just as loud and bustling as the bar. The staff are welcoming and very nice. 

Love the gnocchi and have it every time we go. Highly recommended. 

No parking! Don't try to come to North Beach in a car if there is a parade downtown. We had to cancel one time because there simply was no where to park.
author: Cassie H.

description: Good vibe, like hanging with Tony Soprano. Crowded room, a bit noisy. Friendly service. Basic tourista Italian fare, nothing special. Enjoyed it overall.
author: Rick P.

description: Rachel was fantastic. The food was authentic, delicious, and filling. Best Italian restaurant in north beach. Will most certainly be coming back whenever in the neighborhood.
author: Jenna C.

description: Great Italian restaurant in  North Beach. Super friendly service. I came in with a stroller and the waitress accommodated me right away. This place has been operating for 100+years. The food is out of its world. We had a cheese pizza and pasta with chicken. The crust in the pizza is so good. Sodini Rocks!
author: Macky G.

description: This place is just wonderful.  I have been here several times for lunch in a private party, and then of course for dinner.  The food is consistently great, I have never had a bad thing here, so go ahead and explore the menu.  The wait staff Is great, friendly and willing to help you with any of your needs, the bartender has a great smile, and a bit of an attitude, that will make you smile
author: Paul G.

description:
It's standard Italian food. Not that great at all compared to all the other options. It's overpriced too - $15 for calamari?! $15-20 for basic pasta dishes?

We got a pizza and were disappointed. The crust is pretty bad, but they did put lots of toppings and cheese.
author: Phil D.

description: Authentic Italian restaurant.  Great pizza & rigatoni.  We ordered thin, which was perfect.  Bread served while you wait.  Great wine.  Feels like NY little Italy!
author: Kristen H.

description: I don't usually write reviews but this place is terrible! The food is okay but the service is awful. We had to wait for the waitress to get our orders then we had to wait forever for the food to come. The worst part is that we even have to wait to get our check! We had to even look for our waitress so that she can process our payments. It was the most ridiculous service i have ever had! Needless to say i will not be coming back here even if it's free.
author: Kathy H.

description: As I walked into this establishment,  a few locals walked out  and I asked them what to expect. They responded saying,  "amazing, get the seafood linguini." With this in mind, I ditched the place next door and got a table with my family. I got the seafood  linguini and it blew me away. Best seafood linguini I have ever had. It's a very relaxed atmosphere with authentic cuisine. Don't order the stereotypical Italian food like meatballs. Highly recommend this place
author: Randy K.

description:
This place is amazing. A small hole in the wall place with a big first impression. I've been there twice, and can't stop raving about their lasagna, it's the best I've ever had. The place is small and kinda dark, staff are very friendly, and helpful, but the chef in freakin amazing. Seems like everything that comes out of his kitchen is legit.. this guy knows how to cook.. Wow!!
Anytime I travel to the bay, this is always going to be a place I stop and have dinner, for sit down and to go, because I can't get enough.
author: Dave C.

description: I went into Sodini's on the first, for dinner. It was close and I was hungry. It was very dim inside, and the place was pretty full so I decided to try it. It was mediocre. My salad that came was very large and slightly over dressed. I barely had time to take a few bites before my entree arrived. I don't even think it was what I ordered but I didn't want to complain. It was okay... I ordered the chicken in cream sauce and got chicken with a thick slice of slightly melted mozzarella on top with a side of pasta. The best part of my meal was the pasta and bread. I don't think I'll go back. The bar server was nice though.
author: Kelley S.

description: Good Italian food, had Gnocchi with Gorgonzola, chicken parmigiana, chicken breast.. Very tasty! Minestrone soup & bruschetta were good. The Polenta was medium.. Very friendly staff!
author: Kostin D.

description:
So,

I live in union so wanted to get some pasta as the wife did the grocery shopping earlier and came home with nothing edible.

No reservations is great, so you have a decent chance to find a table. 1 Star
People are nice and it is loud so you feel like you are eating out. if you like that ambience.

The wine is cheap and sucks, one level above chateau Diana "wine product"
I mean when you go to Trader joes and buy the cheapest bottle for 4.99 it tastes better than the $9 glass of wine they give you. My wife blurted out, taste this, it tastes like "cheap wine". Order beer is all I can say.

The pasta, this is not a fresh pasta place. The pasta tastes does not taste fresh.
Mine was the seafood linguini and it tasted like it was store quality.

The sauce, it tasted like canned tomato + some cream.
Her pesto sauce looked like one you get in whole foods. Dark from storage and too oily.
When you make fresh pesto it looks very light pretty green for 30 minutes before it starts turning. So this was not fresh.

I had the sea-food linguini
My wife had the pesto gnocci
I had the pinot grigio  {bad}
She had the pinot noir  {very bad}
