The portions are huge so I'll give it another 1 star for being cost efficient.
You can come in.
Order one appetizer, one main  and you both come out full.
For dessert you have to go somewhere else.
I suggest the cafe's they have excellent Tiramisu.

This is my second time there.
I thought maybe first time it was me.
But turns it, it is not me.
I won't be coming back.
I hope you don't go there either.
Cook at home or go elsewhere. 

Ciao.
author: Saar H.

description:
I don't usually write reviews but this place requires me to write a great review. 

We came early and beat the crowd. 

Service was great. The servicers were fast and friendly.  Cleaned dirty dishes fast and food brought was hot and fresh. 

Food was so delicious.  Had the carbonara, fish, NY steak. Everything was so good and cooked to perfection. 

Will definitely be back for more!
author: K W.

description:
Review about 10 months overdue but had a great time with my wife enjoying good drinks and excellent food.  Mark Sodini the owner goes out of his way to take great care of his customers.  The staff is great, food very tasty and generously plated (served).

Enjoyed the Fritto Misto appetizer, linguine di mare and world class lasagna.
author: Omar G.

description:
The sign on the window is so funny: No reservation. No dessert. At least the restaurant tells you upfront about the restrictions.

You can easily miss this restaurant on Green Street. However, this is a wonderful place to go to if you are in the Little Italy area. 

Seating is very tight. There are around 15 tables and a sit-down bar area. 

The free bread was a disappointment as it wasn't warm and was regular plain white bread. Nothing special. You can use rosemary infused olive oil and balsamic vinegar provided on the table for a dip.

The food is delicious!!! 

Appetizer: Fried calamari with the garlic aioli and cocktail sauce - MmmM.. the calamari was fresh and the lightly coated batter was perfect. Well worth the $15! This is a popular appetizer as most tables ordered it.

Main Entrees:
Seafood Linguine- Wow! There were clams, shrimp, calamari, and mussels in the dish. The seafood was really fresh, and it was in a light tomato cream sauce. My mom and sister shared this dish, and the chef split the platter into two smaller plates. What a great touch!

Tortellini with mushroom and pancetta- MMmMm.. my favorite dish of the night. The cream sauce was rich and so yummy. The mushroom and pancetta gave the dish the earthy and salty flavors. The tortelini was cooked well too. Great dish.

Gnocchi in pesto sauce- We called the dumplings "little pillows" since they were shaped like that. SO cute! The gnocchi wasn't bad. Not quite as fluffy though. The pesto sauce was pretty thick.

Service was okay. We didn't see our waitress that much since the restaurant was extremely busy.

Definitely come to this restaurant to experience southern Italian food!
author: Jackie S.

description: I had the margherita pizza and my boyfriend had the meatball linguine which were both terrible, and to top it off, the server was extremely rude. I'm surprised this place has 4 stars overall. Would not recommend it.
author: Ani A.

description:
Love this spot! This is my go to when Im in North beach. 
Had the lasagna as always with a Manhattan. Nice little restaurant, nice wait staff and Great food.... what more could you ask for!
author: Travis R.

description:
This place is really sweet. Perfect atmosphere. And at least 4 stars, if not 5 on the gnocchi!! Our waitress was really nice, and the wine was decent and generously poured.

Would've been 4 stars, except the bread was kinda stale and could have been from Safeway, and there's no dessert!?
author: Jennifer F.

description:
Your typical neighborhood amazingly awesome classic Italian joint.

Most U.S. cities with some exposure to the outside world have their version of Sodini's- A classic, moderately priced Italian place burdened with a slightly irritating wait times but boasting extremely tasty pastas and dishes without the stuffy environment. It's that gem of an Italian restaurant that helps you realize that you were a fool to suffer places like Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill for so long, and trust me- once you've eaten food at Sodini's, you'll never look at Olive Garden the same way ever again. 

Taste- 9/10
The taste is both out of this world and traditional; the chefs at Sodini's seem to have a level of reverence and respect for pasta and sauces that modernized cuisine lacks. 

Price- 7.5/10
Prices are what you'd expect at every great, non formal Italian place: $10-20

Chances are, you've been to a place like Sodini's before. For a Socal native like myself, my Sodini's is a nice little place called Pomodoro in West L.A. It's a place that isn't necessarily a must see, but a restaurant choice you'll never regret.
author: Eugene P.

description: Atmosphere is neighborhood Italian. Seems to be fewer tourists and more locals.  Good-but not that good.  Pizza was good.  No cioppino on the menu which is lame for north beach.  They have something sort of close ish which is highly mediocre.  Service was just ok.
author: Colonel M.

description: We were told the lasagne was 'ethereal' from another patron waiting to be seated so we had to order it. Don't get me wrong, it was good, but to me, short of ethereal. I also had minestrone, house salad, while my company had spaghetti and meatballs. Service was excellent, food was good, ambience was fun.
author: Eureka P.

description:
Very Nice little restaurant in North Beach!

Originally we were not planning on eating due to the fact that we were so hungry that we could not wait the quoted wait time for us to be seated. So we got a pizza and then came back and were seated within 5 minutes! While we were waiting for our table the owner gave us complimentary Bruschetta since we came back after originally leaving! 

The Bruschetta was very good, one of the better bruschettas that I have had. Seasoned very well and very tasty.

The House salad was ok, the others that I was with found it to their liking, but I was not to crazy for it. Very garlicky and I like garlic (lots of it) but the dressing did not do it for me.

My main course was Linguini with meatballs. Delicious! The sauce was great, good consistency and flavorful. The Meatballs were huge and were very flavorful, but I feel that the meatballs could have been cooked a little bit longer. It was pretty mushy. Oh, did I mention that the linguini was cooked perfectly? Anyways..

Others had the Seafood Linguini which was very good and the sauce that accompanied the seafood linguini was oh so good!

After we had finished our meal we ordered a cappuccino. The cappuccino was ver good, but I was hoping that they would have done some sort of design with the foam, but none the less it was delicious.

The vibe in this restaurant is absolutely great. All of the employees were continually smiling and everyone was happy. The atmosphere is great also! The walls are covered with portraits, art work and other little things that make this restaurant unique!

Overall, if you want to eat a restaurant in North Beach with a unique atmosphere, exceptional service and good food come here!
author: Joshua B.

description: Authentic Italian at its best. My partner who doesn't ever like calamari (or fish) tried one and never stopped eating MY appetizer. It was so good and didn't taste and feel like fish-flavored rubber bands. It was that good. I ordered the pesto angel hair with a couple meatballs on the side. Mom and Tim ordered lasagna. Everything was perfect. No complaints. Next time we're in SFO we will definitely be back.
author: Rudy B.

description:
Food sucks.  Carbonara was incredibly bland and just thoughtlessly drenched in sauce.  

Atmosphere is kinda cool. Just disappointing.
author: Josh B.

description:
You think after waiting 40 minutes for a table this wouldn't be a stellar review. The meal I had at Sodini's was one of the best Italian meals I have had in SF.

To note:

1) We were a big party. So that's why it took awhile to seat us.

2) The service was amazing and polite.

3) The drinks were strong and bartender hilarious.

4) Food was excellent.

In short, if you find yourself in North Beach I highly encourage you to go to Sodini's  for dinner. And have the gnocchi with pesto. (Ok, order whatever you want, but I am definitely going back.)
author: Alex G.

description: The quality has just gone down so much. I was there last Sunday. It pretty much felt like no one wanted us there. The service was extremely poor, the food was below average and on top of that, I just realized that they charged me an extra 10$ tip on top of what I had left.
author: Saaransh G.

description:
Pretty cute place in North beach! I would come here again if I didn't feel so sick last time.. Don't know why but ate bread, had two bites of my lasagna and stomach started hurting so I left..
but I think it was good food..?

hahaha, my poor date.
author: Alyssa Z.

description:
The San Francisco neighborhood of North Beach is Italian Food heaven, as everyone knows.  It's difficult to get an actual bad meal here.  My favorite place in the neighborhood, Baonecci, seemed a little out of sorts last night (very odd and unpleasant smell coming from the interior) so we tried this place a couple of doors down.

Service was friendly, if a bit slow.

I had the minestrone, which was pretty nice.

The gnocchi on the menu caught our eye, and I had gnocchi with a "creamy meat sauce," while my friend had gnocchi with a gorgonzola sauce.

Mine was delicious, if a tiny bit bland.  However, the gorgonzola sauce for my friend's gnocchi was heavenly.  Very rich and garlickly.  I'd come back to this place to order that.

Note:  This restaurant does not serve dessert.

Rating:  Not half bad, but nothing to write home about.
author: Ray I.

description: Sodini's has tons of old school charm, but there are also an uncomfortable number of flies buzzing around inside. You can barely open your mouth without risking one doing a fly-by. The food was okay.
author: .Alan Y.

description: While most restaurants on the Columbus strip on a Friday night had long wait times, there was no wait here. The setting was dark, with candle lights, but noisy. The staffs were friendly. Our waitress was personable. She made us feel welcomed and we felt like part of the family. We got free warm bread. My friend ordered the side salad which was big enough to feed 2 people as an entree! It was like a Cesar salad but they added red beans which was unusual and lots of croutons. For appetizer we shared the steamers with all clams and you can choose to have that mixed with mussels. The sauce it was swimming in was perfect to dunk the pieces of bread in and the portion was generous. For entree I ordered the gnocchi. I love gnocchi and I've had great gnocchi, however the gnocchi here had a gummy like texture and I honestly thought it tasted like ravioli from a Chef Boyardi can.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description: Went here because of a high recommendation from a man at our hotel--- he didnt steer us wrong! Food was best we have ever had, everything homemade & authentic. I'll be craving this until I return.
author: Ness S.

description:
Love this place!  We are from the NY/NJ area-so we are very particular about good Italian food.  This place was great.  

Fried Calamari with spicy aioli was fantastic!  The Pesto Pizza was great.  Bartender/waitress (don't know her name but an old timer since she knew everyone else in the place) was great.  Very informed, not pushy, a little quirky in a good way.

Can't wait to go back.
author: Mya G.

description:
The food wasn't even that great. 
Won't go here again. 
I will gladly mention the waitstaff. The ladies were smiling and friendly and my water glass was always full.
author: Richelle M.

description: We went to Sodini's on the recommendation of a couple who go there when they are in town and it was exactly what we were looking for. This is a old school Italian restaurant. If you want a little pile of gormet  food on your plate, don't go here. But if you want an old fashion hearty Italian dinner this is the place!!! The house salad is a meal in it self. My wife followed it with the Chicken Marsala from the daily special. It was delicious! I had the Linguini with whole and baby clams in a white cream sauce off the recommendation waitress. I absolutely loved it! I only wish our stay in San Francisco was longer so I could go back again. Bravo Mark, you and your staff helped make our trip to this beautiful city just that much better! Now move to Chicago!!!
author: John A.

description:
As a longtime North Beach / Lower Russian Hill resident, given the number of tourists and general visitors to North Beach on any given evening, there are only a few places that I'll actually have dinner - or take guests to dinner - in the area; Sodini's is one of them, and the typical go-to place.

It's just enough out of the way that those who'd be lured to the shenanigans on Columbus will miss it, and those that frequent the drinking establishments on Grant will avoid it.  And that's perfect for me

the vibe:  is pleasant and the lighting sufficiently and appropriately dim to set an intimate mood; it's great for a date, and you'll see plenty of those in the two-tops next to the window, but you'll also see a nice mix of families / Locals and lower-key Tourists and Visitors to the neighborhood.

the staff:  are great - it's family run, which you note from the good-looking Italian chap occasionally behind the bar - to the very Italian waitresses.  They're friendly and direct - and get the job done.  They've also got excellent memories, so if you frequent it often, you'll get a nod of recognition and be greeted even more warmly. On occasion, if there's a wait, we've been pleasantly surprised by a glass of wine offered up.

the food:  the menu is solid and the food is good; though given dishes are always better than others, I typically opt for the NY Steak with the calamari starter and have never been disappointed.  Compellingly-priced carafes of the very drinkable house red round out  my meals, though there's a good selection of wine otherwise, should you want to move 'up-market'.

Finally and not insignificantly:  Sodini's is one of the few NB restaurants - the only one that I frequent, actually - that makes you feel welcome long after your dinner is finished, your wine is gone and espresso cups are empty - independent of whether it's a slow, rainy TUE evening, or a perfect SAT night in the city and the wait list is long.  Remember those waitresses?  They'll bring the check as you wrap up, but qualify it by saying, "Take your time; this is here just so that you can leave when you're ready."  And they mean it.

And that's why I love it - and continue to go back.
author: Blue S.

description: Holy ravioli do not go here. First, super average food for high prices our linguine is straight from a box. The line chef who made my salad was wiping his nose with his hands yea for me. The other chef was flirting with waitress and giving her the v  and tongue sign. Really this place is just ridiculous. Our waitress showed up to take our order give our check and collect money. I had to ask a bus boy for more wine. I ended up tipping him. When I got on to yelp to see what reviews this place received their poor food inspection warning came up.  100 bucks out poor food poor service and a big disappointment
author: Kelli O.

description: The salmon was excellent! The wine was wonderful. And the service was above and beyond.   If you leave the restaurant not happy it is not because of the food and staff it is not their fault!  It is true old San Francisco!
author: Donna M.

description: Great linguini with clams and mussels. Bread with oil & vinegar beforehand was also great. Staff was friendly and helpful.
author: Randy S.

description:
Went here for the first time about a month ago. I love that you get bread to eat while you wait for your food. I ordered the pesto cheese tortellini which was AMAZING! They give you crayons to color on the white sheet of paper that covers the tables. It was fun to draw and pretend to be a kid again. 

I love that its def an Italian style atmosphere. Everyone sits so close together, the decorations have an Italian touch. Service was on point. I cant wait to come back and bring friends or family with!
author: Krista R.

description: Very good italian food in the heart of the Italian neighborhood.  I got the linguini with clams and mussels.  The delicious sauce was absolutely loaded with delicious clams, but the pasta itself was generic.  I liked the vibe.  Very small and cozy.  The owner circled the restaurant continuously.  It looked like a shrine to Frank Sinatra.  Beer list at the bar could use upgrading.  Bonus points for crayons to write on the tables.
author: Dan C.

description:
On a mission to try all the Italian restaurants in North Beach, my bf and I stumbled upon this one last week. It was the Wednesday after Christmas, but pretty full inside. One star service started with the bartender literally waving us over to a table across the room. Waitress with menus followed in approx 10 mins. Waters in another 10. Drinks probably didn't arrive for another 10. I'm not joking. That was how the night went. 

Plenty of pros: great atmosphere, good wine list, full bar, nice and warm on a cold night, but honestly food was so-so and service was bare minimum. We actually had to ask a bus boy to send over our waitress so we could order. And in an hour and a half we only had the opportunity to order one drink. Basically none of the pasta dishes included meat, and personally $15+ for pasta and Prego sauce is a rip. I asked if the pasta was homemade and it's not. 

Little bit of a letdown, but seems to be a staple of North Beach.
author: Natalie H.

description:
3 and 2/3 stars.

Four stars for the ambiance: You can't beat it! It's what you would want to find in North Beach. Friendly bartender who shouts out "HOW ARE YA?" as you walk in, large blown up photo of Italian family (the founders?) on the wall, homey, yet classic Italian restaurant feeling all around. You have the open kitchen towards the back as well.

Three stars for the service: Took awhile for us to place our order; the waitress was busy making a salad. We didn't get water refilled too often and it took awhile to get our check. Not exactly attentive. 

Four stars for the food: Okay, so they don't make the raviolis there or the gnocchi, but lemme tell ya somethin, that filled gnocchi with the meat sauce was the BEST gnocchi dish I've ever had. Hands down. 

So...I think I did the math right 4 + 4 + 3 = 11/3 = 3.666666666667. Oh and get the gnocchi, you won't regret it.
author: Tiffany K.

description: It's a perfectly fine place. Good authentic Italian food, and this place is always very popular. A bit pricey for what you get. The place is crammed and poorly lit. Tiny narrow bathrooms (not sure they are even up to code). Some staff were friendlier than others.
author: Critic X.

description: Love this place. Classic American Italian food. I usually get the veal parm, which I recommend. Don't expect ultra fancy or high end fusion Italian food, but for a solid Italian meal, this place is great.
author: Scott H.

description: The food is good for a small restaurant which I like very much.  Small restaurants are more personable to me.  I had the gnocchi with Gorgonzola.  I really wanted to get it with the pesto sauce but I also like Gorgonzola but should have listened to my gut.  As much as it was tasty, the cheese upset my tummy a little.  On another note, I've dined here many times.  Everyone is super friendly and our server was very good at checking up on us.  Our friends that were visiting from England really, really loved the food there.
author: Liz D.

description: A party of 6 went to Sodini's last night for dinner.  It was busy, but the bartender greeted us when we came in, told us about the wait, and made us comfortable outside while we waited.  The waitresses were friendly, the food was AMAZING!! They were so nice and made the evening such a pleasurable experience for our family.  We all tried different things and shared bites, and every dish was great.  This is my new favorite restaurant in San Francisco.
author: C D.

description:
My friend from the 808 requested a weeknight Italian restaurant choice and this was it (are there any Italian and Mexican restaurants on Oahu?). Reading reviews of Megan D and Natalie I, this seemed like the logical place. Interestingly painted in green (something to do with the national flag?), it certainly isn't difficult to find. When you enter, the bar is on the right and the main dining room (about eight to ten tables) is to the left. Being only a party of two, the hostess was kind and understanding in seating us at a center table for four (we're pretty big guys!). After reviewing the menu and getting our bread basket with olive oil, my eyes wandered about the dining room. Behind me, I noticed a makeshift stage above with ceramic statues of Sammy, Frank, and Dean. Lined across the far left wall were various clippings, posters, and photographs of these three too... see a recurring theme? There was one photo of Tony Manero (aka John Travolta in his white suit). Directly to the rear of the dining room, the kitchen was open with several people busily preparing the meals. It turned out that my visiting friend ate here during his last trip, so the menu was his choice. Here is what we shared: 
Appetizer: 
a) Fried Calamari - Thickly coated calamari meat pieces, fried and served with two Marinara and tartar sauce. The calamari meat was of good quality, but my preference is a mixture with the curly (tentacles) parts too. The batter was bland, hence the need for the two sauces. (http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iZCSLA7clUGpUFzRnZtQkw?select=pM2_u3npUaXL7u8_i2wKKw) 
Entrees: 
b) Tortellini Carbonara - Cheese filled tortellini dumplings filled with ricotta cheese in a heavy cream sauce with small pancetta cubes and white mushroom slices. Filling and generous portions. As always, love my plentiful mushrooms.(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iZCSLA7clUGpUFzRnZtQkw?select=6lrMV9twcEDcX2EgjY-tXA) 
c) Linguine with Clams, White Sauce - Made with fresh in-shell clams, this is another hearty pasta sauce, using a cream sauce with lemon garnish. Definitely, not for someone looking for a light dinner.(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iZCSLA7clUGpUFzRnZtQkw?select=YW9Zh2TmWt-Cz-yI0qlUbA) 
Side order 
d) Meatballs - Two freshly made meatballs in a savory Marinara sauce. Meatball flavor had a heavy celery (?) or other veggie flavor, but was a good pace change from the above choices (ordered after seeing other tables getting this - see-food diet!). 
(http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iZCSLA7clUGpUFzRnZtQkw?select=qtRMgrLpdbW13IbgQc8NTg) 

Both pasta dishes came with a small slice of garlic bread, perfect for sopping up the remaining sauce(s). In my case, I cleaned my meatball sauce. My friend commented that he LOVES their food because they actually use the heavy cream sauces that we remember from the '60's and '70's when "trans fat" wasn't even listed in the dictionary; after dinner, I could feel the cream oozing through my veins. Must admit that my taste has changed and my preference to lighter fare these days.  On my next trip here, I would like to try their Minestrone soup and their special that night (Osso Bucco with Linguine). The food rates a solid 3.5 stars, adding 0.5 star for the atmosphere.  If I'm thinking of next time, it must have been pretty good!
author: Mike C.

description:
Maybe this place is too authentic for me, but I really did not have a pleasant lunch experience here.

The pesto pasta was so pesto-y that the sauce was kind of grainy.  And really, that's all there was to it. Just some grainy pesto and noodles.  And to make it worse, the noodles were overcooked and not al dente at all. Gf's marinara sauce was so-so.  Not bad, but certainly not memorable.  Being people who really enjoy food, we left the meal with a rare feeling of "well, I guess that food will get us through the next few hours" rather than actually enjoying the meal. 

As gf proved just a few nights ago, we (well, actually, SHE) can make a better pasta dish than Sodini's for about a fifth of the price.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I'd say this is the best Italian restaurant in the city. Outside of Europe, I haven't had an Italian dinner this amazing. The service is great, and the menu will literally melt your face off.

Try the pesto--either on gnocci or ravioli, but it's the brightest green you've ever seen. I'm almost certain it could glow in the dark, and it's one of the best dishes I've ever had.
author: Tyler H.

description: This place is by far my favorite restaurant ever! The food is always amazing and the staff is friendly and attentive. You can't go wrong with any meal you choose, but my favorite is the penne al forno!
author: Nicole E.

description: I am subletting an apartment in North Beach and I was very wary of all the Italian Restaurants because most seem to cater to tourists and the food is overpriced and average.  I walked by Sodini's a few times, then one night I was craving simple spaghetti and meatballs.  I walked in and the bartender Anna greeted me with a big smile, and I felt at home instantly.  The food is amazing authentic Italian American.  This is the place Paulie from Soprano's would eat, if he were real and iived in SF.  I go once a week now and everything on the menu is delicious.  I love this place.  My favorite Italian in North Beach.
author: dave b.

description: Great food and great staff! Started with steamer clams and calamari...the steamer broth was awesome and so was the bread that came with it. We went while the Giants game was on so there was quite a lively crowd watching the game. Fun times! One of us got a pizza, another linguine with meatballs, another seafood linguine - all excellent dishes! Ask for thin crust extra crispy for your pizza...very good! Regular crust probably great as well but we didn't try. Authentic cooking and great people!
author: Bridgitte M.

description:
One of my new favorite places in San Francisco.  Was visiting for a long weekend, and Sodini's was recommended as a solid Italian place to go for my last night in town.  As soon as I walked in the door, I knew it was a great suggestion.   Best hospitality I've ever experienced.  I walked in alone, and although it was fully crowded at 7pm on a Monday, the bartender, Ana, immediately found a seat for me at the bar.  She poured me a drink quicker than I could order it, and soon found me a cozier spot at the other end of the bar where I'd have more room to order food.  The waitress who took my order asked for my name, and by the end of the night we were saying our goodbyes as if we'd been friends for years (ok, the wine may have helped haha).  Overall, the best dining experience of my vacation.  Oh, and the Veal Parmigiana was pretty kickass as well.

Great food, drinks,and people.  I'll definitely be heading back to Sodini's on my next West Coast trip :)
author: Jennifer D.

description: Real neighborhood feel and great food! I recommend the gnocchi pesto. It was delicious! In addition, they also fill your glass of wine to the top which is a plus in a city!
author: Sara F.

description:
Absolutely Fantastic! We came in w/o a reservation, on a busy Saturday Night, place was packed, great vibe, Mgr. said "no problem" set us up @ the bar. All four of us? Big lads. One's the size of Connemara. I had the steak, cooked rare. beautiful! But the house salad .... Gorgeous. The waitress Erin was a gem, great job, great personality. Can't say enough about this restaurant. Hope to go back soon! 5 stars!
Just wish the Scottish guy in our company knew about tipping! Embarrassing to say the least! Dear Lord!!! Cannae Unnerstaund that boy. Tight as a rusted lug-nut!
author: James M.

description:
This is one of my favorite little Italian places. The food is good, but the atmosphere and service is what really makes the place special. 

It is an old historic building, lots of cool stuff on the walls, and authentically Italian. When you see the bartender you will know what I mean. He looks like someone off the cast of the Soprano's! The staff are all really friendly and you always feel welcomed and at home. Not all places have personality like this place. I wish more would.

The food is great but 2/3 visits my chicken has been overcooked (hence docking a star). When they cook it right though it is one of the best meals ever.

I always get the chicken parmesan. it is $20 but comes with your choice of either a huge minestrone soup, or salad. The salad is packed with blue cheese, onions, and lots of other goodies. It is a salad that is worth spending $8-12 on its own so the meal cost is really reasonable for San Fran.  The wine is also great. We got a bottle of some type of red, forget the name but the waitress (Blaze was her name!) was really helpful in finding us the perfect wine. She even went out of her way to suggest some other wines to try and wrote them down for us. 

Oh and they have crayons! I love this! You can draw on the table while you wait for your food! What's even better on my last visit they upgraded them all to Crayola. None of that no name china brand #$%. That surprisingly adds quite a bit to the meal experience. There is nothing better than eating fresh bread and coloring on stuff. Did I mention how good the bread is? Very fresh with olive oil and balsamic to dip.
author: Chris S.

description:
Tried this place for the first time on Friday, had an amazing experience along with great food and service! I must say I was fairly shocked. It is hard to find a great restaurant in North Beach, where you are away from the weekend "rift-raft" that goes on around that area. 

We sat at the bar and had some of the best service. We were able to meet the owner and got the 5-star experience that any restaurant goer should experience. Had a GREAT drink at the bar, really strong to where I didn't need a second one (Always love that). The waitress Jennifer was amazing and hilarious we really enjoyed her.
We ordered the Chicken Marsala and the Salmon, which was the best marsala I have ever had.

Lets just say as a AVID COOK, who specializes in Italian cuisine this place is AUTHENTIC. From the owner, to the food, to the environment, its a TRUE ITALIAN PLACE! Which is what you should EXPECT and get when you come to North Beach. All in all, we found our new stomping ground in North Beach. 

Totally recommend this place, you will not be disappointed.
author: Renee B.

description: Went here after seeing Beach Blanket Babylon down the street.  AMAZING food, all three of us thought.  And I used to live in Italy!  Only regret is I didn't get take out to take back home the next day.
author: Karen C.

description: Very good. I had the chicken parm and my business associate had the salmon special. Service and atmosphere was very good, too. Highly recommended.
author: Alex M.

description: This is our go to Italian (and probably our first choice) Restaurant in San Francisco.  We love the family atmosphere and all the food is awesome.  It is traditional italian and the best of that genre.  We alway come here when in SF and you should too!!!
author: Jim P.

description: We love this place !  The food is just amazing....  I normally have their minestrone soup for starters and then a slice of pizza for starters.  By this time, you know this place is amazing...  The seafood linguini is my favorite but I can't seem to get away with ordering one more slice of pizza every single time.  Their wine selection is good and pairs up well with the pastas, etc.  parking is a little tough but worth it.  Been here several times with my family and we keep coming back.  I am about due for another visit and will definitely invite others to enjoy this great Italian food place
author: Jimmy V.

description: My very first authentic Italian restaurant. I even had lasagne perfectly prepared. You have got to try the polenta with mozzarella and meat sauce app....awesomeness. Staff was fun and inviting!  Easily 5 on my list.
author: Gus G.

description: The Best!!! Hands down!!! My fav when I'm the area. Ordered the seafood linguine and it was HUGE...filled with lots of seafood too! Clams, mussels, shrimp, calamari galore! Definitely recommend and will definitely always be back!
author: Robert D.

description: Although I just moved to San Francisco, I am already becoming a regular at Sodini's. The food is more than worth the wait, the staff is super friendly and the wine pours are very generous. In the 12 years that I lived in Los Angeles I never found an Italian restaurant that even compares. My boyfriend is 100% Italian and he raves about Sodini's. I'm very happy that it's only a short walk from our apartment because we will definitely be eating there a lot!
author: Jennifer P.

description:
Really fun experience at Sodini's. Great location, great thin-crust pizza. Excellent gnocchi--some of the best we've had. Little pillows of awesome. Fun, informal waitstaff, and a very nice atmosphere.

I have no problem recommending Sodini's, and I'd love to go there again next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Doug B.

description: The food is ok the owner mark will be a little touchy feely towards your wife definitely something to look out for
author: Dan Q.

description: I was welcomed at the door by the owner and treated like family. I'm northern italian and I highly suggest the pesto. My fiancee had the seafood linguine it was fabulous.  I highly suggest this spot.
author: Mario R.

description: Such a fun and great place for a local's dinner in North Beach. The service was of the highest quality, everyone was amazingly courteous and attentive. The drinks came quickly and the food was paced perfectly. Can't wait to go back. Thanks so much!
author: Tim A.

description:
Service: We were seated immediately around 5:30pm. Took about 10 minutes before we could order drinks. Food arrived fairly quickly thereafter.

Atmosphere: Seems like a fairly friendly place. At first, it was mostly a casual dining experience where all of us at the table could talk to and hear each other (early in the evening), but the busier it got, the louder it got as well.

Food: All I can say is "meh." We ordered fried calamari to share; they were crispy and not chewy (basically perfect texture), but the seasoning on them was quite bland. Definitely needed some marinara sauce for taste. I had the beef ravioli with meat sauce. The ravioli were quite big with lots of meat. The meat sauce itself was also kind of bland; probably needed a bit more salt or something. I ended up adding some chili flakes on mine to improve the flavor.

Other Comments: The place is kind of small. We were seated at a 4-person table in the middle of the dining area. As the waitresses and bus boys kept walking by, they would pretty consistently (but accidentally) knock into my elbow while I was eating. Try to get seating against a wall if possible.

If you're desperately looking for an Italian meal, this place will probably be alright for you, but there are definitely tastier places in the area (Sotto Mare just down the street is great if you like seafood).
author: Michael S.

description: After all these years . . . I love Sodini's even more than I did then. I have been going to Sodinis for about 10 years now, and its still one of my favorite, if not my very favorite, restaurant in SF. Everything about it is great. So first, the customer service is outstanding . . . the owner, Mark, is often at the door welcoming customers with open arms and genuine warmth. The food is wonderful as well. You can't go wrong no matter what you order. I love the linguini and the chicken breast, and the sauteed spinach with mushrooms. Everything is so flavorful and tastes authentic. I've had many different items over the years and its outstanding every time (the bread is amazing too). Also, Sodini's is a place where friends gather. You see people that have been going there for years and have become part of the Sodini's family. Its heartwarming, and my friends and I have spent countless hours eating and drinking at the bar, talking to wonderful people that have lived in City forever and have been coming here to eat, drink and be merry for years and years. Its warm and inviting, and you will LOVE it as much as I do if you go. Sodini's is more than just a restaurant, its a little home away from home.
author: Elizabeth S.

description: We stumbled on this place because we were hungry and quickly yelped it and it had good reviews. We are from Southern Cali and wanted to try the food in little Italy.  We weren't disappointed. We were immediately greeted by the owner who looks like he can be in one of those Italian movies . He's friendly and handsome, just sayin . It was New Year's Day and we were a party of 5 and were immediately seated. The ambiance is very romantic and family oriented at the same time. Frank Sinatra music is playing in the background. The lighting is dim and the decor is really nice . Feels like you're in someone's home. Also this place is family owned and has been open for over 100 years ! Talk about history! The kitchen is actually the center-end of the room and you can see them cooking there. I ordered tortellini carbonara. The food was fast to come out and wasn't scolding hot which I like . It was so delicious I finished every last bite. Cost was about 17 dollars but I think most Italian places are on the pricier side. The waitress was really attentive and friendly. Overall great experience.
author: Stephany G.

description: This place is meant for fat people like me.  Loads of carbs with heavy sauces. Nom nom
author: Fatty A.

description: Looking for a nice family Italian place after they closed are favorite (Capps Corner) last month. A long time friend recommended Sodini's we could not have been more pleased. Met the owner Mark and they treaated us like family. Lasagna and and Gorgonzola Gnocchi were  the recommendations and both were fantastico!
author: Vic B.

description: Start with the dinner salad.....excellent, I don't usually like salads but I crave this one. The raviolis with tomato meat sauce were very good.  But I think the absolute best is the  tortellini carbonara.  Super service and a great atmosphere.  We'll go back every time were in the city!!
author: Bob C.

description: Sure it's a little touristy, but the gnocchi are like little pillows from heaven and the frito misto (mixed fried seafood) are awesome. Family owned super helpful waitstaff, this is a regular on the guys might circuit. If you want traditional Italian-American with a pitcher of chianti this is the spot.
author: C. K.

description: We try to make it back to San Francisco once per year and when we do, our first stops are China town and then Sodinis green valley resturaunt. As much as I want to try something new, I jut can't. I always get the same thing....Two words, clam linguine! It is exceptionally divine! Their house salad is completely awesome as well. If I were dying and was asked what would be my final meal, it would be sodinis clam linguine and their house salad. For dessert I would send someone to Johnston's rv park in east glacier for their resturaunts mile high huckleberry pie. Yummy!
author: Rick W.

description: great place! the chicken parm was amazing and the cesar salad was a big portion! mark is the best! I also  got a sodinis north beach t-shirt!! good food and old school feel to it.
author: Brian B.

description:
Walk through the door and enjoy the experience.

Alone, with a friend, in a group, or on a date -
Sodini's just fits like a glove.

The following things you always get
from here-

1. Good Food ( you see clean plates and take out boxes)
2. Good Drinks ( Wine,beer,whiskey, you get the idea...)
3. Good Atmosphere (customers having a good time)
4. Good Service ( everyone works here for you to have a good time)

I walked through the door over 15 years ago......
and
I keep coming back for more......
author: Humphrey L.

description: What a cute little place! The wine list is really good to start with; the staff is extremely friendly and the food is really good. We ordered tortellini carbonara and gnocchi pesto. Both were so yummy!
author: Allyson B.

description: I've ordered take-out from here.  The woman on the phone, think she's the legendary hostess or bartender, is so nice!  I ordered the lasagna, which has beef in it, for two.  She said she'd make sure there was enough bread, butter, and place settings.  The lasagna is so hearty and like someone in your family made it.  It's a big portion, too!  Can't wait to try more on the menu and actually eat inside.
author: Paige W.

description: Best homemade Italian food in North Beach hands down. Authentic & fresh! Pizza & seafood linguine delish... Our go to place when we're in the area!
author: Leila D.

description:
Old style Italian... Fresh/Wild Salmon for $24 a STEAL, large cut, perfectly
cooked, side of pasta and (side) Salad was Large and Excellent. Good friendly
service, decent prices, it does get full and Loud so get there early!
author: Peter J.

description: The main thing this place has got going for it is its old style family Italian restaurant charm.  But the food is also old family style...... Kinda bland.  I wanted to throw on some garlic and a hand full of oregano on my tomato sauce with meat balls.  The meat balls were kind of spice free as well.  My wife had the pesto pasta and it was just about 3 star.  So it was a nice trip down memory lane but I will not be back.
author: Bob K.

description:
Went here for dinner on Friday night arrived around 7pm asked how long of a wait for 4 she said around 30mins. okay not bad for a Friday night.
Sat in the bar drinks were ok.. place is very small the bathrooms are really small.
We kept seeing people getting seated and we are still waiting now it's 8 and we have been seated. The calamari was good the bruschetta was very good. I ordered the combination ravioli's with pesto. The pesto was salty. Wanted to get dessert but they don't have any!! What the hell no dessert. Oh well not a horrible place but not the greatest.
author: Michele B.

description: This post is waaay over due. I moved to sf a littlw ober a year ago and thats when my boyfriend and i discovered sodinis. We saw the yelo revoews and wanted to try it out and every time we want to treat ourselves to something nice sodinis it is! Ive had a few different dishes here and no complaints AT ALL! Hands down the best italian spot in north beach if not sf itself. Reccomend the tortellini cabornera (spell check,lol sorry), amazing!!
author: Tayler H.

description: Always amazing servers and amazing food. My boyfriend and I live close by and this is one of those restaurants with a comfortable environment.  It's a must go in San Francisco
author: Lissa Z.

description: I'm going to keep this simple: I'm from New Jersey and I'm Italian... and this was one of THE BEST LASAGNA dishes I have ever had.  Please don't tell Granny.
author: Domenic Z.

description: Old school Italian with a very comfortable interior. It is strange that they do not offer dessert but the food was spot on!
author: Josh S.

description: Sodini's is a wonderfully authentic old-school Italian restaurant that serves huge portions of goodness. The house salad, at $6.95, is immense and almost a meal in and of itself. I had to restrain myself from finishing it so I had room for the entree. I had the special - penne with scallops and asparagus - and my wife had the linguine with meatballs. Both were outstanding and portions were very generous. The entire meal was very good and the ambiance, seemingly unchanged in the 100 years that the restaurant had been on business, added to the great time.
author: Mark S.

description: This is definitely my new favorite place to have Italian in San Francisco.  The food here is excellent and very rich in flavor.  I ordered the Chicken alla Sodini, which came with a hearty and tender piece of chicken covered in cream sauce and mozzarella with linguini on the side, which was delicious!  Additionally, it came with either a bowl of minestrone or house salad as an app.  They have an extensive wine list and some Italian beer on tap including my favorite, Moretti.  The service here was great, but come early if you want to avoid waiting for a table.  I came in around 630 on a Monday evening and it was pretty much empty, but when I left about an hour later, it was almost full, so word of the wise....come early!
author: Ricardo S.

description:
Friends took us here for dinner. Typical little Italy joint. Their motto is no reservations, no decaf, no desserts. Should have added no good.

Food was typical bad Italian, pizza was terrible--tasted like they took it out of the freezer section of the supermarket, lasagna was boring, pesto gnocchi was over-sauced. Pretty much what you would expect from a tourist trap.

Would never go back or recommend this place to anyone. Left hungry because the food was so bad it wasn't worth finishing. Two stars because the service was good and the waitress was nice.
author: Billy M.

description: I really like this place!! Quality Italian food and a great old school Italian restaurant.  The minestrone soup was the best I've ever had! hardy and creamy
author: Justin Ryan B.

description:
Ambiance was great - Sinatra in the background, pictures on the walls, native italian feel. Service was great too. Gnocchi was too heavy and angel hair pasta a bit overdone; plus the marinara sauce didn't have enough flavor.

FYI they don't serve desert.
author: Formicas F.

description:
Mark Sodini, owner since ~1990, and bartender will take good care of you. 

Food:
Classic Italian. 

Service:
Best of North Beach hospitality. 

Decor:
Sinatra humor abounds on the walls - "I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning, that's as good ad they are going to feel all day."
author: Jefferson L.

description: Great food at a decent price! The Tortellini Carbonnara SP? was outstanding! Service pretty good and wine choice was good. Definately the place to go from now on!
author: Chrys T. M.

description:
We are total regualrs at this place! the owner knows us by name, and is so friendly!
Great food and atmosphere! Love evrything!
author: Michelle K.

description:
Very dry and very abrupt waitress .
We felt like we were doing them a favor by being there.
Food was not that great
author: Serge H.

description: Great little place to stop and have a quick nosh.   Pastas are tasty!
author: Paul W.

description:
Asked about 30 locals where to go for good italian and we decided on this place due to the reviews.  SO GLAD WE DID!!
Family Owned, Homemade, Cool Atmosphere, Exceptional service from Ana (bartender) and our server! Don't miss the house salad as the dressing is insanely good and the server offered to split it for us (when does that ever happen?) Best Chicken Piccata with Fettuccini pesto ever tasted.
If I knew how to add pictures, I would!
author: Anita H.

description:
The Best!
My husband and I went here for dinner tonight and had an absolutely delicious meal sitting outside under the beautiful San Francisco sky!  What a lovely evening.
On recommendation from our waitress, I got the gnocchi nostri and my husband got the tortellini carbonara.  My husband practically licked his plate!  I ate most of mine and was too full to eat it all.
We loved Sodini's!  We loved the ability to sit outside and loved how it was off the beaten path of Columbus Street. 
We can't wait to go back and try something else.
Thank you for a wonderful dining exerperience.
p.s.  My husband loved how he got an extra glass with olives and onions in it for his martinis!
author: Jennifer M.

description:
Usually it's my husband who is super enthused about Italian food, but I loved my experience at Sodini's.  We went on a Saturday around 9 and waited maybe 20 minutes, the bartender was friendly and  the restaurant has a great old school, jazzy vibe.

I tried and loved both salads we ordered, the caesar and caprese.  When I read other reviews I thought, 'how good could the salads really be?'  So, so good.  They put red onion on their caprese with yummy fresh mozzerella and I don't think I've ever had better caesar dressing!

I had the linguine with clams and mussels as my entree, not usually a fan of red sauce, I thought this dish was delish.  It had good amount of seafood and garlic -- yum.  
Hope to be a repeat customer next time I'm in north beach for din!
author: Kim U.

description:
To me, Sodini's is like the ex you call late at night, when you've had a bit to drink, even though you don't really actually even like that ex, and you always feel a little dirty and disappointed with yourself once you leave his place...   Let's see. I used to come here pretty often with friends and coworkers.  This was our go-to place to stuff our faces before drinking entirely too much.  I feel they handle groups very well.  The waits for a table were never too bad, even with large groups, and the service was cheerful and just attentive enough.   

The portions are generous, the prices are fair, and the food is OK.  They have a few dishes that they're known for (and which are already adequately reviewed on Yelp), but most of the menu is just so-so.  They have an extensive wine list which includes quite a few inexpensive options.

So why am I not a fan? The food is really mediocre, even compared to the restaurants in this touristy neighborhood.  It seems like every time we eat here, at least one person in the party feels ill afterwards... on that note, the last three times I've been here, there were mice running around the dining room, under the tables while we ate.  It would have been funny if the staff wasn't so nonchalant about it (guess it happens all the time).  They were actually kind of cute but... wow.  Each time I go here, I promise myself I won't again, but then I end up in North Beach with friends, a couple of martinis under my belt, and into Sodini's I go...
author: Heidi M.

description:
I was exhausted when we came here on Friday night, and not exactly pumped about standing in line, but the smile of the servers as they were walking back and forth kept me smiling, and the smells of the food that kept wafting past kept me hopeful...

I was not disappointed.

My husband and I shared the Gorgonzola gnocchi and the penne al forno and both were excellent.  The gnocchi were like happy little pillows of flavor, and the penne was what my Italian grandmother would make if I weren't overwhelmingly Irish.  The house wine, both the red and the white, were also good, and the wine list beyond that also looked decent.  

The tables are a little close together here, and I do understand why - they've been here for 100 years, and there's only so much space - but if you are trying to have a romantic dinner (which we weren't, we just wanted some damned good pasta, and we got it!), it's something to keep in mind.  Overall though, big thumbs up!
author: Heather H.

description:
Overall, a great experience. Service was great, yummy bread with oil and vinegar given upon arrival. I ordered the Chicken a la Sodini, and I loved it. I got got white sauce instead of the marinara on the noodles, which was bland, but fine. The chicken was cooked perfectly, and very yummy. My husband got the Chicken Parmigiana, and he did not like it at all. He says it tasted like "fake chicken". Both came with a salad, which was delicious.

Pros: great service, great atmosphere, large portions, free salad with entree, yummy bread
Cons: the entrees are hit and miss
author: Emily D.

description: This is Old School SF Italian food that used to be what North Beach was all about.Huge portions, lots of garlic,red sauce,and outstanding Friendly service (thank Erin and Linda).Seafood linguine with pesto sauce,mmmmm.Forget your diet for one night. You remember the cliche "You're only a stranger once".?This place it's the real deal as is the food.Like stepping back into 1957.
author: John K.

description:
HAIKU REVIEW:
Comfortable as-is:
Head-spinning drinks by Ana;
Old-school style pastas.
author: Joe J.

description:
I haven't had a meal this good since I was 29-years-old, but after a long and difficult period of frustration it was time to finally "go Sodini." 

I'm sure glad I did and I would encourage everyone to do the same!
author: Heywood A.

description: The food was mediocre and the taste of the pasta was bland. I had the seafood linguini and it was average in terms of taste, presentation, and quality in my opinion. It did however have a generous amount of seafood which was great! I also ordered the house pitcher of wine which was not very good (tasted flat and sour) and ended up sending it back and ordering a bottle of wine. Mind you, I am someone who never ever complains or sends items back at a restaurant, but it was $31 and I couldn't comprehend paying that much for something that I could barley stomach. This is where my experience went from zero to a hundred... Our server, Erin, was fantastic! She took great care of us and made us feel like regulars. She even gave us a tour of the restaurant and showed us all of the history on the walls. Great photos! If you're looking for the ultimate Italian ambiance and vide, this is the place to go. If the owner is working, he'll make you feel right at home and looks like a true Italian straight from Italy. Great experience overall.
author: Bobby J.

description: A co-worker of mine always talked about how delicious Sodini's was but I had never had the chance to go. Man was I missing out. The atmosphere is so old school and the food is delicious. The beau enjoyed their lasagna and I had their gnocchi in pesto. I definitely want to come back and try their pizza which looked amazing.
author: Donna H.

description:
I've have never written yelp review before, but I always come to the site to browse and check in on what's good and what's not. This place has the honor of getting my first review, but I'll try to make it as short and simple as I can.


THE PROS:

*The food was good. I custom ordered the Linguini with pink sauce and garlic steak fries. Neither didn't disappoint. Sadly, thats where the pros end and is where all of my two stars are going to. 


THE CONS: (This might take a while to explain, so saddle up)

*The service. It took about 40 mins for our food to come out and about half hour to get our checks AFTER we were done with our food. The place was about half full, so not a full house. 

Where to begin... It started off nice, as we were seated and greeted by a lovely lady who began to take our orders shortly after. Before ordering, we specifically told the waitress that we wanted separate checks for our orders. She stated that she would take our orders and divvy it up afterwards, which seemed simple enough. 

What she failed to mention was that they only allowed one card per table. 

By the time our food arrived and had to pay, we were crunched for time and had to leave. I flagged down another employee (He was working the bar at the time, but gave me the impression that he was the manager) who seemed rather annoyed at the fact that we had three separate cards. I tried to explain to him the situation, but he immediately saw me as an annoyance and quickly proceeded to give me an attitude, saying, and I quote, "This is why we have ATMs around the corner". Much confusion ensued as I tried to understand his frustration but *never* have I been so rudely treated by a restaurant employee, let alone the manager. 


OVERALL:

My first experience at Sodini's was left feeling sour and maltreated. We were ignored by the staff, and when we finally got some acknowledgement, it backfired. The manager (or whoever he was) was rude, and insisted on starting an argument. I don't plan on returning based off of this experience. 

What ever happened to "The customer's always right"?

So anyway, unless you have lots of time to spare and have plenty of cash (or have one card per table), come here.
author: Ivania A.

description: Upon seeing the good reviews on Yelp I decided to give this place a try. To my dismay I found myself to be not such a happy camper. Although the service was prompt and courteous I found the food to be insipid. I ordered the minestrone soup and the tortellini al pesto. The minestrone soup looked like a thick porridge that not even the three little bears would enjoy let alone touch. It was very thick, tasteless and a bit cold. The main entree I found to be boring and it lacked spices and a little TLC. The best part of my meal was the sprite. I think I was better off going to The Olive Garden.
author: Angel C.

description: This place is awesome! Such a great vibe, and the food is delicious. Also, the service is lovely! Definitely recommend!
author: Beth A.

description: The best down low genuine Italian in North Beach.
author: Edward K.

description:
The moment that I walked in the place it was magic .... The ambiance was amazing ...The Bartender greeted me right away and the way she did it was humerus, witty and welcoming all in one.... I sat at the bar because that's were my dinner partner had sat ...  if you live in San Francisco and you don't go there you should be ashamed of yourself. I would suggest that you take a date, friends or family. 

The food was great there was a perfect amount of dressing on my house salad and it was abundant but not to much ...

i had Linguine and Meatballs  ...  It was very good but there are a lot of things on the menu that I will go back and try ...But It was a very good start ..... 

I like the hand written checks that's just OG dude.....  and that's how the place is. You do feel that you are in mafia movie , well it is an Italian place.....
author: Bernard mickey W.

description: Seafood Liguini was chock full of calamari.. Some clams and a few shrimp... Overall it was  good.  The food took awhile so don't go in there if you're in a hurry.  I'd definitely eat here again... All of my family was happy except for one of my sons who was butt hurt because we didn't go to the resteraunt he picked across the street.  I would recommend this place to anyone who wants some authentic Italian food with great atmosphere.
author: Sam T.

description:
I have always wanted to eat  a real authentic Italian meal. Not the fancy "California Cuisine" type, but the kind you envision a grandmother making in an old-fashioned kitchen. 

Sodini's was all that and more. First of all, the wait staff seemed quite familar with my then boyfriend (Nick Calvanese aka Nicky the Barber) and now ex (I found out he is a pathological liar and unfaithful sociopath.), He was probably bringing in several other women at the same time he was bringing me there. We were seated at the "Frank Sinatra" booth in the corner. The ambience was like the Italian restaurants I remember from my childhood; small and intimate, red checked clothes, beautiful wooden bar, pictures of famous local Italians, etc. etc.

The wait staff was warm and friendly. It reminded me of the t.v. show "Cheers," where you could feel if you became a regular patron, you would make you feel like part of a big, happy, well-fed family!

The waitress brought us a complimentary plate of the house cheesy garlic bread which I thought was fabulous and Nick (whom the rest of this review I will call "Ick" complained about it and the waitress who thought to bestow it on us.

Ick got the house calzone (which is made with a crepe) and I got the ravioli with tomato sauce (I was trying to be "good!") Omigod, it was sooooooooo wonderful, trying to be good was a silly thing to worry about when you are eating really delicious food.

All in all I would say: 
restaurant: A wonderful treasure,  an A+
boyfriend who took me there: A dirtbag, F
author: Anastasia E.

description:
Went there tonight and as I said in the past - this place is totally cool. Atmosphere is kick ass and drinks are stiff. But tonight the food was great and as promised I had to bump it up to a 5 star, they deserve it - 100%

I will return.
author: Bella B.

description: The decor and atmosphere were the only good thing about this restaurant. The food was mediocre, without much flavor, and was by no means good enough to make up for the horrible service. The waitress  snapped at me when I asked to place a drink order and said that she had a full restaurant with people who were there first. There was no apology by her or anyone else at the restaurant. There are much better places to go in North Beach.
author: Catherine K.

description: As old school as it gets, but never gets old.  Mark and family makes YOU feel like family, and the food reminds me of all the greats my own Nonna used to whip up in the kitchen.  The chicken parm is a must have, don't miss out on the Gnocchi, and their various pizza's served elevated over your table top are the perfect height for optimum munching!  Busy all the time, so don't go there in a hurry.  Just enjoy the ambiance, and perhaps sip on a drink or 2 and take it all in.  I hope this place never closes up, I will be heartbroken.
author: Fred E.

description: Nice cozy atmosphere, great owner who gave us free shots but the food is pretty sub-par. The pizza was not impressive for the price and the pasta was very heavy and saucy. The food took a long time to arrive- granted it was a Friday night. For a North Beach Italian restaurant, I would go elsewhere for a solid meal.
author: Julia W.

description:
This is my absolute favorite local Italian restaurant in San Francisco, and has been for well over 15 years. Here's why: (1)  family owned and operated. It's clear that the staff all cares about the food and drinks they serve; (2) prices are VERY reasonable considering the high quality; (3) like old-style NY Italian restaurants, you don't feel like you have to dress up to eat a good meal. I could go on and on, but here's the skinny: I love love love the Linguine Sodini and garlic cheese bread. The only improvements I'd suggest: I would love it if they'd take reservations. They don't serve desserts but I understand it's simply an issue of not taking away from local cafes, but still, I'd love it if they served desserts!

Also: the pasta has always been cooked perfectly IMHO; but then again, I hate al dente. ; ) I say, ask the waitress for al dente if it's important to you.
author: Diane C.

description:
You want Italian food - the kind you know and love.

You don't want to take a chance, you don't want to gamble - you just want a guaranteed delicious dinner.

Go here. Order the gnocchi. Either kind. 

Or, order any noodle, with the tomato cream sauce.

I promise, you will be pleased.
author: Sam A.

description: Went to this place last night and was quite disappointed. We got 2 pizzas and some pasta. The wait was quite long but the pasta were very good and I learned later that this is what the place is known for. On the other hand, the pizza were simply bad. None of us could eat the crust because it didn't taste good, and there were a ton of topping which made it very overwhelming. Should probably stick to selling pasta only...
author: Ben L.

description:
The gnocchi pesto are like little packets of heaven in each bite. For this dish alone I give the restaurant 5 stars. The tortellini pesto is also 5 stars. The pesto is so fresh and thick, it's unbelievably good. 

The other dishes here - I don't know that I care for them so much. We've had ravioli, some veal dish... mostly decent, but nothing as great as their gnocchi. 

Like other reviewers have said - really great cozy atmosphere. I can't help but enjoy the crayons on the table. Also, nice that you get a variety of options for bread dipping. Most of the restaurants in North Beach only offer some plain olive oil. Here you can mix it up with balsamic and parmesan :)

Now been here at least 5 times and each time it's consistently good.
author: TS S.

description: I used to love this place, it was my favorite restaurant in North Beach.  I haven't been in a couple of years though, and went back for the first time tonight.  I suspect they are under new ownership, because things were just not nearly as good as they once were.  The food was very meh.
author: Robert S.

description:
I have been to Sodini's many times throughout my decade living in SF and I really only come back for one reason: the atmosphere. It's definitely a quintessential spot for SF and great to bring visitors and family - the interior is very welcoming, cozy, and dark - great place to go to get out of the rain - love the red glass candle holders - awesome touch. The servers are always wonderful and wear happy smiles on their faces as they're buzzing around; the place is always packed.

The food. I have been wanting to fall in love now after ten years of trying but I have just never ordered anything here that has wowed me. The food is extremely average. In the sea of Italian spots that is North Beach... there are many more fish. You get my point.

Come for the love, the atmosphere, the experience and just enjoy it.
author: Meredith R.

description: Ate her on the recommendation of a city tourism employee. Food was awesome, atmosphere was great and prices were reasonable.  If you are looking for authentic Italian food this is the place.
author: James P.

description:
Character, charm, friendly service, and honest food at good prices.
The Salmon special is not to be missed.  The minnestrone soup, was piping hot, and full of flavor.  Cannot wait to go back.
author: tonya m.

description:
I am still lusting for their clam sauce, and its been weeks since I ate here. I am a vongole y linguine connoisseur and I think this is the best I've ever had, and I order this dish all the time.

This is a great date night restaurant, it has charm, the wait staff is awesome without smothering their customers, specifically the bar matron who acted as the hostess also.  

I felt like the chef from Lady and the Tramp was going to come out from the kitchen and sing Bella Noche, a perfect setting for a romantic evening. 

However, if you are looking for a modern foodie OR "a place to impress the out of towners" type atmosphere don't go here, they do not take reservations (frankly they don't need to), so save yourself the trouble of the hour long wait and leave that table open for me!!!
author: Natalie J.

description: Came here because other Italian restaurants in the area were full. The greeter was friendly. However this place is super crowded. I move my shoulders out and accidentally hit a waitress. I got pasta with meatball and it was nothing special. Meatball was bland. Tomato sauce was bland. I don't think it's worth the cost. My boyfriend got lasagna. It tasted better than mine. It was cheesy but it something that I could make. Portions were good size though.
author: Jess P.

description: The food is decent but the staff could use some improvement. While enjoying my dinner the lady seated at the table next to us accidentally knocked into my water glass spilling it all over me and the table. While we were scrambling to clean up the mess not a single employee of the restaurant came over to assist. They all basically ignored the situation. It's a fairly small place and we were seated right by the kitchen so there was a lot of foot traffic  and the least they could of done is offer us some napkins.
author: Sarah M.

description:
We wanted Italian and we got Italian. Nothing particularly unique or special about this restaurant beyond the excellent service. From the bartender to the waitress, all were friendly and delightful throughout the evening.

Everything is huge. That starter salad is a meal. The lasagna was noteworthy and everything is laced with enough garlic to frighten off the most determined vampire. Buon appetite!
author: Jane K.

description: Most authentic and best tasting italian restaurant I have found in the city. The owner is extremely welcoming and I love bringing my friends and family here when they come to visit! Soooo good!!
author: K W.

description: A very good experience. Great food, personal service. We had a table outdoors to be in the cool breeze, but indoors would also have been nice. We shared the clams and mussels, the gnocchi pesto was terrific. Would be happy to return.
author: Carol L.

description: The food was super delicious, but the waitress was super rude! I was with some Chinese exchange students and my friend was trying to help them order and the waitress scolded them for being on their phones. We didn't even tip her because she gave us attitude and made us wait forever for everything. Although we are students and know the importance of tipping, we also believe you need to earn your tips.
author: Maddie A.

description:
Came here as kind of a last ditch effort to try to get some pizza before 9pm. Had wanted to go next door, but the wait was ridiculous.

This ended up being a solid deal though. Fulfilled our pizza craving, for sure, and the wait was only about 15 minutes. 

We had two glasses of the house red wine and two beers, with a large thin crust, 3-topping pizza (salami, sausage, and peppers). The total was about $52. 

Everything was a-ok food-wise. I definitely enjoyed the basic pizza even though I had been craving something a little more unique when looking at the menu from the place next door.

The atmosphere was a bit noisy, and the tables were pretty close together, so it was difficult to hear my friend across the table and a little too easy to hear what the people next to us were talking about. Sorry to hear that the lady next me had a father who was falsely diagnosed with some sort of lymphoma.

There are definitely a lot of pizza joints in the North Beach area so I can't say this is the best, but if you find yourself in a bind, like we did, then try this place. They don't accept reservations, so the wait probably isn't that bad ever.
author: Michelle L.

description:
My husband and I just visited San Fran this past weekend and stopped here Sunday evening for dinner.  Great atomsphere.  Owner greeted us in the door and was able to sit us right away, which was surprising since they were packed.  Atomsphere is perfect for a family owned small restaurant in north beach.  A ton of family pics and things that remind me of my own italian family memories.  

We both had dinner salads, which were delicous!  My husband had the linguini with meatballs and I had the chicken parmagiana.  Both very good and good portion sizes.  My husband would give it 5 stars, I gave it 4 stars since my pasta was great but my chicken could have been a little more flavorful.  Wine was great.  Had some port wine to end the night, which was great.  Service was good, a bit slow to get our drinks ordered initially but like I said, they were very busy.

We would definitely go back here next time we're in San Fran.
author: Jen D.

description:
Loved it!
Grew up visiting Little Italy in NYC. This place has a similar old-school vibe, with friendly servers and great food. It was worth every step of hill-climbing we did to get there.
author: Susan O.

description: Place waa a little bit tight reminded me of little italy in nyc.  Food was excellent had meat pizza salad and veal.  Flavors were remind me of little italy in nyc. You can't go wrong.
author: Rob A.

description: I'm not sure where the reviews are coming from....let me start of by saying, very friendly greeting and welcoming. However, we were seated at a ridiculously table next to the bar, as the time lapsed our table was getting ass bumped every 5 mins along with middle aged swm trying to live out their frat boy years at the bar, view from the table consisted of people's crotches and flat butts. . Ordered the "margerhita" diced tomatoes with preserved parsley, frozen mozzarella cooked over a deliciously stale dough put in a metal oven. 40 mins later, our pasta dishes did not arrive. Waitress was nice enough to cancel our pasta order. Walked out and had a lovely evening at baonecci right next door.  PRO: great for swm for a alpha kappa delta reunion class of 85 and earlier, great for large groups, has a bar scene.CON: loud, chaotic, food is mediocre compared to other places in the area. My humble honest observation, maybe I'd order the pasta or lasagna to go next time...but probably not when Tony's is right around the corner. 2.5 stars
author: Darrell D.

description: My second time here and it was a real disappointment. My first time was a 3-4 star rating but a repeat visit was 2 stars at best. The chicken parm was so tough and dry, it was like eating an over cooked steak. The prices online are not updated. Meals were at least $10 per order more at the restaurant than what was listed online. I will not be returning.
author: John C.

description:
Five stars because I am absolutely mesmerized by everything here. The people that bless the place with their great personas by working hereafter the ultimate bestest out. I go here when I visit a friend in little Italy during the early afternoon on the weekdays. My friend and I always eat outside,for the atmosphere and I love to be seen by the passer Byers. Everything on the menu is a must eat. I always eat any seafood or meat, with a linguine or angel hair pasta and an alfredo sauce. Yummy in the tummy.
Just a side note: for years I never wanted to partake in oysters. But for some reason, since my friend always gets oysters, I figured one day I might try. This was the day. I knew that If I am going to try them, I should do it here. Eating them here, will let me know if I really would love them. Guess what? I did. That ish was hella good. I would definitely be eating them here again And only here. 
Giants fan? Oooohhh weeee. So are they. Of course they are because they are in the city but....No. They really are the place to be when it's a giants game. Pease go kick it with them wit that great wine selection and food that'll have you writing a yelp review
author: Elease T.

description:
I almost gave birth to a baby on Saturday night and Sodini's was responsible for knocking me up.  I'm talking about a food baby here and the evil seed was implanted via their meat lasagna.  This thing was all thick and tasty meat sauce with more than a generous helping of ricotta and mozzarella cheese, which then was sprinkled with parmesan cheese by me of course.  I hardly saw, felt, or tasted any pasta and I was fine with that.  This thing called out to my inner roughneck while shoving my fancy pants qualities aside.

Considering how my friend and I were dressed you would think that this would be the opposite of what we were looking for but it was just right on Saturday night.  Even the Caesar Salad was a kick in the pants with its garlic and anchovy elements.

It's not the biggest place so if you are showing up at dinner time you will be waiting, even if it's a party of two.  Just park yourself at the bar and enjoy a few drinks to pass the time.
author: Luis M.

description: This place was great!  Great food, a little off the grid, small and quaint, decently priced, perfect for a couple.  Not the place to go if your in a hurry, our dinner was about a 1.5 hour experience but we made it clear we were out for an experience rather than a quick meal.  A full bar and friendly, personable (and very Italian-looking) waitstaff makes the experience even better.  I'm glad we happened upon this place and we'll definitely be back!!   YUM!!
author: Kelly O.

description: A throw back to Italian places of yester-year.  It has a "Cheers-y" vibe. When you walk in the door, you may get greeted with a yell and a point to a table where you should sit.  Alternatively, the owner may direct you to your table.  Such a fun and inviting atmosphere coupled with traditional, authentic, amazing food.  We lived in the Bay Area for a long time and this was our go to.  Then it was our weekend treat when we would travel in from LA or Sacramento.  Now we live in Texas but it is always a must visit for our frequent trips back the SF.  Order the pizza and go on a Friday when the singers are in house.  A great treat for romance or with the kids.
author: Allison T.

description: I'm giving two stars because the food was decent, but I can't recommend this place after seeing one of the waitresses yell at a woman and her child as they left that she was a "F-ing foreigner" while another waitress pushed her out the door.  This was after a disagreement about the very slow service. There is no excuse for talking that way to a customer.  I won't be back and I discourage you from going after seeing the way they treat someone with an accent.  There are lots of places in SF that respect "foreigners".
author: Steve G.

description:
Sometimes I get so tired of eating foo-foo Italian food in SF and just 
want some plain ol' angel hair pasta and meat sauce.. 

Sodini'a had it! All the traditional dishes....YUM.

Huge bar almost the same size as the restaurant.
The restaurant is small as heck but seems like its always packed...
So, if that doesn't speak for itself, I don't know what does!?!


Cozy little place with great servers~
author: S. M.

description: My favorite meal of the trip! Very authentic Italian feel. Seating was limited. Lighting was pretty dark, but can't beat some good Italian food with no wait for us! (We went around 6pm on a Sunday holiday weekend)
author: Emily M.

description:
Came after a long day of drinking in napa. Mark, the owner was behind the bar and was kind funny and kept my water glass full. The place was very full and it seemed mostly like a local place and most folks ere seemed like regulars. 

Great service, amazing food (gnocchi was pillowy perfect), lasagna the was perfect. Good value.
author: Mary Elizabeth C.

description: We love Sodini's food! The wait staff were great and we love the bar! The pasta and sauces are homemade and they are delicious and the portions are large for the price, and the we love the atmosphere and it is soooooop Italian! We love the bread, the chicken dishes, the other meat dishes and the sea food, the clams!  We love the wine and coffee. Who cares about  no desert, so they don't serve it. We can always go around the corner to get desert if we absolutely have to have it, usually full anyway. Will be back.
author: Donna C.

description:
Great food at great prices.  The portions are pretty generous too.  I always feel like the places in North Beach a little off Broadway have way better food, prices, and ambiance.    There is usually no wait or a very reasonable one.  

I've gotten their clam and garlic pizza both times I've been and I'm drooling just thinking about it again.
author: Z C.

description:
I love the HUGE portions. A friend and I went here and shared a salad and pasta dish and both had plenty left-over for lunch the next day. They also fill their glasses of wine nearly to the very top which is very nice. The food is yummy too. I had been another time too with family and we also all loved everything that we tried. I would recommend the salad with the dressing on the side because the salad is really delicious but the dressing is almost too rich.

All the decorations inside are really fun to look at too and you feel like you've been transported to a different world. Quite a fun spot!
author: Meghan P.

description:
Holy yum.
