My friends and I own a tattoo shop three doors down, and we have to put up with walking by this place every night, smelling the delicious smells, seeing all of the people inside having a great time. It's horrible. Because I can't afford to go there every day.

The food is above the rest, the atmosphere is charming and warm, and everyone that works there is your friend. And not in a cheesy or forced way, either. There aren't many places that have this amazing of an atmosphere.
author: Mez L.

description:
The food is very good and the service is awesome. Such nice people, great ambiance, well made cocktails, and very fair prices. I would totally go here again.
Its not your typical commercial, touristy Italian place in north beach and its pretty romantic. Can get a little noisy if its a busy night but, overall its a great place.
Try the gnocchi w/ pesto. Super tasty! Also the cannelloni is really good. You cant go wrong!
Oh, and don't ask for a desert menu. I didn't read the sign outside and i asked out waitress and i got a comical "did you read the sign, NO RESERVATIONS, NO DESERT!"
I will definitely go back here!
Cheers
author: Kevin M.

description:
Two words to describe Sodini's :

Mark and Ana 

Why?  Service with a smile and they never let your glass get empty ; ) 

My favorite restaurant in North Beach! 

Why? Their delicious Caesar salad and mouth - watering chicken carbonara. . . .! 

Best old school vibe around town.
author: Jenny B.

description:
The Gnocchi are like "little pillows of love"
I seem to be stuck on these every time we visit....but have tasted food off of friends plates...and found EVERYTHING to be delicious!

They don't take reservations....so get there early....or plan to stand around for awhile in the cramped bar area by the front door....

ALSO....You can bring your own wine...but they charge a $15 per bottle corkage fee....
author: John F.

description:
I had the beef ravioli again, and it was not good.  It tasted like it came out of a can.  

The butter was almost melted for the free bread.
author: Niniane W.

description:
Sodini's is a must every time I visit the City. 

It is a small neighborhood place that has been there forever! 

It has all the charm, history and ambiance a down home Italian place should have. It's like an organic collection of history that you couldn't even try to put together, it has to come together naturally overtime. It's warm, charming and fun. It's still owned and run by the Sodini family. 

I love the experience from the second I walk through the door!

The owners greet you right away and be prepared it is packed! I've never been there when it's slow. You may be crammed in a corner with total strangers for a little while, until a table comes available but it's okay because you share a comradery in anticipating the whole dining experience that Sodini's offers. Smashing up against strangers with a stiff cocktail is part of the experience.

The drinks are stiff and affordable, the calamari melts in your mouth and the pastas are fresh. You can have a full dinner, appetizer and a glass of wine for about $25 -$30 a person.... not bad at all.

The servers act like they are part of the family and have always been pleasant. I recently had the sodini ravioli and it may be my new favorite, although I can honestly say that I've tried several things on the menu and they have been consistently delicious. 

If you are looking for a utlra nice dining experience, and reservations with prompt seating,  this isn't it. Sodinis is down to earth, comfortable and a dining adventure that will leave any true foodie pleased.
author: Adela P.

description: A random, local bartender told us to go to Sodinis @ North Beach. We had planned to go to some other restaurant, but I am so happy we decided to eat where suggested by a local. We had the calamari for an appetizer, and it was the best calamari that I have ever had - big pieces. We shared the clam/mussel angel hair pasta for dinner (in red sauce). It was just as amazing as the calamari. We also had a glass of their house red wine, which was good as well. I didn't ask what the house wine was, so I can't offer up that information. The place was very small and you could see into the kitchen. It might have held 50 people for dinner. I had to use the restroom while there, and it was pretty tiny, but really does that even matter?!  Our server was very nice and told us about a bar close by to have a drink. This is a must eat!
author: Brooke W.

description:
My wife and I make it a point to go up to North Beach a few times a year for a great Italian meal.  We have tried several spots, but Sodini's is in a small rotation of places we come back to over and over.

The bar is usually pretty active.  The bartender is always very friendly, and if there is a wait - the bruschetta appetizer while sipping on a glass of wine is heavenly.  I've dabbled here and there with the menu, but my favorite item is the Lasagna.  It is a huge hunk of lasagna cooked in its own casserole dish.  It is very saucy and loaded with cheese.  It is probably the best lasagna I've ever had.

One of my few complaints with Sodini's is after a nice, romantic evening in the City - I like to have a little dessert.  Sodini's does not offer any desserts.  Overall, Sodini's is a romantic little spot with really good food, and one you should make a point to visit.
author: Joel V.

description:
I have serious mixed feelings about this one.

Pros:
The waitress was super sweet!! The girls I went with decided to split entrees, 1 per 2 people. This was more than enough. The waitress even divided the entrees so that each person got their own dish. She also recommended a lovely pinot noir for us. She was friendly, attentive, but not overbearing. And to top it off, she had an injured wrist but was still fabulous! 
There was also a pretty nice ambience. It was dimly lit, chatty but not too loud.
Overall the food was decent. The seafood in my clams and mussels pasta could have been fresher, but it wasn't too bad.

Cons:
The pasta was overcooked. By overcooked, I mean seriously overcooked, soft and mushy. Enough said.
Oh yeah, and there is no dessert! :( But this can be remedied with a trip to Naia gelato or one of the many dessert places in North Beach.

It's hard for me to give an Italian restaurant a good rating when the pasta is not al dente, or at least cooked to medium. It boggles my mind because the pasta quality was worse than at a chain restaurant like Olive Garden. :( Maybe it was just a bad day...
author: Cathy S.

description:
So I went here with my best friend for her birthday dinner with a couple of our other friends since she was craving pasta. What a mistake that was... I don't know who has been reviewing this place and giving it its four star rating but man is it not a four star place. 

First off the service is SLOWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWWW.
I put that many "W's" for a reason. Our food took so long that we got served bread twice, our water refilled countless times, and my friend took a dump and none of this happened at the same time. Our food took about an hour to get to us after we ordered it. I work at a restaurant that serves some of the same food and I know for a fact that our food should've been out in 15-20 minutes max.  The place was maybe only 3/4's full so the kitchen should've had no problems getting out orders, but for some reason they did. 

Second, I'm assuming this guy was the owner or a manager but he was extremely LOUD and obnoxious.  I don't know if he was drunk or that is how he normally is but when we were trying to eat and all we heard was this commotion coming from where he was.  

Third the food was very bland.  Ive had frozen raviolis that have tasted better than what I ordered.  My friend ordered the angel hair and wasn't satisfied. We were so unsatisfied that we ended up going to eat food at King of Thai down the street (which I might add tasted a whole lot better and its a chain restaurant!!).

There was only one positive thing that I took away from my experience at Sodini's and that was walking out the door. I would NEVER recommend this place to anyone.
author: Clayton M.

description: I will never forget this place... it's lots of fun,  good food and good service. The true Italian experience. Genuine.
author: Tom H.

description: My favorite North Beach restaurant.  Had a wonderful meal as always to celebrate our sixth anniversary.  Sodini's is the place where it all began.  Love the food, love the wine and love the staff and owners.  Service is great.  Everyone is very friendly and treats you like family.  The calamari compares to none.  We always order it out and compare it to Sodini's and it never makes the mark.  Love it as well as the awesome tartar sauce.  I have never had better gnocchi than at Sodini's.  They are so fluffy and melt in your mouth.  We have never had a bad meal here over the past six years.  A wonderful San Francisco gem.
author: Katherine B.

description: Year after year, trip after trip to SF and I always come back to Sodini's for the rack of lamb and spaghetti with pesto. Great wait staff!
author: C M.

description: Hands down one of the best Italian Restaurants in North beach and the city.  The staff is great and I have never had a bad experience.  The gnocchi, rack of lamb, and the calamari are to die for.  Prices are great and the atmosphere is old school.  You will not be disappointed.
author: Dino N.

description:
Love Linda, our waitress!! And Mark, the bartender. From all the Sinatra and Giants memorabilia to the huge pic of Jayne Mansfield with Sofia Loren staring at her boobaliciousness, the style of the place was off the hook. All our food was perfect (try the spinach and ricotta-filled gnocchi, it's HEAVEN in your mouth) and their house red was delicious.

This place is one example of how San Francisco is making me chubs.
author: Anita A.

description:
Sodini's was recommended to my by a friend that used to live in San Francisco. He said that it is where a lot of locals go and that I wouldn't be disappointed. He was right on both accounts. 

The owner, Mark Sodini was taking names and automatically made you feel at home. The restaurant is fairly small and feels cozy when it is full. The waitress we had was very nice and made sure that we had everything we needed and was knowledgeable of the menu.  Everyone at our table ordered something different and we were all very pleased with our choices.

Be sure to get there early because it does get busy and wait time can get somewhat long.
author: Kelly M.

description:
If you love great Italian food, make sure to check this place out.

My girlfriend and I ate dinner here last month.   We walked in off the street on a Saturday night around 8:30 or 9:00pm, and had to wait 10-15 minutes for a table.  While waiting at the bar, the bartender was very friendly, and made me feel like a regular even though this was my first time here.

I ordered a seafood pasta dish, which was bursting with flavor and was quite large.  I forget what my girlfriend had, but suffice to say she enjoyed it a lot.   Our waitress was great.   

The only reason I did not give it 5 stars is:
  - the house wine was just so/so
  - at the table next to us, they ended up seating a guy (who we later found out was a regular), who was noticeably drunk.  He was sitting by himself and tried to make conversation with us.  After that failed, he turned to his other side and made conversation with that couple all night long.   They were trying to have a romantic evening, but it was ruined.   It took the wait staff 30 minutes or so to realize what was going on, and only then did they attempt to talk him out of leaving his seat.  They get a plus for coaxing him into leaving the dining room, but the fact that it took them so long to do so did have an impact on their dining experience, and a slight one on ours.
author: Marc P.

description: Best evening in San Francisco. Excellent food and drinks! Erin was the best server, and the owner was a charming greeter/host as you arrive. Everyone goes out of their way to make the most of your visit. AWESOME!!!!!!
author: Paul F.

description: I've always really likes this place.  It's an authentic Italian place in the heart of North Beach with wonderful pastas.  I tried the New York steak and was pretty underwhelmed, though.  Anyway, it's dark dining area is lit by warming candle light and if you get a table with a view of the street, the moon will hit your dates eyes just right and...."that's amore!"  Perfect place to take a date!
author: Nors D.

description: Sooo good! We were there on a Monday,  they open at 5 and there was a line to get in at 10 till... that speaks volumes. I got the rotini al forno,  my companion got chicken. We shared caprese and house salads. The salads were both so good - not minimal by any stretch and filling. My pasta was superb. It was simply rotini and their homemade marinara baked with some mozzarella. It was the perfect way to showcase their fantastic sauce... I mean really flavorful and fresh sauce. I hear that the chicken was also very good. I would not hesitate to seek this place out again... fantastic food, fantastic and friendly service... the only negative I can come up with is that it isn't located closer to home.
author: Tammy S.

description: This is an incredible restaurant, with amazing service, romantic ambiance and most of all, exquisite food.  I have to thank Mark, -the host- for hooking us up with the best table in the house, although it was a bit cramped it was defiantly worth it, and besides, if you're a normal height, or at least anything less than 6'8'' you'll fit right in! Very affordable, and a great location in the heart of North Beach. An excellent experience.
author: Jack W.

description: Awful food. Worse service. Salmon was overcooked.  One member of our group was served 10 minutes after others.  Save your money. Buy Rao's pasta sauce.
author: Lola H.

description: Went on a date last night and although we started off wanting sushi, the parking problem in Russian Hill was so bad, we decided to head elsewhere. Fortunately, we stole the last available spot in North Beach and headed off for pizza. After walking to two more known pizza spots and them both having a super long wait, we bailed and stumbled onto this cute spot. The staff was great, the drinks were well mixed, and the pesto pizza was delicious! I'm definitely going back; and this time, as a first choice. :-)
author: Mindy T.

description: First time here. It looked cute. Charming interior. The waitress seemed friendly at first. But the bread was cold. I ordered the lunch gnocchi pesto. It tasted like a microwaveable TV dinner. The panini & fries my friend ordered looked much more appealing. When it came time to close out, the check was a handwritten check & we asked to split it. She said since it was already written, she can't split it... Odd that a handwritten check can't be split. She was just really rude about it in general. We ended up splitting the check for her & she ran our cards accordingly.
author: Steven T.

description: Visiting from Kansas City and stumbled upon this place on a date with my husband.  i could not have had a better experience.  The staff and other guests were so friendly and the bartender made the best manhattan I've ever tasted!  The food was delicious and the atmosphere was quaint and authentic--compared to the other restaurants in the area!  I definitely suggest this restaurant if you want a taste of the local flavor!!!
author: Laura B.

description:
This place definitely has a great atmosphere! Cozy, cute and very popular!

The bartender is truly pro - wow! She effectively served the long bar, organized the table waitlist all while being very relaxed and super friendly! A large group walked in after us and she nicely informed them the wait was probably over an hour but, if they were interested, she highly recommended another nearby spot! 

After our nice time waiting at the bar, we were seated in a cute table by the window and I was so excited thinking we've found a new go-to spot in our neighborhood! 

The servers are all friendly and cool! Price was very good!

However, our pizza was really generic. I'm not a picky pizza person but the bread was soggy, pineapple canned (I'm sure most places do this but it just seemed extra canned somehow), the ham seemed like lunch meat and overall it was salty.

I definitely want to go back but will not order the pizza. Hoping the pasta dishes are better - I really want to like this place!
author: Bonnie P.

description: The concierge at our hotel recommended this place and we went out of our way to go there.  It was so worth it!  The food was amazing!  The owner, Mark, went out of his way to make everyone feel welcome and since we had to wait a while for a table inside, he gave us some bruschetta that was the best bruschetta I've ever had.  I ordered the Gnocchi Gorgonzola without mushrooms and it was delicious.  The gnocchi was soft and filled with spinach and cheese.  The sauce was creamy and cheesy, but not overwhelming.  The house white wine was fantastic too.  As we ate, we watched Mark accommodate people even catering to a larger group who hadn't answered the phone when he called to tell them their table was ready and yet still insisted they sit (uprooting a couple from their table in the process).  I love the photos on the wall of the family and the fun attitude of "Don't even ask!".  "No dessert, no decaf, no reservations, no exceptions"!  The only bad thing about the restaurant is that it is a little too small to accommodate larger groups, but it's also kind of good as everyone gets individual attention and the food comes out made to perfection.  A highly recommended place to eat in Little Italy!
author: S C.

description: One thing I LOVE about visiting SF is the Italian! Hands down. The gnocchi is the best I've had my entire life!! And I know I've never been to Italy and wasn't a foodie when I was last in New York, but props to my SF foodie friend for doing all the research for me. Eating Italian is always on my bucket list when I visit her. In fact, I went the whole trip not having Italian food and I told my friend the day I had to fly back to LA, "I know it's hot, mid-afternoon, and probably not the best time to eat Italian food... I'm actually not even hungry, but I HAVE TO get my Italian fix on." Since my friend had to leave town for a family BBQ, my newbie other friend was awesome enough to take me to Sodini's and make my trip complete. ::BLISS::
author: Celia C.

description: Eh, not mind blowing at all.  Good, solid, over priced Italian food.  Doesn't stand out. Lots of other options I'd rather go to.
author: Tiffany H.

description:
OK, I don't get it and I am going to get killed for writing this review.    

Waited 50 minutes for a table for 2.  The bar staff were so great though and we actually chose to wait longer so we didn't have to sit at the crappy 2-top that came up first.

My co-worker, a San Fran native loves this place.  Insisted I go.  I thought it was fine.  Had spaghetti and meatballs, which is my true test of an italian joint.  My friend had tortellini (which I must say, he loved). 

I thought the spaghetti was mediocre.  The meatballs were tough.  The sauce was completely uneventful.

The atmosphere on the other hand was great.  Super old italian place with all of the history. 

Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing?  

LOVED the bar and wait staff.
author: Stacey C.

description:
Great food and great service. Even though they don't take reservations, they were quick to seat us on a Friday night. This is good, homestyle Italian cooking with good-sized portions and all the dinners include a salad.

Our waitress was great and more than accommodating.
author: Amy K.

description:
I have a friend who is a native San Franciscan, I mean born and raised, I know it's a rare thing. She recommended Sodini's to me so I went with a few friends to try it out.

We went on a Friday night and the placed was slam packed like a can of sardines - ironic since we originally thought the place was called Sardinies. Haha! No wonder we couldn't Google the address! We waited an hour to get a table and during our wait we ordered drinks and hung out by the wall, since the bar was overflowing. The strange thing was that over the blaring noise of the people in the bar the bartender yelled at us to be quiet. We didn't think we were being loud at all, then she called us a chicken coop. We thought that was a bit rude until another group of people stormed out rambling that the bartender called them loud. So now we think she called them the chicken coop. Not sure but it was weird and we were tempted to leave, but we didn't because I knew my San Franciscan friend was all knowing! 

Bartender aside, the reason I gave the restaurant five stars was because once we did get a table the waitress was out of this world! She was so gracious and funny we wanted to make her our Facebook friend! We even tweeted how cool she was! The food was mouthwatering and the ravioli and gnocchi felt like fluffy little pillows. We were bummed that they didn't serve dessert because we could only imagine how amazing it would have been.

If you are in the mood for outstanding italian then go to Sodini's aka Sardinies, but whisper around the bartender or she might kick you out!
author: Sandy G.

description:
Chilly night in San Francisco, so great to happen upon a nice warm dinner spot before heading over to Beach Blanket

Likely got the last open table at 5:30 before the wait started so plan to get there early.

Food and wine great.
author: Richard B.

description: Food was excellent as well as the service!  My wife had the Tortellini Carbonara and I had the Gnocchi Gorgonzola.  We both loved it!
author: Chad A.

description:
Sometimes I think its a coin flip whenever you go to north beach - I'm still afraid of running into some overpriced tourist trap where the food come out of a can. But you don't have to worry about that here. I had the penne with carbonara sauce and it was SO good. There was so much of it (and since it was rich) I had enough to eat for lunch on another day. The service was great and since the guys ate quickly I wasn't able to try anything else, but they licked their plates clean. 

I really enjoyed my meal here - and I definitely won't hesitate to come back.
author: laura f.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago with friends right after work.  Very friendly atmosphere with nice waitresses.  We had two orders of the calamari.. and I had the cheese tortellini... mmmmm nom nom.. they were both great!

since i live a block away... will definitely come here more often!
author: Jasen L.

description: Service was poor. Came in for an early dinner, the place was almost empty but they seated us in a cramped corner table. The gnocchi gorgonzola was ok, but the pesto ravioli was completely bland and flavorless. The bread was cold, the server only visited our table to write the order and deliver the weak food.
author: Kassie C.

description:
I tried this restaurant a few nights ago on sat night. The service was pretty good- they gave us a seat about 30 minutes in (while other restaurants was taking about an hour) and quickly served us some bread and took our order.

But even though the service and ambiance was good, the food was just okay for me. My friend and i ordered the gnocci and it didn't seem like the hand made ones that i usually enjoy in LA, the seemed all too uniform and machine made. 

But the bruschetta was pretty good. I recommend that
author: Tinaa W.

description:
Brought my boyfriend here and we were seated in the front window. Surrounded by Chianti bottles with candles, it was a scene straight out of Lady and the Tramp... I was tempted to order spaghetti and meatballs for that reason.

Post-St. Patrick's day parade, the people watching was priceless... but as was the food. We had ravioli and the calamari to start.. AMAZING! Plus you can write on the tables in crayon where we discovered that I'm a tic-tac-toe master! 

Service was amazing, wine was great but inexpensive and it was an all-around perfect experience. Thanks!
author: Meghan B.

description:
My wife and I had dinner here last night.  The place was packed at like 7:30 and the wait was about 45 mins which was what we expected.  We had a beer across the street (Grant & Green) then came back over and sat at the bar.  The bar is great to sip a drink and people watch.

The place has a real cool rat pack vibe to it.  It is a real small place jam packed with tables and tons of rat pack/Sanatra pics on the walls.  Our waitress/server was excellent and friendly.  The only problem is that there was only 2 waitresses/servers so some stuff took a while because they needed more help.  No big deal though.

* Bread they give you to start - eh...just eh.  I was only eating it because it was there.  It was just a loaf of standard Italian type bread.
* Caesar Salad - very good
* Italian Salad - excellent
* Polenta & Mozzarella appetizer -  pretty good and unique
* Chicken Parm - pretty good
* My wife ordered the special of the night which was shrimp and pesto pasta stuff.  The shrimp was excellent (nice big/fresh shrimp) but we both thought their pesto was not very good at all.  It was pretty bland and definitely lacking something.

I don't agree with a lot of the reviews on here saying that this place is basically out of this world good Italian cuisine.  I think it was very good but not amazing.  I wouldn't refuse a return visit because it was pretty good, but with so many other places that look awesome, I can't say that I'm going to rush back.
author: Jason B.

description:
Great little Italian place. My boyfriend got the chicken parmigiana and loved it. The chicken was cooked just right so that it was melt in your mouth tender. I got the cheese and beef tortellini with pesto: That was a little disappointing since I could tell they got both the pesto and pasta from Costco. But very filling nonetheless. Delicious minestrone soup. Very attentive waiters. They never let our water glasses go empty!

I would have given 4-stars but docked one because the ladies restroom had NO toilet paper and it wasn't that busy.
author: Roz M.

description:
I like it.  It's cute.  And cozy.  The food is satisfying.  And there are crayons at the table!  They're for big kids, too, you know.  

I have no complaints, other than, no dessert?!?
author: Marsha Z.

description:
GET THE LASAGNA!!!
Cute little place in North Beach with great and attentive staff. 
Dressing on my house salad was SUPER garlicky but delish. I asked the waitress to suggest a light and sweeter red wine, and without even taking a second to think, she knew exactly what to bring me, and I loved it. My boyfriend ordered the lasagna. The cheese on that thing was absolutely unbeatable. It is a MUST if you dine here.
author: Camille R.

description: Food is great, staff is nice.. Small, local spot Guiness is amazing! We went a couple times this week... Yummy!
author: Jaymee E.

description: If you're in the mood for a great old-school Italian place, you'll love Sodini's.  The bar is cozy, meals are delicious, and service is very good.  We loved our salads--the greens were fresh and the dressing was delicious.  The Chicken Alla Sodini was excellent (chicken with ham, mozzarella and cream sauce).
author: Augie R.

description:
I have been going to Sodini's for 20 years.  As an SF native, my favorite place in the world is North Beach.  It is the ultimate backdrop for a hot date, a celebration, or just fun times on a friday night.

I've eaten everywhere, and Sodini's is my alltime favorite restaurant.  Mark and his brother Pete are the owners, and are both charming and smoking hottttt!!!! (holla ladies!) not a bad thing to sip a cocktail while a ridiculously hot flirt chats with you:)

i also got engaged here, over chianti and tortellini carbonara...i swear, you could just grab the plate and drink the sauce in.....so awesome!!!!

not expensive, not stuffy or fancy, but very romantic.  Sinatra playing in the background as you mingle with the *REAL* SF....

Mark, Pete, i think of you all the time, and the only reason i don't go there everyday is because i would explode from eating massive amounts of your fabulous food, but i'm coming soon!!!!!

This place is awesome.  i don't know how else to describe it:)
author: Faith J.

description:
I can't believe I have gone this long without writing a Sodini's review!  This is a fave spot for the BF and I.  We had our first date in the table-for-two tucked in the front window and haven't been able to get enough since then.  We don't branch out much: 1 bottle Chianti, 1 house salad to share, 1 fettuccine with clams and mussels, and 1 tortellini with pesto.  The portions are rather large so we could probably get away with sharing one pasta (you know... lady & the tramp style) but I love the leftovers too much.

Here is what keeps us coming back despite the abundance of similar places in north beach (aside from sentimental value of course):

* We always have the same waitresses and they are great
* The don't take reservations but the bar area is a great place to kill an hour and is always full of locals and regulars
* I love the "Rat Pack" charm of the place
* It hasn't been taken over by tourists


But... minus one star b/c it is a little pricey.
author: Meagan C.

description:
Valentine's Day tragedy and no reservation for dinner. I MUST fix it! After brainstorming with my friend, I remembered that Sodini's doesn't take reservations, so there we went, on a mission to have a good time!

Sodini's is a cozy little restaurant on Green. The decor is inviting and fun, the music is nice, the service is friendly and the food is good. I had been there a couple of times before, and have always left happy.

We had the gnocci al pesto - yumm! And with a bottle of chianti that really complemented the pasta. It's true and disappointing: no fresh ground pepper nor fresh parmesan cheese. But, hey,  the pasta is fresh and flavorful, the service is friendly and attentive, and if you are looking for a last minute Italian meal that is fair, Sodini's fits the bill.

Oh, and Rachel, the waitress, has always made my experience a lot better!  She's FABULOUS! :-)
author: Simone W.

description: Great neighborhood spot and fun to draw on the tables. Gnocchi is bomb.
author: Kelly K.

description: Awesome. Excellent staff, great vibe. Very good food- the caesar salad tasted fresh and was the best I have had in a long time! I also had the veal, which was a bit salty but still excellent. The portions are substantial and the service was nice, friendly, and fun.
author: Jenn H.

description:
I have been to Sodini's on previous occasions and loved the food and service.  Unfortunately, when I went recently, neither was very good.  The chicken dish that I ordered was just so-so, as it was dry and unseasoned.  Also, my boyfriend's dish was very disappointing.  It came out raw, even though it was requested as medium rare.  After two attempts to correct it, they still didn't manage to bring out medium rare lamb.  

Sodini's was one of my favorite restaurants in all of San Francisco, but after this negative experience, I do not plan on returning.  I have never felt so slighted as a customer in my life.  Extremely disappointing...
author: Courtney M.

description:
Another journey into North Beach in search of authentic Italian cuisine and yet another disappointment.  Maybe SF doesn't understand good Italian food?

The menu is dumbed down for toursits as it is heavily waited towards simple, commonplace pasta dishes (a small subset of Italian cuisine).  These dishes were lacking flavor and authenticity.  The ingredients were not fresh and the wine selection was poor.

The only thing that saved this place from a one star review was the cozy, friendly atmosphere.
author: Mike B.

description: Dry bread. Bland food. We wanted to love it, but the food just wasn't good. Nice vibe though.
author: Michael B.

description: Deffinitely the tortolini carbonara and rack of lamb (cooked medium)..excellent for a group.  wonderful service you feel like you are part of the familia.  I want to go and try more dishes but my gf wanted to take some food home and for lunch so I let her take a portion of my carbonara (we order steamers also really yummy) so I want to get more t.c.  I need to go on amazon now and look for a wine jug like the ones they have here....5 star for sure..real san francisco dining
author: Greg B.

description: Overall good quality food. The family enjoyed chicken parm, lasagne and linguine and clams. Service was very good. Get there early to avoid the wait.
author: Bob C.

description: Awful service! The bartender greeted my party immediately; however, she gave us the impression that she did not want to serve us. First, she over quoted our wait time. Although there were no parties waiting, there were tables open, and a waitress stated she had an open table for us, the bartender still quoted us 45 mins! After we told her we still wanted to put our name on the waitlist, she told us "well are you sure? you can try other restaurants down the street. take a business card, and call me to take your name of the list if you stay somewhere else." She made us completely feel like she did not want our business. So I took it elsewhere. I will never return to or recommend this place!
author: Jannae N.

description:
Sodini's is a great old skool Italian restaurant just off the busy Columbus scene.  Dim lighting, good music like Tom Jones, Frank Sinatra, and Dean Martin.  That kinda old skool.  I've been coming here for a few years after Mister B introduced me to the great classico cuisine.

B and I hopped right in and ordered the bruschetta which is awesome and makes my mouth water as I write about it.  Tangy marinated tomato dice with herbs and probably crack.

I remembered this time around that portions are big, so B and I decided to split an entree, since it comes with soup/salad (by the way, the house bleu cheese vinaigrette is gooood).  The night's special was veal parmigiana, and I love anything that resembles pizza so that was my/our choice.  It was good, though not a great win for the veal itself. (My new friend Gail N. recently helped me realize that parm kinda overpowers something as delicate as veal--thanks!!)

No room for dessert........until we passed the first gelato shop on our walk down Columbus ;)

I'll be back again and again.  I've been told I should experience the gnocchi.
author: Aimee B.

description:
I came here with a couple of friends after attending a CD release party.  So, we were in a good mood, but it was late and definitely famished.   It was a warm Friday night, and I was a bit reluctant to have huge helpings of pasta, but my friends really like this.

So, the portions were huge and the food is rich.   The food is really tasty and filling.  We got a nice seat by the window, which is always interesting to people watch on a Friday night.

I had the Ravioli Sodini, and we split an order of garlic fries.  The garlic fries are ok, but the Ravioli was awesome.  I don't drink much wine, but my friends really like the wine list there.
author: Will A.

description:
Best Italian food I've ever had. Amazing service too. Had cocktails, mussels appetizer and for the main course seafood linguine and lasagna.  The mussels were the BEST I've ever had, how do they make the sauce that delicious? Nothing I've had since compares.  The linguine was also the best I've had. The bartender and servers were so friendly. 

Romantic date night tip: there is a large booth in the back, next to the bar, where you can close the curtains and have a cute date night dinner!  

This place along with sotto mare (next door) are my favorite restaurants in north beach.
author: C.M. C.

description: We went for the chicken parmigiano -- it was a couple of steps above Chef Boyardee, but not planning to write home about it.  Nice atmosphere, friendly family feel. It announces right on the front window:  no decaf, no dessert!  Never seen that before.
author: Susan M.

description: Went here for some apps with friends and became a fan. They were able to accommodate us (with baby and dog), seated us quickly, and made excellent food recommendations. Really enjoyed the calamari ... light, crispy, and fresh. Great little nook for lounging and enjoying drinks and food on a sunny afternoon.
author: Candid K.

description: One of my favorite places for Italian in the city. The lasagna is perfect and the gnocchi  is as tasty as it gets. The staff are very friendly and will make your dinner enjoyable. Plus, they give you crayons to draw on top of the table. Sold.
author: Michael S.

description: We love Sodini's! Where else can you walk in, get greeted by the friendliest face in North Beach (love Anna!), and get a great meal at a great price. My whole family (there's six of us so we're a hard bunch to please) loves it....don't miss the Tortellini Carbonara (but really, it's all good - the kids love all the pastas and the great pizza). They are so attentive, you feel like you're in their own home.
author: Mary M.

description: Went to Sodini's for the first time with a friend.  Great food and service!  Anna was tending bar.  She was professional and very, very funny!  She can make a great Manhattan!  Great sourdough bread, huge salad with meal and delicious entrée.  Love the décor...
author: Johnny C.

description:
Service is terrible. Went in at 6PM. One overworked woman taking orders. 
Bread was stale. We had to wait for our food. Hey, I've been going there for a while. I don't know whats going on. The lone waitress was actually preparing the pasta and serving it with her long blonde hair hanging down. Lots of choices in the hood , and this one isn't mine
author: Peter S.

description: No Joke...I am walking down Columbus with my family in tow and the Yelp app up on my phone. As I am looking for Tomasso's (sp?) a lady asks me if I need help. I proceed to tell her I was using Yelp and looking for a place and she looked disgusted. I had a quick conversation with her about the sheer awesomeness of crowd sourcing but still, she wasn't having it. Long story short she pointed us to Sodini's and we couldn't have been more pleased. Service was awesome and the place was super kid friendly. Great food and a decent price as well. This will absolutely be part of my regular SF rotation. Oh, and Yelp later confirmed that crowd sourcing works as the avg review was well above the 4.0 mark.
author: Kris W.

description:
Wheeeeeeeeeeen daaaaaa moon hitza ur eye like-a big-a pizza pieeeee
THAT'S AMORE!!!

Old school joint, been around forever.  Used to be called Green Valley (my dad has some interesting stories about the old haunt).  Of course, it's in my old 'hood so I gotta hollah at both the hood and the food.

Great bar, I know the bartender (though I only see the dude once a year).  Usually go with the homies, we throw a few back at the bar while watching some sports then head to a table for some parm, pasta, pizza, whatever - it's all pretty good.  I even take my ladies over sometimes and even that picky crew digs the place.

If Danilo Bakery is still open, we usually get some desert to end the evening with a bang.

Cool place, great hood, good prices.

Ya feel me?
author: Johnny L.

description: Just had an amazing meal here.  The calamari was incredible!  I got the Seafood Linguine which was filled with fresh seafood, has huge portions, and a delicious sauce.  I highly recommend this place!
author: Mara M.

description:
I took my man here on a Friday for a celebration. It's a celebration bitches! 

Anyhow, the food was awesome. Good ol' hearty Italian food. I had the pesto cheese ravioli and my honey had the tortellini carbonara. Both were really really good. We had the polenta appetizer as well, which was baked cheesy goodness to the max. Everything we had was really rich and hearty. Definitely comfort food.

No complaints other than that they don't have dessert. Why oh why not just throw a few easy dessert items on the menu to end the meal right? Tiramisu can't be that hard to make.
author: Sarah P.

description: I love this place! We stumbled on this place after trying to eat at Sotto Mare, Sotto was closed so we walked a block and saw this place. We were so hungry by this time and the smell coming from Sodinis was so amazing that we just about ran in and requested a table. Once we walked in we instantly loved the atmosphere! Friendly staff and amazing food!! I got the ravioli with pesto sauce and my husband got a seafood medley pasta. Once the food arrived we knew we choose well! Huge portions at a very reasonable price!  We have come back a couple times and it is always good! Great service, great atmosphere and great food!!
author: Florence M.

description: We met friends here for dinner last night.  After a short wait at the bar, we got a table for six and worked our way through the small but packed restaurant.  We ordered bruschetta, which was excellent.  The bread was toasted and the tomatoes were delicious (and I don't even like raw tomatoes!).  A huge platter of calamari arrived and we ate every single crisp bite.  Nicely done.  We split a house salad and their dressing was to die for.  I ordered cheese cannelloni with a tomato sauce.  It was very flavorful and the cheese filling was light and creamy.  My husband got the gnocchi with Gorgonzola. The gnocchi were fluffy little pillows of goodness and the sauce was perfectly done with the right amount of cheese.  Our friends ordered seafood linguine and gnocchi with meat sauce and everyone was very happy with their meal.  Service was excellent, friendly and they were on top of clearing away dishes and refilling water.  We will definitely go again.
author: Maria M.

description: My bestfriend wanted to try this restaurant and when I heard it was family owned, I already was anxious to try the food. The service and food was spectacular! I will DEFINATELY return to this restaurant!
author: Rodney A.

description:
This place is nicely tucked away right next to the alley where they filmed "Mrs. Doubtfire." It's got a nice old edwardian design and upon entering you will be greeted with loud happy customers and servers scrambling all over. The place is small and cramped, but not to the point where it will be a nuissance - in fact it just adds to its overall charm. 

I came here and ordered their gnocci while a friend had the calamari pasta platter. Both dishes were delicious. They were very generous with the amount of seafood on the platter and the gnocci had a very nice soft chewy texture in my mouth from the chewing pasta, cheese and pesto.

Service is also very friendly and the prices were very reasonable. It's definitely a place to check out the next time you're around North Beach.
author: Will M.

description:
Bread. Bread. Bread. BREAD!

I got full off the bread alone since it was delish! I ordered the tortellini of...ugh, I don't remember but their bread and olive oil/balsamic mix is yummy!

It doesn't take much to make me smile and Sodini's made me FULL!

YUM!
author: Jay C.

description: Great Italian restaurant. Loved the decor. We had the shrimp and seafood pasta. Perfect!
author: Monica C.

description:
Friday evening I was surprised by my love to another magical dinner at Sodini's...

Our first waitress, Linda, greeted us immediately at the door and just so happened to have the same exact private booth available for us right away! Unbelievable, considering the place started packing in patrons just a few minutes later! I guess we were just meant to have our spot again!

Linda was just as awesome as my first time (and first date!) at Sodini's and the food was just as delicious! 

I'm sure as long as we are together, Sodini's will be our number one choice for an all-around wonderful dining experience!
author: Karen C.

description: Ate here two years ago and had a fantastic meal so when we found ourselves back in San Francisco last week we decided to try and find it again. Could not remember the name but after walking a few blocks on Columbus we found it. There was a stated hour and a half wait but after looking and finding it we decided to wait. Got seats at the bar and after an entertaining 45 minutes we were seated. The food was wonderful again. I had the Clam linguini and I believe it is the best I have had. This is a great spot for its food, atmosphere and staff. We will definitely return. (bought a t-shirt so I will remember the name.
author: Joe H.

description: I'm a frequent visitor of Golden Boy and Bocce but never noticed this gem in the middle of both! My roommate suggested Sodini's for the four of us apartment-mates and we were not disappointed. The interior is cozy and intimate. The waiters and waitresses are incredibly nice and attentive. The food is delicious as well. It's an array of appetizers, pasta dishes, some entrees, and pizza. The calamari is a must! I had the clams and mussels in tomato sauce and it was mouthwatering. I'm only sad they don't have dessert as that would have been a perfect end to the meal.
author: Brittany L.

description: This is the best Italian restaurant (excluding those in Italy) that I have ever come across.  Having grown up in San Francisco, near North Beach, we frequently dined at various Italian restaurants. When we visited Sodini's, we adopted this adorably cozy restaurant as our "family place" and visit AT LEAST once a month! It's atmosphere is unbeatable and it's food is superb! If you do choose to visit (a very wise choice indeed), I would highly recommend the meat lasagna.
author: Eleonor W.

description:
Our dinner here was A-OK. The service was great, but the food wasn't very memorable.

The bruschetta was the highlight of the meal...it had a little kick to it which was delicious. The gorgonzola gnocchi was good (but REALLY rich!) and the lasagna was pretty A-OK as well. I don't know that we would seek out this restaurant again, but if we were in the area we might drop in.
author: K. D.

description: Our favorite restaurant in North Beach.  The Gnocchi is amazing and the atmosphere is warm and cozy.  Don't forget to get a glass of Zinfandel, the wait staff is on top of it and you feel like family there.
author: Lynn N.

description:
Visiting from Austin, a group of us had dinner here at the suggestion of a local bar tender. Boy were we glad that we went! The place is small, but you feel special when you are there and it's definitely not a place that tourists would stumble into.

I swear that we were sat in the "mafia booth" since we all were facing the door! The staff was so friendly and the food was superb! Our visit to Sodini's definitely kick started our best night in San Francisco.

Go for it...you know it's gotta be good when Joe Torre shows up for dinner!
author: Katie O.

description:
Ate dinner here last week and I was treated to everything I expected.

You see, I'm one of those dorks that loves little authentic places with charm and fantastic food.

Sodini's hit the spot.

I had the lasagne and spent 40 minutes eating every bite slowly. And I mean every bite. It was the best lasagne I'd ever eaten and that's a lot for me to admit (I make a mean bolognese).

If you're in North Beach and you can't figure out which place is more authentic, just try Sodini's. 

It certainly met my expectations.
author: Josh L.

description:
Cold  ministrone soup followed by tough cold dried out Raviolis in a bland  tasteless red sauce- Cold bread - no butter visible- four of us ordered different items. the food  had no merit.
all wrong  total cost $185 with so so wine.
author: Andrew C.

description:
It was crowded, it took them at least 10 minutes to get us a table even though we were the only one's standing around.

The waitress was a little slow in our service and the food wasn't that great.  I got the cheese ravioli with the basil pesto and my friend got the gnocchi.  We shared the dishes together and they both tasted EXACTLY the same.  Lame.

Also, the menu wasn't that inventive, they seemed to have the "typical" italian foods: penne, gnocchi, angel hair, and pizza.  A lot of the menu actually looked like what you could get at the olive garden.  Also, the presentation wasn't all that great, I swear my friend's gnocchi with the pesto sauce on it looked like duck turds.

Slow service, mediocre food, really crowded, and not very many tastey sounding veggie options, and a little pricey for bleh-ish food.

Also, just as a side note (not related to my review), the two guys sitting next to us were total d-bags.  They were trying to flirt with every single woman in there and I overheard of both of their unemployed status as they high fived each other for their "accomplishment"
author: Kameron K.

description: Simple, delicious, old school Italian.
author: Jorie M.

description: Excellent service, ambiance and food. The tortellini and gnocchi dishes are all rich but very good. This place is virtually always packed, even during the week- however generally don't have to wait longer than 10 minutes to be seated.
author: Romita J.

description: Not bad. The service was great, the prices were fair, and the gnocchi was good, but the meat sauce was a bit thick.
author: Tammy H.

description: Great spot to carb-load!  We stumbled in this place in the North Shore of San Francisco.  It is loud, packed, and all that but it had a great old school atmosphere and is in the heart of San Fran's Italian neighborhood.
author: Sarah P.

description: OMG! I am drooling thinking about this place! I had the clams with linguini! YUM!!! I also ordered the salad. It was the most delish salad I have ever eaten! I will be back the next time I am in SF!!
author: Dee R.

description: Had the pesto beef tortellinis for lunch. The food was tasty and loved the old school SF ambiance the place has- dark wood, only one TV, no laptops. The waitress and bartender were friendly and attentive. Plan on coming back next time it rains to enjoy the food and the cozyiness.
author: Johanna S.

description:
Since it was such a beautiful night (for once) in San Francisco, we were looking for a little place in North Beach to sit outside and grub on some delicious Italian food.

This. Was. It.

They had plenty of outdoor seating, even on a Saturday night at 7:30 (which generally would be a warning sign...). It was delicious -- I ordered the Tortelini with cream sauce, pancetta, and mushrooms. YUM! My friend ordered the Lasagne (as he believes the true test for any Italian restaurant is how well they make lasagne) and beside it not being in its own baked dish, it was delightful

I'm also super picky with pesto sauces, and this one was perfect. Just enough basil and just enough parmesan. Great!
author: Lauren F.

description:
1st time in North Beach.
Great Italian atmosphere, great Frank Sinatra music, delicious steak.
Good service.
Great walk from there to our Hotel Park Galleria!
We`ll be back!

Dion
author: Dion J.

description:
One of our favorite places in the city.  Even though we try to go someplace different every time, we have been back 4 times in the last few months.

Fair warning - Parking is atrocious.  I spent easily 40 minutes circling once trying to find something.  However, once you get inside the place is fantastic.

So far I have not had a dish I didnt like.  Their Red Sauce is amazing, and its obviously home made because its a bit different every time we go in (though always delicious).  The wait staff is friendly, and quick.  We haven't usually had to wait long for a table, even when bringing in a party of 6.  I expect to go back to Sodinis more than a few times, the place is fantastic.  If you havent been, go check it out.
author: David B.

description: Great neighborhood restaurant with a friendly staff and family ambiance. Try the stuffed gnocchi with pesto. They are sublime
author: Mark M.

description:
TRIED AND TRUE SODINI'S WINS AWARD

SODINI'S 
510 Green St., (415) 291-0499 

 It is told that, in San Francisco, a restaurant closes every day and every day a new one opens. Why is it then that we have a trattoria in North Beach that has survived and flourished year in and year out, maintaining a reputation reinforced by in the Bay Guardian's Best of the Bay Awards? According to the Guardian Sodini's is the "Best Old Style Italian Restaurant" in San Francisco.

 I asked Mark Sodini about this one night at his packed restaurant, with people waiting in line out of the door. "It's the employees," he answered, "Most have been with us for over a decade. We have one girl who is new. She has only been here six years. Our chef, Rufigio, has been cooking here for 12 years." Those of us who have enjoyed going to the restaurant for years know beautiful Ana. She runs the full bar and welcomes everyone who steps in the door as if the place was hers. Our server, Rachelle, started working at Sodini's nine years ago as a single woman. Now she is married with three babies. This is a family restaurant in more ways than one. Mark told me that his brother bought the place 16 years ago, and Mark joined him one year later. Not long after, Mark took the establishment over and has run it day in and day out, 360 days a year.

   In addition to his staff, Mark attributes his success (he has never advertised) to Old World Italian food, with many of the recipes being his grandmother's. He supplements the neighborhood feel of his place with products from North Beach:  pasta strips for lasagna from Molinari's and crusty bread from the Italian French Bakery. The restaurant draws eighty percent of its customers from the neighborhood. 

 The walls are covered in memorabilia and art. There's a painting of the old Green Valley Restaurant that Sodini's replaced, a mural that positions the viewer to look from the restaurant down Green Street, and another one, executed by a former waitress, that shows Mark's brother kissing his wife, amid grape vines. 

  As for the food, if there was a prize in North Beach for the best house salad, Sodini's would win hands down. The fresh romaine lettuce is supported by, black olives, onion, tomato, cucumber, garbanzo beans, croutons and mushrooms. However, it is the house made dressing, made of blue cheese, olive oil, garlic and lemon that makes the salad. The fried calamari appetizer is not your generic North Beach fried calamari. Sodini's only serves the rings, which are lightly battered and lightly fried, leaving the calamari extremely tender. This delicacy is accompanied by spicy aioli sauce. 
 
 The restaurant's signature pasta dish is Tortellini Carbonara. This beef filled tortellini ring has a light cream Alfredo Sauce made with mushrooms and pancetta. The tortellinis melt in your mouth and the sauce is light. Biting into a piece of pancetta brings this otherwise mild dish to life. Lamb lovers will enjoy the rack of lamb, infused with butter, grilled to perfection and served with a generous portion of linguine pesto. My favorite vegetable at Sodini's is the sautéed spinach, with mushrooms. It is fresh, tender and not greasy or overcooked. Try it with a little hand-grated parmesan cheese sprinkled on top.

 So one night when you are wondering where to eat, saunter over to Sodini's. You will be treated wonderfully, leave with a belly full of good food and feel like you have just been to an Italian family's home for dinner. Just remember their motto: No decaf. No reservations. No dessert. No exceptions.
author: Carol P.

description:
Their tortellini was the best, was it handmade at the store? Because I've never had pasta that delicious. I loved the atmosphere and the fact you can draw on the table! Paper tablecloth is amazing.

Their prices were a bit high, but alas. I will be back again, one day!
author: Ashley F.

description:
"It looks crowded," my friend said, "So it must be good."

Or it must just be a San Francisco institution. The menu said the restaurant was 100 years old. But what brings people in year after year after decade after decade? It couldn't have been the overly peppery frito misto or the bland North Beach style angel hair.

Our waitresses were nice, but the service was So Slow. I wasn't impressed. With all the other restaurants to choose from, I can't say I have any interest in coming back.
author: Elizabeth F.

description: Loaded with tourists and very ordinary. Loud and busy. The bar was good.
author: Wayne K.

description: A solid meal. Cute, unassuming spot in NB. Nothing unusual or out of this world, just good, quality food. Funny quirks -- on the menu you'll see their wine selection: 1. Red 2. White. And they don't serve dessert. Would defn return.
author: Kari L.

description: I ended up at this restaurant by mistake, and it turned out to be a great mistake! The food was spot on (linguini and clams, lasagna, minestrone soup, and house salad all recommended), the atmosphere was great and the service was good but not great. I would definitely make this a hang out.
author: Seth L.

description:
The trouble with eating good Italian food is that five or six days later you're hungry again.* The trouble with eating Sodini's food is that it sucks. 

Rule one of dating, and most of life: in the first five minutes people will tell you what they're about, you just have to listen. Same deal for restaurants. Unfortunately, I didn't listen. Twice. 

First ignored clue - Sodini's  large sign which proudly proclaims  "No dessert, no decaf, no reservations, no exceptions."  Lesson learned: when a restaurant claims they take pride in soup-nazi level service, you should assume that's exactly what they provide.

Second clue ignored - our treatment when we walked in on the Sunday of a three day weekend. The place was crowded and there was a  wait list. That part was fine. Less fine were the  bar and wait staffs' heroic efforts to ignore newly arrived customers. No "welcome to Sodin's." No "The wait is 30 minutes. Would you like to leave your name?"  We did eventually get our names taken but between the slow moving line and the lack of staff interest we decided to take our business elsewhere. And we virtually never leave restaurants. Lesson learned: when a restaurant annoys you enough that you leave, don't give them a second chance.

We went back the next week, it wasn't crowded and we were seated promptly. Service this time was pleasant and efficient. For two large portions of too soft, pre-boiled pasta, and calamari that looked and smelled good but was devoid of any flavor and two glasses of wine we paid, with tip,  $75. 

On the plus side, the atmosphere is good if you like old school Italian movies  - dim lights, dark wood, red booths, candles and Sinatra memorabilia. Also, people who dislike eating at shopping mall international food courts because the flavors are too complex, subtle and exotic may find comfort in Sodini's bland and familiar offerings. Others are advised to steer clear. 

I realize this review may come across as harsh, and I'd like to make it up to Sodini's by offering this slogan, to be placed on their sign, as a gift:  "Sodini's - we're so gourmet you can leave your tray on the table." 

 
Ratings:
Service: ** (average of a four star and a zero star experience)
Food: **
Atmosphere: *** 
Value: ** 




*George Miller
author: Bill S.

description:
Really 3.5 stars.  This place is really good when it's good.  But it can be hit or miss.  A few times I went and ordered something that wasn't so good.  

Grab a glass of the house red while you wait... and depending on the night it could be quite a wait.

Atmosphere is nice and it's really fitting for the locale.
author: Calvin N.

description: A friend and I went to North Beach to eat dinner at a couple of other restaurants and stumbled onto Sodini's.  WOW, it is this quaint funky Italian place which seems to celebrate Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack.   But who cares about that ... the food was AMAZING.  We had the best deep fried calamari that I've ever had here in SF (perhaps all oft he US).  I had a regular green salad which was HUGE and was dressed with the most delicious house made creamy Italian dressing.  We only had pasta (no main course) but it was cooked to perfection and the marinara sauce was delicious.  The hot food was hot, the cold food was cold.  And the service was EXCELLENT (thank you Blaze!).  Sodini's is definitely on my list of outstanding Italian restaurants in SF.
author: Ed P.

description: If all you know about italian food is Olive Garden, this place will be a good choise for you. The food is quite mediocre.
author: Felipe R.

description: Here I am again sharing my favorite North Beach spots to the masses.  Sodini's has an incredible ambiance and the servers treat you like family.  My fiance and I come here every chance we get.
author: Heather M.

description:
Based on the reviews I thought I'd be blown away. I ordered the tortellini con panna which gets the most reviews and it was...bland. The cream sauce lacked any flavor. I was so disappointed. The best part of the whole dish was the delicious garlic bread. 

My boyfriend had the meatball side dish which was also mediocre at best...

Service was good, ambience is definitely romantic, and I like North Beach so those are all pluses. But yeesh...I just thought the food would be better!
author: Latte Queen W.

description: This place is my absolute favorite Italian restaurant when I am in San Francisco.  Its a very small place in the North Beach area of San Francisco. I have been coming here for 5-6 years now and every time I go I order the Gnocchis with their creamy carbonara sauce. The Gnocchis are unlike any I have ever had.  They are filled with a green pesto sauce.  I call them Tiny Pillows of heaven!  They are super fluffy, moist and delicious!  I literally order them any chance I get.  They also make amazing Pastas, Pizzas and Steaks.  You cannot go wrong with anything you order on their menu.  They don't serve dessert which is posted right outside their facility...so don't complain as there are tons of dessert places you can catch within the same area.  Also parking can be a bitch if you want to park for free...otherwise there is a parking lot right in front of the restaurant which you must pay to park in.
author: Giuliana M.

description: I came here after sitting in another restaurant down the street and not getting any attention for 10 minutes (not even a menu).  I wanted an old school pasta meal and that is what I had.  Everything from start to finish was perfect.  The staff greeted me warmly and gave me a great table in the window.  My server (Vanessa - the greatest) was attentive with getting me a drink and bread.  She was so warm and friendly while being quick and rushing between inside and outside tables.  Wanting old school I went with the 1/2 beef, 1/2 cheese ravioli with marinara.  Unlike what someone else said I felt that it was fresh and tasty and it was the perfect portion for lunch.  I enjoyed the old school feel and the Sinatra music playing in the background.  After lunch, Vanessa suggested I have another drink and left me the bread to nosh on, which was great.  I tipped her about 30% mostly because the meal was so inexpensive!  I will definitly be back - especially to try the clam sauce and pesto (which I could smell from a neighboring table - mmmmmmm).
author: Kimberly S.

description:
I am in love with the clam linguine, I have had it at many different places and have never been satisfied by anywhere else, so I'd like to say I actually have a relatively good grasp on what good clam linguine would be.  Sortini's prepares it with lots and lots of clams delicately placed onto your plate. The best ones are still the one in the shell but there are still pieces of clam all over your pasta. Sweet and salty in all the right amounts. The cream is a little heavy though so bring your appetite.

I did find the chicken parmesan good, but not as delectable as one would like it to be. I would like the chicken to be a little less dry.
Their olive oil also goes very well with their bread. I think Sortini's is definitely one of the better places in Little Italy for Italian food, a lot of the places in Little Italy is banking on the fact that you will choose them oh millions of tourists.
author: Winè C.

description: Wonderful! Our waitress was HILARIOUS but very very good. The food was phenomenal. I am very critical and hard to please but this place nailed it.
author: Atalanta M.

description: Love this place!   Great home cooked Italian.  Reminded me of mommas kitchen.   Anna behind the bar was very nice and welcoming.  Very comfortable, inviting place to eat.   Mandatory stop for me and the wife when in SF.   Everyone that worked there was great.  Thank you Sodini's for a fun night!
author: sd e.

description:
If you want real authentic Italian food this is definitely the place to be. They're not messing around and to prove it, they don't even serve dessert - just straight yummy, hearty Italian food. The minestrone was a true testament to that with it's thicker broth, not being as tomato based as most others that you get in restaurants. The pizza, while not my favorite ever, was still pretty damn tasty with a crunchy crust and flavorful top. I was so full off those two things that I couldn't even manage to eat my own meal that I ordered, the Penne El Forna with meatballs (I added those myself  while clapping my hands and squealing with glee!) I'm SO having the leftovers for lunch today and I can't freakin' wait. Is it noon yet??

P.S. They don't take reservations.
author: Julia N.

description:
I usually avoid North beach because it's a ridiculous place. Tourists are ridiculous, people are ridiculous, and there's not much reminds me of my love, Italy. 

Waited for about 30 minutes, no complaints with wine in hand. Observing people around...locals mostly, good sign. No dessert...I hope the food is good.

4 of us shared 4 items, the tortellini carbonara was hands down the best tortellini I've ever had, even in Italia. Other items are all pretty authentic, and the house dressing for salad was super delicious.
author: Yuchi C.

description:
Came here for the first time with a couple friends, one visiting from out of town. For the main dish, I had their daily special, which for today, was the salmon. Portions were a bit small for my standard and it wasn't anything special. 

I am a huge fan of pesto sauce, so my friend let me try some of his from his ravioli dish. I was pretty disappointed and found that it was not enough flavor for my taste. 

To top the night off, someone took my umbrella just as it started to rain. 

I've heard good things about this place but I have to say that it wasn't the greatest experience. Food was okay but just that.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
I randomly stumbled upon this restaurant while looking for a good Italian place to eat on vacation in SF.  

I think I had the best Italian meal here I have ever had!  I had the clam and mussel appetizer to start.  It was in a white wine garlic sauce and crazy good.  Cesar salad was amazing.  Seafood linguine had a cream sauce and was out of this world - they were generous with the scallops, shrimp, and shellfish. Waitress was super helpful and friendly.  Definitely going back next time i visit SF.
author: Harrison L.

description:
Okay after almost of month of scoping out the dozens of cute little restaurants near our new digs, we've found the only Italian place you need in North Beach!

The service was so friendly and efficient, the garlic bread was addictive,  and the soup was not only enough of a meal on its own, but was tasty enough, too.  Then the meal came (chicken sodini and a carbonara) and we didn't even talk-- just ate and smiled!  And though large portions don't usually equate to food you'd want to take home, we did.  And I can't wait to get home to eat the leftovers for dinner tonight.

The best pasta in North Beach; search over.
author: Fernando C.

description: *Warning* this may be a biased review as I did consume 2 strong martinis before dining in this establishment. My first course - the house salad - wow, a HUGE step above your typical iceberg and shaved carrot catastrophe - I love it when restaurant's take sometime to perfect a good starter salad. This one had home made creamy Italian dressing, super garlicy croutons, red leaf lettuce, and fresh crunchy veggies. Then on to our appetizer, bruchetta, BOOM, like a slap to the face the baslamic vinegar is out of this world and I love me some good vinegar. A large portion too. Then comes the star of the show - my carbonara tortellini - a masterpiece of cheese/bacon/creamy fantasticness. I think I found my go-to Italian place in North Beach!!
author: Colleen J.

description: Came in on a Thursday night with a few buddies. We all split a pizza and Pasta with Fruto di Marre (Seafood).  The food was dynamite and service was excellent. We had a cute waitress named Lucia, who was quite knowledgable about the restaurant's history and San Francisco.  Sodini's is one of the remaining places in town, in which the ambiance makes you feel like Frank Sinatra or Dean Martin were sitting at the table next to you.
author: Marty F.

description:
Frankie said it best when he said "I feel sorry for people who don't drink. When they wake up in the morning that's as good as they're going to feel all day." 
Amen brother! 
The ravioli and the meat lasagna are amazing.
author: Stacy T.

description:
I went to North Beach indecisive about what to eat with my out of town cousin and his girlfriend.  We parked in a parking lot and paid $11.  I asked the valet guy which restaurant he recommended, he pointed across the street at Sodini's.  I decided to go with his choice, and boy am I glad that I did.  

As we opened the door it smelled like Italian food should.  Garlic, herbs, and yummy tomato sauce.  We were seated in the window with awesome candles that were melted previously that gave it a very cool ambiance.  

The menu was very simple, no frills.  I chose the linguine with meatballs and added mushrooms....OHHHHH MY was it delicious!  My cousin's gf ordered the chicken parmigiana which came with a choice of soup or salad.  Their salad was HUGE, enough to feed 2-3 people easy mixed with mushrooms, olives, peppers, etc.  Certainly wasn't your typical side/house salad.  Then my cousin got the gnocchi with pesto sauce.  He said it was so tasty and flavorful.

Overall, I was very pleased with this restaurant and am glad that the valet parking guy recommended this place.  You can't go wrong.  Great ambiance, great food, and reasonable prices.  And...did I mention that the portions were so big we had leftovers for the next day!!! My kinda place, definitely worth your bucks!
author: Jennie W.

description: Came looking for authentic Italian in SF and this hit the spot. The food was delicious. The house dressing for the salad is to die for and my pesto tortellini was perfect. Waitress was pleasant and friendly and ambiance was great for a lazy Sunday evening.
author: Alice G.

description:
What I know?
It's Italian.
I'm a raw fish & natto eater Nipo.
But I eat Italian food sometimes and I like it.
I like ethnic food.

And I like Italian restaurant's atmosphere because:

1. I like Italian accent waitress and waiter.
2. I like al dente concept of Pasta.
3, they respect mother's cook so deeply.
4. I like watching a old man who look like the mob sitting at the corner wears nice crisp ironed shirt and trousers eating NY steak.
 
Anyway,
Sodini is authentic. I saw a mob lookin' old man. Great!
We had a calamari, was big, nice and tender, not gooeee.
I had a Lasagna, big, nice, but I have never seen that the lasagna lookin' a bit like a Enchilladas.
It was flat lasagna with cheese and red sauce all over.
But most of all,
I did like the service, the waitress was quick, smart, funny and no pressure, she didn't have Italian accent but she was good.
It was nice and easy, relaxing, No tense, No anxious.

Such a great atmosphere.

we were very comfortable so kept talking after meal but nobody rush us out. 
That's not going to happen at KSF, Kiss the Sea Food, 
THEY"LL RUSH YOU & KICK YOUR FAT ASS OUT right after you are done eating!
FXXX THE KSF!

We had a lovely, relaxing, fun dinner.
Yes, I like to go back.

P.S. I'll eat Ramen tomorrow. yah...I have to....
author: Nobu K.

description: Man i am torn on this place. Let me say this. Awesome atmosphere. Really cool people.  If you like Staten Island style Italian this is a great place for you. If youve been to Italy you know what i mean. As opposed to an Italian place run by Italians this place has huge portion sizes. Heart clogging amounts of cheese and portion sizes that would feed Italian villages. And its all very good. Its just not what youre going to find in Italy. I give it 4 stars over 3 because they are very good at what theyre good at.
author: Ryan P.

description:
Any restaurant where a party of four can have a delicious and filling meal for $80 is high on my list.  Make it an Italian restaurant and I'll be a loyal customer.

Sodini's is an old school Italian restaurant, the good kind of old school not chain old school like Bucca di Beppos.  Table tops covered with paper and little cups of crayons on the table provided everyone in our party some good entertainment.  I had the house salad, which was huge and was dressed witht their own creamy Italian.  The bake polenta was absoluetly amazing!  Covered with cheese and mozerrella...I wish I could have finised it all.

They don't serve desert so don't get your hopes up for some cannolli, which is what I did.  But there are plenty of gelaterias near by to get you desert fix.

I highly recommend this restaurant and wish I lived nearby so I could eat here more often.
author: Allison D.

description:
Love this Place!!!  This is the best Itallian Restaurant in the North Beach area with Franchino coming in 2nd.  

Calamari
lightly battered, well seasoned
steamers(clams and mussels)
wine butter broth was awesome
Chicken ala sodini................man that was good!!!!

Waitresses are very nice..............they are on que with everything.  water was always filled.  food came out at a great pace

I swear .....those mexican guys back there can cook a real mean italian meal!!! 

Very rustic italian cuisine I think(hahahhaha).
author: jason g.

description:
Thanksgiving weekend is second best only to Burningman week in SF in that you can actually get a table at Sodini's on a Saturday night.

We only had to wait about 10 minutes!!

We split the ceasar, the polenta and I had lasagne and it was all really fucking amazing.

The wait staff were all incredibly warm and friendly, it definitely shows that this is a family business and that they love what they do.  I wanted to hug the waitress when we were done!
author: Alice S.

description: We ate at this restaurant.  The service was extremely slow.  When I complained to the waitress she yelled at me.  I was with my little kid so I decided to leave.  Both this waitress and another who was there (the big one) ran after me, pushed me and called me a "fucking foreigner."  I had never gone through something like that before.  It was a terribly traumatic experience.  I loved this country; after this, I wish I could leave.
author: Patricia J.

description: Went there with my wife and 3 teenage sons for dinner. The place is fantastic and the food was good and hearty. The waitresses are very welcoming and we all enjoyed the meal and feel of the restaurant. Prices were great too.
author: Mark M.

description:
I came to this restaurant based on the yelp reviews here. 

Food was good. Large portions (couldn't even finish my food)
Atmosphere was warm and inviting, great San Francisco charm. With lots of locals and chitter chatter around the bar area. 
Warm friendly staff welcoming and very inviting. 
Had the Chicken parm, and cheesy bread with garlic as an appetizer. Minestrone which came with my meal was excellent. But the Cheesy bread was my favorite. VERY GOOD!

I must give it up to our waitress. Rachel, I was so please with her I had to call back to the restaurant to remember her name as I wanted to include it in this Yelp review. She was very attentive, but not to intrusive, was smart, funny and charming. Will be definitely back and ask for her by name. As you should too. Great late night sunday dinner. Thanks again Rachel.
author: Anthony R.

description:
Old school Italian done right. To me that means simple, fresh ingredients and down-home service. They have a full bar and decent wine list. 

Interestingly, they don't have dessert, so we had to stick a candle in a tequilla shot for my brother's birthday last night. Who needs sugar anyway....
author: Gretchen T.

description:
After a full day of shopping in Union Square this is the place to go eat. The wine was delicious, my pasta was delicious. I ate all the bread and butter. I had no room for dessert so its a good thing they dont have any:)
I really like the decor inside too.
author: Setareh N.

description:
Although initially off my radar, Sodini's has won a spot in my regular neighborhood rotation.  However... there are a few key details as to just how they fit into my eating/drinking habits:

1)  Yvonne & I like to come on off-nights, when their is no wait and the atmosphere is super casual.  We'll chat up the staff, folks like Anna or Blaize, and often sit at the bar to eat.

2)  Their calamari is one of my faves... and it seems to end up on our bill more often than not.

3)  Their pizza is one of the best in the 'hood, especially the Di Lucca style.

4)  I've seen the staff bashed once or twice on Yelp, but we've had nothing but great service and what seems like genuine efforts to learn our names and remember us when we come back in.

Solid all the way through.  Worth checking out.
author: Chris C.

description:
A friend of mine recommended this place as a good spot to take an out of town visitor for a classic North Beach dinner. After reading all the Yelp reviews, I came to realize this place is quite a San Francisco landmark, which made me even more excited to check it out. 

The verdict? Eh... I thought the food was fine but nothing to write home about. On the plus side, the service was great, but I plan on checking out a lot of other North Beach spots before coming back to this one. I got the Tortellini Carbonara after seeing it mentioned a lot in the reviews. It was a little heavier than I had hoped. My friend Chrissy got the Angel Hair dish which was lighter but not flavorful enough for me. Bottom line, just an average North Beach experience in my book. I'd rather go back to Trattoria Contadina!
author: Priya N.

description: The service makes me want to bump up the rating, but I just can't based on what I had for dinner.  Gnocchi pesto was my dish of choice.  Pesto is usually so fragrant and in your face flavorful, but I could barely tell I was eating pesto aside from the green color.  I wanted to love it, because the little gnocchi pillows were cute and had been promised to be amazing/imported from italy/etc.  I sprinkled black pepper, red pepper, but nothing could make the dish interesting to me.  It is hearty, so it's good for satisfying your hunger.  That's my only positive takeaway from the food.  Our waitress was really pleasant, and the perfect balance of available without being intrusive.
author: M M.

description: I'm into the service as much as the food .
