Maybe it wasn't the kitchens best night or our expectations could have been set too high as well, but the food was only slightly above average.  Service was definitely sub-par.  I am used to having to wait for a table, especially in a cozy small joint, but once seated, I don't like having to wait 25 minutes before a waiter asks if we would like anything to eat/drink.

Returning to good things, pizza was great.  Special veal dish that night was excellent, but the veal parmigiana on the everyday menu was lacking.  Sauces are definitely one of their stronger points.
author: Ian C.

description: Ate here on a Saturday early evening - sat outside which was a little on the cool side but we are from the midwest so not an issue.   The wife had chicken Marsala and I had Ravioli - the portions were fair, but not huge.  The food was very good, but I wouldn't rate it as a 5 star due to cost / portion.   Service was excellent.  My wife also likes dessert after a mean and they don't serve dessert.
author: David M.

description: if you want traditional family-style Italian restaurant with good service and a relaxed atmosphere--you get it here.  Feels less trendy than many other Italian joints in North Beach.  Large servings of classic comfort food.  The food was good, but not great.
author: Pablo L.

description: One of my favorite SF Restaurants.  I recommend it to visitors and go several times a year.  Great for dates.
author: Jonathan D.

description: I ADORE this place! It's a quaint little place, with a tiny little bar, and somehow a very romantic atmosphere. It's has a very personal vibe that I love. The waitress was very sweet and friendly.  The salad was so-so, but the rest of my food...pasta and chicken were amazing! The wine was good, and even if you have to wait a bit for a table, you can always wait at the bar and have a drink before dinner. The staff are very, very friendly and the food isn't overpriced...perfectly reasonable. Trust that a little place like this that has been around forever has GOT to be GOOD!!
author: Dana W.

description:
Love, love, love this place.  The atmosphere is fantastic.  A great place to enjoy a glass of wine and talk with the ever-friendly local talent.  The waitresses and bar staff make you feel like you're part of the family.  It's truly the most comfortable restaurant I've ever been in - which is probably why you'll find me here almost once a week.

The food's nothing to write home about, but it really does taste like my mom used to make.  Nothing cutting edge, just honest, solid Italian classics.   You can do much, much worse in North Beach.
author: Robyn H.

description:
The food was atrocious and ridiculously expensive. I have never been so angry to pay $40 for dinner.

I had the lasagna. The pasta was soggy and overcooked and frankly tasteless. So they overcompensated for their horrible cooking by being heavy handed with the cheese.

The wine selection was piss poor, and I don't use the term "piss" lightly....it was aweful!

And the service was s-l-o-w even though they weren't busy at all. Since we were hungry and didn't have food, we snacked on the bread. Another mistake. Even the bread was boring and awful. How the heck can you mess up bread in SF??? There are great bakeries everywhere. Most places have good bread!

Warning....do NOT eat here unless you enjoy getting crappy tourist food/drinks yet paying inflated tourist prices!
author: Lev E.

description: Fantastic food, service and atmosphere!! Love the wine in the jugs. Will be back!!!
author: Nichole K.

description: Great food w/excellent service...very authentic!! Only drawback is they don't take reservations and in a small place such as this one, it can be a bit too close for comfort during peak hours...
author: D G.

description:
This is my favorite dinner-for-special-occasions place in San Francisco.  Whether it's a birthday, parents in town, or other celebration, Sodini's always delivers good food and a homey, how-North-Beach-used-to-be atmosphere.  I've never been disappointed.

Excellent beef tortellini, cheese ravioli, meatballs, pesto, marinara, house red, and fresh bread.  Friendly staff.  Reasonable prices.  Off of the main Columbus drag.  No skeevy people outside trying to talk you into eating there.  Basically everything you need.
author: Megan D.

description:
We walked up to Sodini's and saw how alive the inside was and knew this was the place to be for dinner. We were told we would have a 30 minute wait for 2 which I didn't think was bad for a Saturday night in a tiny restaurant. As we waiting we each had wine sitting on stools looking outside to the street watching people go by. I think we might have waited for 20 minutes before we got out table.

We sat down and ordered another glass of wine and the polenta fries. So good! We had endless supply of fresh bread and yummy it was. For dinner I had the gnocchi pesto and my partner had the carbonara. Each dish was delicious. I loved how the pesto was not over bearing and the gnocchi was beyond fresh. Our waitress was very nice as was the bar tender. I will be going back here again next time in SF.
author: Glenn M.

description:
Last night was my 3rd time at Sodini's, and I invited some of my extended family who were in town from NY: aunt, uncle, grandparent, cousins, etc.

They are typically a hard group to please, but they really enjoyed the linguine w/ clams, pesto pasta and gnocchi. The waitress gave my grandmother a drink on the house and she didn't have much to complain about (which is unheard of - she usually complains about everything).

I've found the service here fantastic and the food consistently good every time. You can't go wrong with Sodini's.
author: Chirpy M.

description: A friend and I were wondering around north beach trying to pick a place to fill our belly. It was raining fairly hard so we just jumped into the 1st decent looking Italian place. I really liked this place. The waitress and staff were super friendly. The food was good, I especially enjoyed the Minestrone and house dressing for the salad. The atmosphere was also nice: dark, small, warm, inviting. The only con would be that they pack in the tables, so you feel a little cramped getting in and out.  It was also fairly reasonable price wise. Although I would not call it cheap. Check it out.
author: Laurie A.

description: New Year's Day lunch with the fam. It was wonderful. The seafood linguine and the linguine with meatball were fantastic. The wife had a pannini. Also very good. The sourdough baguette bread was warm and delicious. We sat outside and had a very nice lunch with wonderful service.  We'll be back.
author: John F.

description: I was pretty upset as I left Sodini's shelling out major cash. We waited an hour for our table, which was fine since it was six of us, but when we were called for seating, we walked through the bar, and the dark haired bartender yelled at us!  Stating that they had no tables and we had to wait like everyone else.  Which is it no tables or waiting?  Would have been okay if she was nice about, but yelling at your customers? We walked on to our table and our water came very fast, but our waitress took over 20 minutes to come take our drink order.  Since we sat near the kitchen we couldn't help but notice our waitress was drinking a tall can of beer! I thought it was pretty funny, till she messed up our orders and then acted like it was our fault! Maybe she should have laid off the beer! As I  thought it couldn't get worse, till she messed up our credit cards and double charged one! Seriously?
author: Madonna Ç.

description:
I am SO FRICKIN MAD AT MYSELF right now.  

I left my to-go box of leftovers on the table.  

Lunch tomorrow... I'll be crying into my lean cuisine.  

Sodini's is TRUE Italian food - fattening, oily, hearty, cheesy... as Italian food was meant to be.

The wine list could use some help.  Mark is a little stiff behind the bar (and he's the owner... go figure) but still runs the restaurant.  The 2 girl servers have been there forEVER and are awesome.  The wine list is super limited and kind of sucks, but the taste of the food makes up for the super cheap Sangiovese ($25, can't get mad now can you?  CAN YOU???  That's what I thought.) that has a little bite to it and is probably too young to be drunken.  (Drunk?)

Overall, good times, small place, no reservations, crowded, expect to wait, crayons on tables, great food, no dessert.  There you go.
author: Plaid B.

description: This is my favorite Italian place in Northbeach. Real good lasagna! Me happy here! Good portions and very low key. The only downfall the place is small and pretty popular now, that means a wait, bummer.
author: Karen T.

description: I absolutely adore this little hole in the wall.  Cozy bar, locals scene, great Italian food, attentive service, decent prices, neighborhood feel all tucked away in my first city love...North Beach.  Here, you can come to catch up with an old friend, eat your troubles of the day away, and feel perfectly content to stay awhile longer.  I've never felt the rush to move along; even though they don't serve dessert :(  It's okay, Sodini's, I still love you.
author: Kelly H.

description:
i love this place!  love the food, atmosphere, ambience and crowd.  very old school and such a throw back to the old italian restaurants.  great character and love the bar, too. if you like che-che - then this place is NOT for you.  this is the real deal, excellent food, dark, great crowd and super fun. you must wait, since no res, but they make it worth the wait.  the blue cheese homemade dressing on the salad is to die for. i have tried to re-create it many, many times at home.  never can repeat it. 
 bon apetito!
author: CC C.

description: My husband and I were referred to this restaurant by a waitress at Scomas who lives in the North Beach neighborhood. She said it was her favorite. What a great tip. We didn't expect it to be really busy and so we were surprised when we arrived about 5:30 and the place was packed. We grabbed a seat at the bar and had a drink while we waited for our table. The wait was well worth it. The food was incredible, as was the service. There is a lot of energy in this mom and pop place. It was truly the North Beach experience we were looking for. I would recommend it to anyone!
author: Jan K.

description: 1/8/09 I always like to start with the positive. We are visitors here. We had to park about 6 blocks away in Telegraph Hill. It's a decent neighborhood.The restaurant itself is a quaint, homey. Pretty nice. The décor is a Sinatra tribute. The house chardonnay was great. The people were very nice. We started with the minestrone and house salad. They were ok. The bread was cold and stale. The special shrimp with linguini pesto was just not great. All of the pasta dishes we had were just lacking in flavor. Very bland. Our son really got the short end of the stick though. He had the linguini alfredo. It was the worst alfredo we ever tasted! No flavor whatsoever. Have some wine and soup, and leave.
author: Nancy P.

description:
I love Sodini's!  This place is very family-friendly and totally cozy.  The wait can be long during dinner hours, but the ambience is so nice that it's almost a pleasure to plant yourself at the bar and chit chat with the barkeep while you sip exceptional cocktails.  

Once you get a table and order your food, there's crayons at the table to keep you occupied.  I know "crayons" may scream tacky to you, but the ambience is not affected by this.  It is warm, candlelit, with neat old-school pics of San Francisco on the walls.  

The prices are reasonable and the Gnocchi is amazing.  Oh, and so is the cannelloni (but this dish takes a long time to cook).  If you're not too bothered by a potentially long wait for a table, check this place out, especially on date night or parents-in-town night.
author: K N.

description: The food here was terrible. We took out of town guests here last night at someone's recommendation and I am still embarrassed by the poor quality of the food and service the morning after.
author: Lanie K.

description:
Food: Like Olive Garden. We tried the basics - garlic cheese bread, lasagne, linguine with meatballs, and penne pasta. Everything was drowned in mozzarella cheese, the meat sauce watery...the bread had so much garlic, it was gaggable.  The only saving grace? The wine.

Loot: Expensive...and for what you get, not a good value.

Mood: Candidate for a restaurant makeover show

Staff: Nice, attentive and quick, but busboy kept wanting to remove our plates before we were done.
author: Michelle M.

description: After reading all the feedback on Yelp, my dinner companion and I decided to give Sodini's a try.  Very kitschy decor, but good, solid Italian food.  Our waitress was friendly and accommodating--very professional.  I had the penne with prawns in cream sauce.  A tad undersalted, but the cream sauce was silky smooth and the prawns were cooked nicely.  My companion had the tortellini with pancetta which was GREAT.  (I hate to admit when my companion chooses the better dish.)  Portions are really generous--served on these super heavy oval ceramic plates.  I could not even finish half of mine, despite the fact that I enjoyed it.  Now I know why they don't serve dessert--after having their entree, you have no room.  I'd definitely go back to try a few appetizers.
author: CJ C.

description: I just went back for my 6 year anniversary and what can I say, I was wrong to give just 4 stars. They treat you like family, the food is always consistently good and seriously, who needs dessert after a sumptuous meal like this? I always get their seafood linguini and there's a drink that is fabulous, ask for the blueberry lemonade, gidyup, it's delish and will do the job. Love this place and love the people there (Anna and Rachel are top notch women who have great hearts)
author: Natasha C.

description: You can never go wrong here!  I have been to this restaurant a few times now and it has been consistently GOOD!!  Great food and great prices!!
author: Catherine S.

description: I have to agree with the other reviewer, the pasta was overcooked and mushy.  Sauces and cheeses used were very tasty, but on mushy pasta it doesn't work.  This is not acceptable in an Italian restaurant.  I loved the ambiance, I found their menu selection to be typical of the Italian restaurants in North Beach -- nothing unique, but acceptable.  The server was charming and chummy.
author: Christine S.

description: Love Love Love! we ate here for m 25th birthday the setting was quaint and romantic, and the wait staff was awesome, they brought me a free lemon-cello and wrote "Happy 25th birthday Jessica" on the napkin, I thought that was really cute (totally saved it for my scrapbook) we sat in the window and enjoyed the most delicious Italian meal i'd had in long time. all around great experience. We try to go back everytime we visit SF.
author: Jessica L.

description: Very nice people and help.  They accommodated our large group (10 people) on short notice on a Saturday night around 7 PM.  We didn't wait long.  Parking can be a challenge in this neighborhood.  The food was great and the price not too bad.
author: Kevin W.

description: OUT OF THIS WORLD!  I am an Italian-American and tend not to eat out often at Italian restaurants as I am often disappointed.  I went to North Beach (short visit to San Fran) to eat at another restaurant that was closed. I "stumbled" across Sodini's and could NOT be happier.  It was DELICIOUS.  The gnocchi stuffed with spinach and ricotta is, hands down, the best I've ever had. The service was outstanding, the atmosphere was wonderful. I WILL return to this restaurant when I return to San Fran in May.
author: Jand J.

description:
All I can say is that anyone that only rated this restaurant a 4 star or less needs to go back. My friend and I have only been to San Francisco twice and we have eaten there 3 times. This past visit in June we visited it twice during our only 5 day stay we liked it so much. . My friend and I split the basil garlic gnocchi the first time we went and all we did was mutter, "Yum", as we took each bite. It melted in our mouths. The bruschetta is awesome. Fresh tomatoes with a garlic/olive oil over toasty bread. I cannot say one bad word about this place. The service was superb. Everyone was very friendly and made us feel like we were part of the family. Go early in the evening if you don't want a wait. That is what we did. If we ever return to the San Francisco area we will definitely return to this restaurant. 

P.S. Why we originally tried this restaurant is because it was off the main road of Columbus. I said to my friend, "Let's try somewhere different that is not on our list and is off the beaten path." This comment brought us to Sodini's and I'm so glad it did.
author: Susan P.

description: My family and I have eaten here twice and absolutely love it. The calamari is the best I've had, hands down, and I've had lots of calamari from all over the world! The ravioli and gnocchi were awesome. Prices are reasonable (especially for the area) and the staff is very friendly. It's like the family owned Italian restaurant you've always heard about personal favorite in San Francisco. Trying to find parking in north beach can be a real bitch, and they don't take reservations, besides that, this is a must-go-to place!
author: Mike M.

description: The place is awesome i stumbled upon the place when i got off the cable car and starting walking aimlessly on the streets of SF for a place to eat. I walked threw china town and got lost and found this jewel of a place. I was spectacle at fist but once i stepped in i feel in love. The bartender greats you says someone will be right with you and offers you a drink. The place is small and has a very great family feel 2 it. You can tell a lot of the locals go there for dinner because the bartender greats them by there fist name. The food is amazing and has a great selection of drinks to choose from. As soon as i walked out i saw a couple debating on going in or not and i told them its a no brainer lol.
author: Arno M.

description: Went here for a birthday dinner. Got a pitcher of the house red wine, salad, and pasta. Everything was very good. The service was wonderful, our waitress was super sweet and attentive, and even us complimentary after dinner drinks when she saw it was my birthday (you can color on the paper tableclothes). I'm from NY, so I enjoy the hole in wall realistic italian restaurants. I would absolutely return!
author: Ashely R.

description: My husband took me to Sodini's on our very first date over four years ago and I've been hooked ever since.  I will say that nothing is better than my Italian Nonna's cooking, but this place definitely comes close.  The food is delicious, authentic and the atmosphere is warm and inviting.
author: Dee D.

description: Great food, staff, and atmosphere.  Go there as soon as you can.
author: Ryan L.

description: Just bad.  The bartender was nice and we were seated quickly, but other than that it was all bad.  Can't really blame them for the terrible pasta, since they don't make a single morsel of it in house.  The thin, bland sauce is all their fault though.  The meatballs were cooked perfectly. If only they were seasoned even a little bit they might have been decent.  The waitress disappeared about the time the drunk next to us and his date, the hooker, really got up to full volume with their expletive filled rant about his old roommate texting him asking for money.  That repetitive rant went on for far too long and would have done a quicker  job emptying the dining room if the servers hadn't all disappeared.  Really bad experience!
author: Susan A.

description: Great food. Great prices. Big portions. They don't serve coffee and they don't serve dessert. The Calamari is always a gold standard for a starter. Honestly, no matter what you get, your tummy will be happy.
author: Victor B.

description: I was dead tired after doing the touristy thing ALL OVER our lovely city.  We had ended our day in North Beach around 4:30 p.m. (it was a Saturday).  Parking was easy at this time of day, and there were plenty of tables when we walked into the restaurant.  First off:  the ambiance---I whole heartedly agree with the comparison to "the spaghetti scene in Lady and the Tramp";  it was quaint ;).  The waitstaff are friendly, prompt, welcoming and genuine.  Portions are huge.  Started off with glasses of Sangiovese and the calamari appetizer---hands down the most tender, crispy coated calamari I have ever had. The Caesar salad was fresh and crisp.   Entrees ordered were the lasagne, linguini with clams and mussels, chicken parmigiana, penne pasta bolognese---everything was perfect, and again---HUGE.  This restaurant is a gem.
author: Ovenmittenkitten S.

description:
food okay, but nothing special.  of course, coming from the east coast, i'm used to great italian places in baltimore's little italy and north central west virginia (believe it!).  

felt tourist trappy.  but the real deal killer was the rude service.  i was bringing out of town guests and was hoping to make a good impression and that just did not happen.  rude, indifferent service and to top it all off, they lost my friend's credit card after she paid and then they were all like, "we never took your card!"  but turns out they dropped it on the floor.  and no apologies either.  so, one star for you!
author: Jeremy S.

description: I almost hate to write a review b/c I want to keep this treasure quiet.  Alas, I cannot be selfish and must share.  Sodini's epitomizes North Beach in what it should be.  Somehow it manages to remain a neighborhood spot with amazing food and great prices.  Ana, the bartendress is by far our favorite part of the experience.  She's worked there forever and never forgets a face.  You gotta love the crayons and butcher paper on the tables too.  I've mapped out some great adventures on my tabletop.  It's definitely the best in North Beach.
author: Rachel C.

description: Haters beware! This is authentic, amazing Italian food. If you are a local, you know what I mean. The ladies (and Mark) rock. You feel like family here and the food never disappoints. If you want cheesy, touristy, crappy food, go somewhere else. If you want great food, inexpensive drinks and a lovely wait staff...then go to Sodini's!!
author: Jen L.

description: The food was great!! I had lasagna and my other half had tortellini with pancetta cream sauce. Not only did I eat all of my lasagna, but I finished my finished my other half's dinner as well. The food tasted fresh and it is one of the better Italian restaurants I've been to. The wine list had a good variety and a good range of prices as well. My only small complaint was I didn't care for the ambiance, only because if you are a party of two you have to sit closely together with other parties. This really bothered me because I had a creepy guy looking at me throughout my entire dinner. Anyway, great location and the service was very friendly also.
author: Cherish J.

description:
delicious with a Capital Delish. excellent lamb and pastas, a cool bar, great service. this North Beach baby is worth the circling and circling in search of frickin parking. SF is so NOT suv/full-size truck friendly.

hey ! don't leave without trying the melt-in-your-mouth gnocchi in pesto. whoever thought one would find everlasting love with a plate of potato pillows in green sauce ?
author: Prima D.

description: Beef rav's with meat sauce was very good, bartender was fun and entertaining while we waited for our table. Service was good too. I will go again soon. Everyone was very happy with their food we left totally stuffed!
author: D J.

description: Love Love Love this restaurant!  Of all the Italian restaurants in North Beach, this is the one I reccomend the most.  Very old school feel to it with delicious food.
author: Kristen V.

description: I should have ordered one of the specials or the pizza. The linguine with meat sauce  was okay but nothing special. The romantic table with the streetview made it a memorable dining experience, but should have had something else.
author: Jeff L.

description: This place has good atmosphere and it's not right on the main strip of North Beach, so its not touristy like many other spots in the area. The food is decent but nothing stellar for this city. Crappy free bread brought to the table, which always annoys me in Italian places- I feel like that's a pre-requisite and sets the stage for the rest of the meal. Other bells and whistles that you'd expect at most good places, like offering fresh ground pepper and fresh parmesean aren't here either, but the food isn't bad, it just lacks a little umph.
author: Kristen L.

description: This place is amazing. Normally I'm not a huge fan of Sicilian Italian food, but their cannoli is so tasty. It's the epitome of everything amazing. Make sure to get the fried calamari for an appetizer (I promise you won't be disappointed). It's a big portion for an appetizer, so make sure you don't  fill up on bread.
author: Katie S.

description: I have to say this is hands down the most romantic eaterie in the city. I know, you're thinking, "An Italian place in North Beach? The most romantic in the city? What the hell are you talking about?" Well, try it out. It's stange, even with how closely everything is packed together and how loud the bar gets, once seated at your table with your ingenue, the rest of the world just melts away. And the food? Delicious. Sauces are done just  right (though bring lots of breath savers, they love the garlic here, as well they should!), and the Caeser has real anchovies. Bellissimo!
author: Tal K.

description: Sodini's very much so reminds me of my favorite Italian restaurant in Chicago Bertucci's Corner (in Chinatown). Be sure to take care of all obligations for the day before you go to dinner here because the food is very hearty and the serving are plentiful so not much is going on besides sleeping once you leave here.  The flavors are very simple and very enjoyable. The staff is a little slow but they're really sweet so I didn't mind... The prices aren't great but they aren't bad either especially if you factor in the fact that you're going to have at least two meals from each serving. All in all a good place for italian with a great atmosphere.
author: Thel D.

description:
After a long day of walking and shopping at Union Square, we wanted some pasta, of course we used our I phone and checked out the reviews on Yelp. Yelp reviews were spot on. Very small cozy restaurant, great service, great food and great prices. It was open late too. We will be back to this great little restaurant. Traditional Italian family restaurant.
We had Garlic Fries, yummy. Pizza perfect and tortellini with cream sauce yummmyyy. Perfect size portions. We will be back for sure, great atmosphere:)
author: Karen S.

description:
SODINIS, WOW!! What can I say!! This is the most authentic neighborhood local Italian place San Francisco has to offer. It has an attentive wait staff that always are willing to chat and be cool, but not over due it, the cast of characters are always as diverse as the city we live in, and the best thing about Sodinis is the unpretensious feel as you walk in. Anna, the neighborhood queen and icon is the most nonfamous famous person, and always has a welcoming smile on her face as you enter, no matter how busy it is, and believe me, this joint gets HELLA busy! As for the food, i almost forgot it was a restaurant I was writing about, I'd go for the Pesto gnocchi, with some polenta to start out with! Bruschetta is a good starter, and the Calamari is good, but deep fried, however, the best prt of the restaurant is that they keep it simple, easy, and fun, something that seems is a thing of the past with all these high end L.A. type restaurants popping up all over the place. Sodinis is a San Francisco throwback that reminds one of how the city once was, and though as you leave it feels like a party that you don't want to depart because it is such a good party, you do leave with a smile on your face and extra memories to look back on and cherish! 
I HELLA recommend Sodinis!!
author: John A.

description: Very good food and nice atmosphere. Simple ingredients with great taste. Really enjoyed it.
author: Steven S.

description: What a fantastic little gem!  Sodini's is small, quiet, and dark - perfect for its close-knit booths and cozy feel.  The pasta is amazing - particularly the creamy thick pesto, which pairs well with the cheese filled ravioli.  A solid house wine well compliments the meal - which was brought to our table quickly.  For a fair priced, but excellent little Italian place with a lot of ambiance, this is it!
author: Lauren L.

description: Best authentic, old-school Italian I've had in SF. Enough said.
author: Diana Z.

description: SO ridiculously delicious. The best part was my pepper steak. We also had the "steamers" appetizer, which had a really good sauce. This might be my new favorite restaurant in North Beach! Really friendly service, too.
author: Stu M.

description: Always a good romantic staple in North Beach.  Anna the bartender is welcoming and genuine!  I am always bursting at the seams after eating here...warm, fuzzy, full and feeling the romance.  I think there is better Italian out there, however the ambiance and staff make the trip well worth the parking.
author: Brye L.

description: This is my all time favorite italian restaurant in North Beach!  The place is small and always packed, but well worth the wait. The food has never let me down and neither has the service.  Just in case you are like me and constantly asking for things that aren't on the menu, the servers never object to helping you customize your meal.  The menu is more like a guideline to help you narrow down what it is you are in the mood for.  Bon Appetite!
author: Stephanie K.

description: By far - Best Italian food I have had in NB since I have lived here! My mom and I went and share the gnocchi and a pancetta tortellini dish. Let me just same....it was almost orgasmic! I have never had better gnocchi in my entire life! AND - (maybe i am the only one impressed by this) Caesar Salad that actually WASN'T drenched in dressing! I love that it is a quaint little place. My only issue would be that, because the tables are so close together, there was this lady listening and inputting in our convo the whole time! Not sure how I felt about that, but whatever....
author: Lindsay C.

description: GREAT IS ALL I CAN SAY OVER AND OVER CAUSE IT'S A GREAT SPOT!.....had a lot of fun here this past Saturday, was with a date and she needed some food and fast as she was fading....anyway, stumbled (literally) into this place and instantly liked it....the bar was perfect, the Bartender was great, got us our drinks quickly and as she also made sure we were taken care of in the food dept. promptly . The decor was great as well, looks as if Bucca De Beppo copied them and no it is not the other way around as this place has been around longer than Bucca. The other customers were great and very friendly as well. Will certainly return to this true Gem of place as it has been a while since I had such an enjoyable time in a drinking/eating establishment.
author: francis A.

description: Having grown up in NY and NJ I know good Italian food. When I am fed up with cali cuisine fussiness and I want nothing to do with an avocado or molecular gastronomy I go to Sodini's. Everything is good. It is basic Italian home cooking. I love everything from the woman who seems to have been born behind that bar to the Chianti bottles on the tables. I love the crayons, the butcher paper,and that they do not overcook their pasta which in my book is a crime that will land you in the bay with cement shoes.
author: J A.

description: Everyone loves Sodini's.  A longtime Northbeach style love affair, in that we may cheat on her a few times but we always come back on our knees... but that just might be the tequila we knocked down at the Grant and Green across the street.   Manly sized portions which don't skimp on the cheese are the norm but everybody comes here for the Caesar, the Calamari, and, of course, for Anna.
author: Genevra P.

description: Fun food and atmosphere for North Beach locals and visitors alike! The staff is always super nice and the food is consistently good in a homey way. Cozy bar is a plus too!
author: Al K.

description: Always an excellent meal when I go here.  They have outstanding homemade pastas and a very family and homey atmosphere.  Drinks are reasonably priced as well as the food.  By far the best Italian in North Beach.
author: Tim P.

description:
Since I am Sicilian, I often find myself a little particular about my Italian food considering my Grandma's make the best food EVER! However Mark and I were pleasantly surprised by our experience at Sodini's. I felt like it was going to be a huge tourist trap but it seemed like locals and regulars that surrounded us on Saturday. 

The food was delicious. Mark had the special which was the veal Marsala with linguine. I felt sorry for him because he had to share half of it with me. I absolutely loved it.

It was crowded so we had to wait for a while but it was well worth it. We had Linda as a server and she was fantastic. She made us feel like we were in her dining room and she was serving food to friends. That is the kind of service that keeps people coming back for more. Oh and we could not help but love the decor. The walls are covered in old photos and great sayings from Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin. Our kind of place!!!! I think we are going to try and make this place one of our "regular" spots.
author: Melissa P.

description:
In my eyes, the only place for that real home cooked meal feel.

They treat you like family.
author: Cris A.

description: The wait for a table was long, but worth it. Cheesy, perfect lasagne along w/ what I'm sure was Rossi/E & G  "house wine" along with a nice, lively atmosphere made for a very pleasant Saturday night dinner.  The bread we got to start with was stale, but the calamari we ordered as an appetizer more than made up for it.
author: Maria D.

description: I can't sugar coat this- It's a toss up between (good) sex and their seafood linguini. There, I've said it.
author: Lauren K.

description: There isn't anywhere else as San Francsico as Sodinis. The bartenders are natives along with the hundred year old wooden walls and authentic black and whites of Sinatra and Joe Dimaggio.  Anywhere that's been around for over a decade in San Francisco has to be alright- multiply a decade by ten and you'll see why Sodinis is the best. Try their ceasar salad and you'll never be able to set foot in a pasta pomodoro again.  Unlike most places in North Beach, Sodinis is worth the wait- especially when Ana is bar tending.
author: Michelle K.

description: A for Ambiance, B for Food. This place gets fairly high grade because it really feels like North Beach and the prices are reasonable. It won't win any culinary awards anytime soon, but who cares. Fun little place.
author: Alan P.

description: My friend who lives in North Beach said that there was "no F&*%ing way we're going to eat Italian food in North Beach because it's full of pricey pretentious tourist-trap restaurants that serve only dogs%$@."  And then he added, "well actually, Sodini's is the best Italian food around, let's go there."  So we went and were seated immediately (9pm on a Friday night too) ate a big meal, drank a pitcher of wine and enjoyed the scene.  My friends made it a fun evening but I could have done without the meal.  Maybe my expectations were too high after my friend's review.  Fried calamari was tough, pesto sauce was bland and the gnocchi was gooey.  When my friend asked the waitress for more wine she looked straight at him and walked away saying, "we'll get to you in time sweetheart."
author: Allison K.

description: Not sold, but heard great things about it and almost waited an hour for a table.  Maybe my expectations were too high, but I eat pasta A LOT and this was not impressive.  Thought the menu was weak and overpriced, and my dish tasted cheap.
author: Sasha H.

description: My date and I went on a Sunday evening.  The service was prompt and friendly, atmosphere transports you back in time, they treat you like you are a part of the neighborhood, and old friend coming in for a good meal.  Our drinks were kept filled and the food was delicious.  I've never had a better bruschetta and my penne was divine.
author: Alison D.

description: I love me some Sodini's.... The help (haha) Service is amazing. The food is so dammm good. I always love going to see the ladies. I am a regular. Rachel & Julia-love them, Ana at the Bar she is the best. It is a good family environment. God love the ladies. They keep you laughing. I can not say just one thing about the menu as it is all great food. Just go eat and enjoy. You can never go wrong.
author: Shayna M.

description: I ordered Ravioli and was pretty disappointed mostly because I had high expectations... it wasn't bad, but it was on par with a chain restaurant or low end packaged stuff you could buy in a store. Certainly not worth the price. I walked in because the place definitely has that old school Ma and Pa look to it, but it's pretty obvious the food is standard fare restaurant supplier type stuff and nothing special. Bread was good, and the atmosphere is nice. Would probably even return if someone else wanted to go, just wouldn't expect to be blown away by the food.
author: Ben J.

description: I can only comment on the bar here as that's the only reason I go to this place. The bartenders are awesome!!! Very friendly and just great. Been stumbling into this place on and off for at least (not going to date myself) several years. Stop on by for a glass of wine or a shot of fernet. You won't be disappointed.
author: Heather L.

description: Not a huge fan of heavy food, but if you're craving a decent Italian meal with some good ambience, this is a great choice.
author: Jane D.

description:
last time i went to sodini's, the wait was so long i was able to put down four glasses of wine before i even sat down to eat.  needless to say, i don't  remember eating the main course.  so when i had the leftovers the next day it was like rediscovering a delicious meal!  it would've been nice though if i could remember how good it was the first time.

that being said, it is pretty cramped in the restaurant, but it feels less so if you can get a seat by the window.  i like this place because it is off the columbus/touristy path.  and it just feels like what an old school italian joint should feel like.  plus, sit at the bar for a bit and watch the old guys hit on the bartender...it's great for a laugh.
author: Jessica W.

description:
How have I not gotten around to reviewing Sodini's? I should be taken to the basement and spanked. 

I have been a consistent, if not frequent, patron of Sodini's for almost fifteen years now and while the food isn't the most refined Italian fare you'll find in the city, it is brimming with cheese and rich tomato sauce and is the epitome of Italian comfort food. The atmosphere matches--with fabulous personalities on the floor and behind the bar, great oldies wafting from the speakers--Frank Sinatra, Louis Prima, Dean Martin, et al. and low lighting and paper table coverings complete with crayons.

Is it gourmet? No. Is it a little overpriced? Yes. Is it always fun? You know it.
author: Sage R.

description:
having previously dated both an art student and a phd student, i'm pretty easily impressed by any dinner for which i don't have to pay, but sodini's earned all five stars on its own. 

it was a rainy monday night when i ate here, so there was luckily no wait. there was also no wait for our food; they brought it out [almost startlingly] shortly after we ordered -- i had the angel hair pasta, which i loved, and my date had some sort of linguine, which he found bland, but i'll admit that i found him a bit bland, too.  the wait staff was my favorite kind of attentive: our water glasses were kept full, but the bill wasn't dropped off until we had completely emptied the wine bottle and it was clear that we had finished. the ambiance was also divine: slightly dim, potentially romantic, candles on the table, and crayons for drawing on the paper table coverings. 

i fell in love....with the restaurant, that is.
author: D L.

description: This is the closest to authentic Italian food as you can get in the Bay Area.  It is always crowded, but no fear, just head to the well-stocked bar for your wait! We have always received attentive service. The food has never let me down. It has always been fresh and hot. I love the warm and bustling mood of the restaurant. It is the epitome of an excellent family restaurant. The only downfall is that they don't take reservation, so you have to test your luck when you come here. We once had to sit next to the coat racks, and I had to crouch down during most of my meal, so the patrons can get to the racks.
author: Angela Y.

description: Great service, terrible food.  Minestrone, how do you mess that up!  Really.  The pasta was just thrown together.  I think this is a place to go when you are really drunk.  Cool location, cool bar, but aweful food.
author: Darren G.

description: Vintage North Beach. Bring cash and a date. Prepare to be left alone by the staff to enjoy your meal. No dessert, but that is what the rest of North Beach is for.
author: Heather G.

description:
Sodini's is has a fantastic atmosphere. The bar is always crowded and full of friendly authentic people. Ana the bar tender is hot, sassy and fun! 
The food is good but nothing amazing. Go for the atmosphere and enjoy!
author: Abra A.

description: Gotta love the Chicken a la Sodini. And the house salad is to die for. Of course parking's a hassle....but that's why they invented cabs. Check this place out and let Mark (the owner) know how much you love it!
author: Patsy R.

description: Despite the consistent one hour wait, I am always entertained, wined, and somewhat appetizer-dined at the bar before we sit down to mangia. On weekends,  with tourists and locals, you're packed like sardines. This place has some stereotypical Italian fare, but I really enjoy it and it makes me miss home every time! The food is excellent, and the owner is handsome and charming. He reminds me of Chris Noth. Each time someone comes from out of town, we head to Sodini's. They will make you an offer you can't refuse. And no I don't work for them.
author: Urban Gypsy D.

description: Great bar, great atmosphere, hit or miss food. Isn't that the case with North Beach these days? My favorite thing here is their classic Italian house salad - iceberg lettuce, red onions, tomato, beans, olives - big enough for two to start. Liked the lasagna but was unhappy with the spaghetti bolognese.  Definitely one of the better mom & pop type places out there.
author: J. R.

description: My wife and I stopped by to eat here on a whim and ended up pleasantly delighted with the ambience, the service, and most importantly, the food.  We ordered a pie so I can't speak for the pastas, but it was outstanding.  The crust was the perfect thickness (I like 'em fairly thin), the toppings were fresh, and it was piping hot.  We both crushed that large pizza in about 10 minutes -- it was so good.  Our server was very friendly and chatty but not to the point of being obnoxious.  We sat in the very front at the cutest 2-top in there- right up against the glass so you can people watch.  The decor is great and it feels a little NYC-ey.  Love it... I will return and I will also bring guests when they are in town and want a little local color.
author: ardian b.

description: I would say this is my fav italian restaurant in the city.  BUT you sort of have to be a loc dog to get service and seated in a timely fashion.  Now that I'm on the "outs" with my North Beach crew I haven't visited this place as much, but I miss it terribly.  The portions are huge and the pizza is amazing.  I highly recommend whatever the special is on any given night, cause it's given a lot of TLC.  The bartender is a real sweetheart and he and his sisters own and run the place. Ask to see photos of his kid and you might score an earlier seat.  Be prepared to wait here....or hit it on a Wednesday night....
author: Claire C.

description:
um, delicious. Best usage of garlic in the city. If the near 150 reviews don't already say enough, this a great place to attend. I forget her name, but our server was awesome, very friendly and knowledgable about the menu but not overwhelming and fake like usual. 

Try the ceasar salad. it was absolutely scrumptious and the half size is actually really huge. 

Also, not so much a great place for large crowds as it's pretty crowded inside, but it's great for 2-somes and 4-somes. :)
author: Sarah I.

description: This is an awesome place for a dinner with friends, family, out-of-towners, or your sweetie. Come prepared to wait in the extremely crowded bar with a cocktail. If you're really lucky you'll get one of the two best tables: the little table in front of the window or the round booth in the back by the bathroom. Service is fun and friendly and you'll walk out with a full belly, no doubt!
author: Katy O.

description: This place has it all.........except for dessert.  Best house salad I've ever eaten, the creamy, garlicky dressing, I've asked for the recipe and they laughed at me. LOL This is my ultimate favorite restaurant in the city. Food is great, hosts are great and it's so cozy. Been coming here for over 10 years and will not stop!
author: Gina M.

description:
My wife and I went ot Sodini's on a Monday night thinking it would not be crowded.  We were wrong about that.  Service is slow, as only one person was working the dining room.    I had the Caneloni, which was tasty, but not as hot as I would like.  To me, plates need to be heated or the food doesn't hold its temperature and perhaps I put more emphasis on this tha is deserved.

My wife had pasta with a meat sauce.  She said the sauce didn't really have that much meat in it, but was good.

But the food was tasty, just not a five star meal.
author: Joe S.

description: The pesto gnochi left me speechless. My mouth is watering thinking about it. The calamari was ok. No biggie. But the gnochi will not be forgotten! Service is very friendly and sincere. Not annoying. Very relaxed lighting. Perfect for a date, family dinner (please no screaming kids), or group of friends. Even the bartendar kicked ass. I WILL go back again :)
author: Food L.

description: This place is also so fun and lively.  Definitely a local restaurant that people keep coming back to.  Service is great - waiters are so nice. Wine is cheap and man portion of food is ridiculous HUGE!  I was starving when we got there and had to wait since we had 8 people with us - hence drinking more wine before I ate.  Ordered the clam linguine with tomatoes sauce - OMG!  I ate alot and in the end it looked like I didn't touch my plate - let's just say I left them WAY too full.  I coulda had that pasta for two more meals!  YUM!
author: Lily W.

description: Good food, and perfect atmosphere. Feels "real"...not like most places in North Beach. I really liked everything about it, and I will definitely be back. Had tortellini with pancetta and mushrooms and it was really good. I was with friends, but it seems like a cute romantic place to go on a date. Bartender "Mark" was really friendly and our waitress was sweet and knowledgeable, with no lame attitude problem that so many SF servers seem to suffer from. Reminded me of Brooklyn or the Bronx....places you see portrayed in the movies as the  "old neighborhood". Its not the finest food I have ever tasted, but for good, tasty, fresh and casual Italian it is just perfectly as it should be.
author: Kandy P.

description:
Full disclosure - I used to work here, and I'm friends with Mark Sodini.

That said, I love this place.  It's the heart of North Beach in a lot of ways - the Sodinis have long-standing ties in NB, the old guys love to come here and shoot the shit with Mark and Ana, and it seems like everyone comes through on a Friday night.  

I'm not a fan of the pesto, but everything else is always tasty.  Try the liguini & clams, the polenta, the calamari, the Valpolicella - all of it's great.  

No dessert (unless Fernet counts), no decaf, no reservations, but a hell of a lot of fun.
author: juliana e.

description: For north beach, I'd say this is one of the better Italian restaurants that I've been to.  The food was pretty good, but the customer service was very nice and accommodating, which is a nice plus in my book.  It's a bit off the tourist strip, so it has a bit more of a local feel and wasn't too crowded for a saturday night when i was there.  It's a solid 4 star place.
author: Andrew G.

description: I just recently ate here with my boyfriend and his family and it was a good time, good food. We got a large pitcher of wine, delicious bruschetta and the  lasagna was covered in cheese and the best tomato sauce ive ever had. Its a small place with a cool atmosphere and good food. Yum!
author: Britney K.

description: This place is my favorite Italian restaurant in the city.  The food is fresh and great.  Solid atmosphere - very warm and classic.  The only downside is that if you go during prime time 7-830 be prepared to wait a long time.  They do not take reservations.  As such, I now go early or late to avoid the wait.
author: Moe J.

description: We went to Sodini's twice on a recent trip to San Francisco because I was so enamored of my spinach gnocchi, which I have never seen on a menu before but love (make my own at home). The first time the waitress suggested the red sauce, and it was the MOST delicious dish I have had in years. The second time I tried the pesto sauce and it left me flat, so I mentioned to her how much I liked the other sauce, and while they didn't make up that special sauce for me, they gave me a meat sauce instead, which was decent. But the gnocchi with red sauce was so memorable. My companion liked his meals both times as well. The bread with olive oil and balsamic vinegar was also great. We enjoyed the atmosphere and recommend the restaurant highly.
author: Oregon C.

description: I felt the selection was somewhat limited, especially since there seems to be seafood in most of the pasta dishes, and since I had a hankering for a spaghetti carbonara I had to rethink. The penne al forno was pretty good though, if a little heavy on the cheese and the linguini marinara was good too. Service was friendly and prompt although we felt a little harried as they started cleaning up around us before 10pm (on a Sunday).
author: Stuart J.

description: If you're looking for an old school American-Italian place, this is IT! Sodini's will not disappoint you. It's dimly lit and romantic, but the staff is all personality and do a good job of breaking the quiet and cozy ice. They were packed late on a Saturday night, so we took a spot at the bar.  The house red ($5) was smooth and drinkable, and we split an order of the North Beach angel hair (pasta with a sun dried tomato, green onion, marinara, about $13), which was simple and tasty. They split the pasta without our asking (very nice!), and brought a generous bread basket and some nice olive oil to start us off. A great value and delicious ambiance.
author: Rachelle A.

description: Have room in your arteries for Sodini's Pepper Steak?  Make room, damn it.  It's incredible.  But spare yourself the minestrone on the same night -- you're asking for a traffic jam on the Aorta Expressway.   Consistently good as the food is, I really come for the service.  Not a hint of pretention in the place.  Perhaps the only restaurant in SF I've felt welcome at since day one.
author: Big Stu L.

description: I came here on the evening of Saturday, 2-9-08 with two good friends of mine. There was a wait but time flew by as we had wine and bruscetta at the bar. The caesar salad was good. I thought my friends gnocci in the tomato cream sauce was the best dish. My ravioli were just okay. My other friends salmon was also a good entree, cooked to perfection and lightly seasoned, very fresh tasting but her pasta was overcooked and it was drenched in green pesto, a little too much sauce for my liking. The bread was fabulous and service was friendly.
author: Lorraine B.

description: Very cool place in a great neighborhood!!  A little cozy but the staff is very friendly.  My girlfriend had some type of veal dish.....she wasn't too impressed.  I however had a seafood linguine dish and it was out of this world!!  I would recommend this place.  You may have to wait (we went on a Friday night) but its worth it.  ps.....the bathrooms need a little help (too small).
author: Alex S.

description: What an amazing restaurant...I came here to surprise my gf for her birthday. At the same time, I was going to surprise her and propose to her but being that I was from NJ, I wasn't exactly sure how to plan the night until I called ther restaurant for reservations and spoke to Mark. He was SOOOO HELPFUL...Though they don't usually take reservations, he reserved the best seat in the house for me and put me in the hands of Linda our waitress. Food was excellent..Service was excellent.. Linda helped me hide the ring in a "to-go" box and we went straight to Coit Tower where I proposed to my new fiance. It went perfectly and I couldn't have done it without the excellent hospitality and service of Mark, Linda, and the entire staff of Sodini's. Looking forward to going back there on our future anniversaries.
author: mike t.

description: They have respectable wine, okay food and their service is wonderful.  Eat at the bar or at a table, you won't miss out on the decor and attention the staff have placed on you.  The mussels are amazing, pasta typical, alcohol in abundance, decor in good taste and service pleasantly fab.
author: Stephanie J.

description: A nice little place.  I had the stuffed pork chop, which was juicy and tasted like it was actually grilled.  The house salad was much bigger than I expected, and had a lot of flavor.  It was a bit crowded inside and hard to find the hostess to put your name down, but all in all I was pretty happy with Sodini's.
author: Jake B.

description: So I might be the first person to give this place 3 stars in a long time.  I have say that when you read such great reviews on yelp about a place you have unrealistic expectations.  I went on a Tuesday night so no wait.  The staff was nice and yes, the portions were quite big.  The calamari though was probably the only thing that made me excited.  We had 3 other pasta dishes and they were all mediocre at best.  The chicken scallopine was a special that day and was rather bland.  Overall it was not a bad dining experience but I really wouldn't say it's the best place in North Beach...not at all.
author: Jean T.

description: Best calamari I have ever had. Friendly, cozy atmosphere. Absolutely recommended.
author: Katy D.

description: Gotta love this place on a cold foggy night (or any other night for that matter).  The wait staff is like your family and the place is cozy and filled with local flavor.  The cream sauces are to die for and the Italian food the real deal.  Ask to split a house salad and they bring you 2 huge individual plates.  No need to have people standing outside this joint trying to get tourists inside...the food speaks for itself.  One of my favorite places in the city!
author: Karie V.

description: I absolutely enjoyed this little place in North Beach.  The friendly Italian staff, great food and tasty wine.  I tried a simple dish of ravioli with marinara sauce and was not disappointed.  I would absolutely go back to this place.  The down side is that they don't take reservations so you need to get in early and get your name on the list.
author: Monica R.

description: My roommates swear by this place for roommate dinners. I've been here a couple times, and if reviews were all about service and personality, sitting at the bar would earn this place 4 if not 5 stars. but it is a restaurant, and food is king, and I love italian food, and this is decent italian food, but nothing great. so great atmosphere plus decent italian food makes for a good place to drinks a few drinks with friends and have a bit of a bite, but no need to gorge here
author: Rich B.

description: Enjoyable, authentic trattoria feel, mixed with a friendly staff that zaps that buttoned-up pomp of a candle-lit diningroom that a lot of trattorias go for.  An enjoyable place for quiet conversation, but the prices are a bit steep for a menu that I wouldn't shake a stick at.
author: Andrew H.

description: A good walk in option off the main drag in North Beach.  I like to sit at the bar for a few cocktails before dinner and talk with the regulars.  The food is not the most outstanding Italian you'll ever enjoy, but it's consistently good, they bring you huge portions, and it's inexpensive.
author: Bridget T.

description: For a few minutes we thought we were in Goodfella's.  For  the price, quality and quantity this place is just great. The BRUSCETTA O MY GOD!!!!!!!!!!!  I thought I made the best...until I had there's.   The nocchi nostri was awesome,  the pesto was good but we did have to add salt...it lacked a little seasoning.  I think if the real Italian's are patronizing Sordini's then you can't go wrong.  It made my meal even better to see a huge Italian family walk in...I just knew it was going to be great, and it was.
author: annie z.

description: Great food, local vibe.  Not touristy.  Would be a good date place b/c it's small and intimate.  Bartender is very friendly.  Reasonably priced (like $65 for two people, a drink each and splitting an app).  What's not to like?
author: Rob E.

description: This is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco - keep in mind my favorite cuisine is Italian.  It's Italian-American to perfection, from the enormous dinner salad with the most delicious parmesan italian dressing i've ever had, to the specially made (for me, because i request it) gnocchi in marinara, to the crayons and the authentic north beach neighborhood ambiance.  The staff is affable.  Regulars line the bar.  It's much less touristy than the traps lining Columbus (without an ounce of pretention), and much tastier too.  Prices are reasonable considering the portions.  This restaurant is San Francisco to me.  I'm veg, but my meat eater friends consistently rave.
author: Mike C.

description: Mediocre food and service.  Tasted like pasta sauce out of a jar.
author: Tiffany L.

description: Walked right in, no waits for 3 of us at 7.30pm on a Sunday night.  The place looks like something out of an old Scorsese  flick: candles, dim pink lighting, Sinatra pics, plastic grapes.  It was very dark,  and we were all a bit tired and worse for wear and thankful for the complimentary lighting (made us look better and was helpful to tired eyes). The waitress was friendly and perked us all up. The pinot she recommended was great. The house salad, which we shared, was divided up on to 3 plates for us to ensure easier eating and was massive. I had the gnocchi nostri and I'm still salivating at the thought of it a few days later. Will definitely return time and time again. Seems to be the perfect mid-week local.
author: MissSkip Z.

description: An excellent date night location. Intimate, cool-vibe, old-school, delicious food and excellent service. Usually Anna is working the bar and she makes a smashing Manhattan! Oh yum!
author: S M.

description: great food. a true gem in NB.
author: Susan L.

description: I saw this place featured on a local television show awhile back and kept in mind whenever I'm in North Beach and craving Italian. I went there last Friday when I had a relative from out of town visiting. They don't take reservations so I called ahead of time and was told to come on over. It's a good thing we did because right after we stepped through the door, a line was forming behind us. We got seated right away and I ordered a martini which was nice and strong! The waitresses were very friendly and did apologize for our entrees taking some time due to them being slammed. I didn't mind because every time I ordered a drink, it arrived immediately. We shared the minestrone soup- great taste and hearty. My cousin ordered the pasta with clams which was a nice white sauce that was flavorful without being too creamy or heavy and the clams were gooood. I ordered the Chicken Alla Sodini which was grilled chicken with ham and mozzarella on top. The chicken was grilled perfectly and very moist, also full of flavor. We licked our plates clean. Being from the area, this isn't a tourist trap and offers authentic Italian food that makes you still think about it the next day. Highly recommend!
author: gail c.

description: Every time I walk by this restaurant, I cannot believe it's so full of people.  I've been here twice: once about 10 years ago and once recently.  The first time I went there I thought that this was the kind of Italian restaurant that people who had never had good Italian food enjoyed.  Lots of heavy cream and very salty.  Pasta with pesto swimming in creamy pesto sauce.  I figured it may have just been a bad night so went back recently.  Same deal.  My wife and daughter agreed.  We live in the neighborhood - with so many choices, why in the world would you go here?
author: steve c.

description:
I liked the atmosphere and people there were very nice.  However, we got one of the seats right at the front window, so we were not so crowded (i feel sorry for the table of 6 stuck in the passage between the bar and dining room).

The food is fine, nothing special.   

Want relatively inexpensive, yet good italian with "charm", this is a great place.
author: Hal B.

description:
It's amazing how many relatives the Sodini owners have on Yelp.  It's also amazing how they can lie so well on Yelp.  I used to trust all of the reviewers at this site....until I got to this set.  This place was so bad that I actually prefer to eat my dormitory food (and trust me, my dormitory food is pretty nasty). 

Our seafood linguini had rubbery/fishy calamari, unveined shrimp, mushy mussels, small clams, and bland sauce (tomato cream sauce...nasty).  The linguini ala casa (with chunky meat sauce) tasted like it was microwaved pasta with ragu poured on top...seriously!  

If you guys like this joint, you'll think hitting up the olive garden is like partaking in a culinary orgasm.  bon appetit.
author: glustin l.

description: Love Sodini's! You can't beat their fried calamari, and their steak with fries is fantastic. Along with their delicious food, Sodini's is the last place left in North Beach with that old world charm. If you're looking for a real local treat it's the only place to go.
author: Star B.

description:
We arrived late to meet out of town family here (hi, North Beach parking! we missed you! literally!) and found them seated and sated with wine and incredibly good, soft bread. My first major concern was the drunken amorous couple who were taking up my space on the bench side of the table; I was anticipating a long night of discomfort until the manager came over and told them, as far as we can tell, to get a freaking room. They were doggy-bagged and out in five minutes. A manager who actually manages, and me not having to deal with someone else's PDA in my lap, might bump it up to five stars for me.

But the food takes it back down to four. The salmon special indeed had special salmon - tender enough to melt in your mouth - but the side linguine drowned in a sea of so-so pesto. The gnocchi in pink sauce was, well, gnocchi.

Going back to the service, someone in our group had ordered a sauvignon and when she was brought the red when she'd wanted the white, the waitress immediately apologized (even though it wasn't her fault). Also, the fam said the manager had come by with parking suggestions when he noticed our empty chairs. The wine was a generous pour, and our water glasses never got less than half full.

In short, I'd definitely go back (if I wasn't on a quest to never go to the same restaurant twice); I'd just order something different.
author: Tallulah D.

description: The house salad is to die for and the creamy pesto is unbelievably good. Will be back for sure, in fact I can't wait.
author: Ginger C.

description: Classic low-lit red checker cloth atmosphere, could even be romantic but works really well for squinting at east coast family members whilst getting loose.  Often populated by locals having a few with dinner before going to GandC's and blowing dessert.  Just what you'd expect for food but oh well it fits its niche, staff and service are just about perfect.  Overall, I think it would be tough to be dissapointed.  I always get the seafood linguini.
author: The I.

description: the caprese had neither garlic nor basil. the draft beer was watered down, crimnally so. gnocchi was mushy and not at all al dente and creamy marinara with meat tasted like beef a roni. atmosphere was cute and service accomodating, but food and beer was definitely lacking authenticity. only saving grace was linda who humored our meager attempts at speaking Italian.
author: lindaven p.

description: I have to say this is the BEST Italian restaurant. The Food is so good, I have never had anything there I didn't like. The atmosphere is so cute and so Italian and the people that work there are always so friendly. I have been coming here for along time...The bar is great also :) So really if you want a nice place to go and enjoy a drink and good food come to Sodini's if I could give it more then a 5 star I would. :) Patty
author: Patty G.

description: A must when you visit or live in SF!  A quaint Italian restaurant in North Beach area.  Great food at reasonable prices. Go early so  you can find parking and don't have to wait too long for a table.
author: Elizabeth B.

description: Last year on my visit to San Francisco we happened on this resturant.  I have a lot of Italian in me and it is one of my favorite foods.  This is absolutely hands down the best I have ever eaten.  Their gnoochi is fantastic and the brushetta... forget about it!  It was so good that we went back on our visit this year not once, but twice.  Believe me, with all of the fantastic places to eat in San Francisco for us to eat there twice was a big deal, but worth every morsel.  Love the food, staff, atmosphere everything.
author: Brenda W.

description: when i first moved to north beach a lot of people (neighborhood locals) recommended sodinis as the best italian in NB. it was good, but i wouldn't go as far as to say its the best... or even close to the best. its a nice little place, but just 'ok' in my book.
author: Michelle I.

description: one of my favorite restaurants EVER!!! food is always good, wine is flowing, and service is top notch.  i have never had a bad meal or a bad time here (and that's saying something since usually i'm here with my mom, uncle and aunt)!
author: Ms. M.

description: I LOVE Sodini's. The food is delicious and prepared from scratch. The reason for only 4 stars: ALWAYS packed, you usually have to wait quite a bit for a seat and once seated you are practically sharing a table with the person next to you. They do not take reservations. Also, most likely because they are always so busy, the host/bartender can be a little bit rude when asked how long the wait is. Mostly locals here, so if tourist bug you, this is a nice escape :)
author: Jes G.

description: It was ok.  Traditional Italian fare with old school ambiance.  Had a good fresh salad, nice chianti and a forgettable linguini.  We sat next to the bathroom and noticed a regular flow of women who appeared to be hanging out in front of the restaurant...wasn't sure what to make of these "regulars".
author: H. E.

description: refreshingly un-hip.  i love this old-school italian restaurant....like the ones you'd go to with your family as a kid.  the waitresses are super nice (Linda - you are a sweetheart!) with big, happy smiles on their faces.  take it from me:  SPLIT whatever you order. we got the special (chicken picatta - and it was divine) - which came with fetticini and a salad.  they split the plates for you - and i'm telling you - it's the perfect size (my male friend agreed).  if you get your own, it's leftover city baby.  sharing is caring....enjoy!
author: Kate F.

description:
First off, this place gets very busy on the weekends and if you plan to go, be prepared to put your name in and wait about an hour to be seated. If you're lucky, less wait time. Go to one of the bars or cafes nearby and grab a glass of wine and just wait out the hour ( check in regularly bc sometimes your name gets called sooner). if its not too cramped, just get a drink at their bar. 

secondly, be on the look out for the host. Its crowded in the front with people waiting to be seated and the occasional couple/group to put their name on the list. Dont stand waiting to be approached, they'll just think you are waiting for your name to be called ( on the busy nights that is). Its a small and busy restaurant and you gotta work with them. The host does look out into the sea of people to see which ones are waiting to get on the list and you gotta make eye contact and nod your head a bit ( just get his or her attention somehow). Kind of like an italian way, lol. Mark ( i think that was his name), took our names the nights i went and he just seems like a really cool and nice guy. My friends and I stepped out to get a class of wine 'cause our wait was an hour and a half. when i went back at about an hour and 20 mins later, my name had already been called and he said it was ok, he'll seat us in 5 mins bc a table was opening up. Anywhere else, im sure i would of been told, too bad, too sad, bye. But mark was great  about it.

The first time i came here it was for my bday and it was fantastic.
Our waitress ( i think her name was linda) was very cool and helped us decide what to get. Throw out some suggestions and see what they recommend out of those suggestions ( i suggest this for anytime you eat out!) I had the lasagna and was very pleased. The calamari, like everyone else, agree that its delicious. Its just one of those great authentic italian restaurants in the neighborhood. Our waitress was attentive and sweet. Talked to us about some stuff and made it a fun experience.
author: Jesse O.

description: This is our local joint with a great atmosphere.  Forget those cookie cutter cow heard italian joints with waiters that use electronic transmitters.  This place is as authentico as it gets.
author: Kevin I.

description: OK this has got to be the best place in North Beach.  Nothing left like this place  that can replace the old Italian restaurants that have totally disappeared from North Beach.  Ana, the bartender, is the heart and soul of North Beach;  an attraction completely overlooked by any and all city reviewers.  Service great, always a crowd, have the calamari-totally unadulterated with foofoo this'n that sauce and best in city.
author: ed h.

description: the seafood linginuninnie ok ok i cant spell. so what u know how to read right? sound it out. hearty portions great service. they make u feel like family. the calamari is a must. very good stuff. and the water has a slice of lemon.. always a plus
author: Mark F.

description: i love this place.  i always get the same thing though- the baked rigatoni dish with red wine.  this is very good for large portions of homey italian food.  i love the ambiance and we always have friendly servers.  the only downside is often having to wait 45 minutes for a table.
author: Kate W.

description: easy on the sauce!  they really pile it on...worse than how they do it at the olive garden.  that said, the sauce wasn't even that tasty. i wouldn't be surprised if it came out of a can. avoid.
author: Allen L.

description: The pizza is amazing! So delicious! Very small cozy restaurant. Service was very great. Bartender is really friendly. Try to get the window seats if there are 2 dining! Overall excellent cozy, family italian restaurant!
author: emily k.

description: A very good homestyle cooking.  The pizza is one of the best and the clams appetizer is a must try.  Good service as well.
author: Mary L.

description: There are certainly quite a few options for Italian dining in North Beach, and Sodini's on Green Street is a perfect choice if you want a tasty dinner featuring huge portions of food and authentic and fresh ingredients, as well as a cozy, dimly-lit ambiance with red and white checkered tablecloths, lots of candles, huge bottles of vinegar and wine for decoration, and Sinatra or Sinatra-esque tunes in the background. The menu features abotu 10 antipasti including gooey and delicious cheese bread and steamers (you can choose clams or mussels) cooked in a white wine broth and served with garlic bread, as well as lots of varieties of pastas with various sauces, meat entrees including a gorgeous Pepper Steak and Chicken Alla Sodini (grilled chicken topped with ham, mozzarella and cream sauce served with linguine alla casa), and lots of pizza options. The wine list is fairly short but certainly covers all the bases. I had a Sauvignon Blanc from Napa which was crisp and tasty. Others had the same as well as a delicious and velvety Valpolicella. We started with the Bruscetta, which is six large and nicely toasted pieces of bread covered with heaping portions of diced tomatoes mixed with garlic, basil and olive oil. The garlic flavor was quite strong but everyone enjoyed the start to the meal. Per usual, I had the Chicken Caesar Salad for my entree. It's probably enough for 2 to 3 hungry folks. Heaps of crisp romaine lettuce are topped with a generous amount of Parmesan cheese and large, moist chunks of grilled chicken breast. The dressing is delicious and I enjoy that there are anchovies in the dressing as it adds that distinct rich and nutty flavor without having the filets directly in the dish. Others had the special of the day, which was Grilled Prawns with Linguini in a pesto sauce, and Tortellini Con Pesto, or beef-filled tortellini in a creamy basil and garlic sauce. The rich, verdant green in the sauces was appealing and the flavors were all delicious. There wasn't much beef in the tortellini but the creamy cheese inside was flavorful and even a bit piquant. All in all a casual and enjoyable meal in a true North Beach institution.
author: Leah B.

description: excellent food. make sure to ask for crayons so that you can doodle on the placemats.
author: Sam Y.

description: After reading reviews on yelp my boyfriend and I decided to try this palce out. It was ok but definitely not as good as I expected after reading the reviews. Also I thought it was wayyyy overpriced. It definitely wasn't a bad meal but I think there are way better places to eat in north beach!
author: Tara T.

description: My husband, brother in law and sister in law ate here the other night while visiting San Francisco.  The food was phenomenal.  My husband and I shared the meat lasagna and a salad.  I had a glass of the Pinot Grigio.  One of the best wines I've ever had.  My brother in law had the stuff gnocchi and my sister in law had the tortellini.  Everything was great.
author: P. L.

description: Cannelloni, spaghetti with marinara, house salad. The cannelloni was fabulous. A little heavy but really wonderful. It had so many different parts - crunchy edge, soft and warm center, lovely sauce and chewy noodle. The spaghetti with marina was not that great - I didn't like the sauce. It had way too much dried oregano. The house salad is huge and lovely.  Want to go back and try the North Beach Style marina and the two vegetarian penne dishes. The pizza's also look great. Service was great and the atmosphere is comfortable. Get a glass of wine and enjoy.
author: Sarah J.

description: I was told this would be a good place for the NY Italian food I missed so much. My test for any Itlaian place is Veal Parm. If they can't get it right, then you can forget about everything else. Like most places in North Beach, this fails. The veal parm is not even breaded. How can you have a veal parm that is not breaded!
author: mark s.

description: Ya tu sabes que es lo que tienen!
author: Manny C.

description: For what it is, it rocks.  Good food, good service, great ambiance, close to home, italian comfort food.  I love the lasagna and the wine is always good.  Love to take friends there or just eat there during the week with my girlfriend.  I would definitely recommend this place to anyone who likes italian food.  The only but, is that they only seat full parties, so make sure everyone is there when you arrive.
author: Your E.

description: wow, so this was one of the first restaurant's i have eaten at in north beach and it was really good. started off with a glass of chianti, how Hannibal Lector of  me. then we proceeded to draw on the paper lined table with crayons that they supply you with, so fun.  we ordered bruschetta as an appetizer , it was delicious but way too much food. we each got huge dinners, two people got the chicken parmigiana and i got the special which was chicken piccata. they were both amazing dishes, each came with a salad and a big side of pasta. mmmm it was so delicious i can still taste it.  it was a bit pricey, but with food that good you don't mind spending about $18 for an entree.
author: Lauren D.

description: Perfect! Well worth the 30 min. wait. The staff is exceptional. The food is outstanding and the Manhatten was the best I ever had.
author: Patrick C.

description: The place is kind of small, which means a long wait in the teeny tiny bar area.  The food was solid (I had a mushroom pizza), though nothing overly exciting.  But the service was great -- our waitress was the perfect mix of business, funny and helpful.
author: GK S.

description:
Went there for dinner with 3 friends and although there were tables vacant, we were told we would have to wait.  No problem.  About 10 minutes later 2 men walked in and were seated immediately.  I asked if we should have made reservations and was told "no".  So we asked why we had to wait.  The response was, "well we only have tables for 2 available" (2 right next to each other by the way).  There was also a table for 6, but apparently only 6 people could sit there.  
As we had to be somewhere by 8p.m., we decided to leave.  As we were leaving the "gentleman" kind of let out an exasperated noise.  I turned to him and said "you know, 2 tables for 2 pushed together equals a table for 4."  His response was, "well I guess we could do it that way, but that's not how we operate here."  Three empty tables in the place, but we had to wait - it doesn't make sense to me.  
I couldn't tell you about the food, but no matter how good it is, served with that kind of attitude, it's hard to choke down.
author: Linda R.

description: Sodini's is a breathe of fresh air with great homestyle Italian food to go along with it.  You can take a date to this restaurant or go with some friends. The service is very friendly. I highly recommend the polenta appetizer...it reminded me of how my grandma used to cook it. Great for locals, great to take visitors to SF!
author: R R.

description: Ate for the second time at Sodini's.  The food is just acceptable, but certainly no better than average and all of it is a cliche of what Americans think is Italian cuisine (I lived in Italy for several months, so I do know a bit about it).  The bread they brought was stale.  The salads were good with fresh lettuces, olives, beans, red onion, croutons (but hey, this is CA where anyplace can make a good salad, and BTW you won't find such salads in Italy).  The chicken Sodini was overcooked, nearly tasteless, and came with a side of linguine marinara that was very bland except for the sharp, bitter flavor from (probably burned) tomatoes.  My friend had chicken parmigiana, which was equally bland, sharp, and bitter There were several wines by the glass both red and white, but all of them were marginal.  At least the server offered tastes, so you could pick the best among a set of sorry choices. The service was friendly, but efficient--they didn't spend much time chatting.  All in all, not a place I'd recommend.  Wish we'd gone elsewhere.
author: Greg W.

description: this place came recommended, the atmosphere and everything was great, maybe i just had too big of expectations.  when you walk in, there is a wonderful garlic aroma, so i thought i was in for a treat.  however, the food did not pack as much of a garlic punch as i thought it would.  the tables are equipped with garlic infused olive oil, but as they likely go through the oil too fast it did not have the flavor infused, also no fresh ground pepper.  there are definitely better ma and pops italian joints in the area
author: Tim G.

description: On a night when we had company in town for their first time in San Francisco, we were in need of finding a place in North Beach that would present an awesome experience as well as decently priced fare. We checked off a few of the more prominent places in a sense of adventure and the desire to find something a little different, and a quick check of yelp via mobile phone led us to Sodini's. The glowing reviews of this place told us this place was "can't miss", and that held up well. We were greeted by Ana, who was gracious and kept us periodically informed of how long our wait would be, and made quite sure we were well hydrated at the bar. The ambiance of the place is nice, albeit a little noisy in the small dining room, and there were what seemed to be quite a few regulars for a Monday night. The three of us at the table managed to get a different type of pasta (meat, seafood, and tortolini), and everyone enjoyed what they had, which was good for us hosts who decided to wing it on showing what good food in North Beach was like.
author: Jared R.

description: Slooooow service!!! We went to Sodini's tonight after a matinee show at the Club Fugazi; I know I read the yelp review and we were going to go to Cafe Sport due to the more popular ratings but when we went by ~ 6:40PM, it was emply  so we headed up the street and found Sodini with a lot of people inside.  The ambience is cozy with a nice bar; the bartender was very accommodating and sat us right away to a table for six although there were only 3 of us. The waitress was friendly and took our order right away.  This is was already 6:45 PM.  It took 45 minutes to get the appetizer which was just a caprese salad and took over an hour for the pasta entree.  The service was extremely slow and it seemed this was the normal pace as the waitress never did once came to apologize for the delay.  We just had pasta dishes was they were not exceptional.  If you want to go and drink tons and don't care about getting served your food, then this place is okay; if not, then you will be starved before you get served!
author: Mei L.
